##------------------URL-------------------------##
http://drzaius.ics.uci.edu/~swirl/impromptu-0.30/xref/edu/uci/isr/impromptu/pie/SlicePeer.html
##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
SlicePeer xref
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
View Javadoc

1   /*
2    * Created on Mar 12, 2005
3    *
4    */
5   package edu.uci.isr.impromptu.pie;
6   
7   import java.awt.Color;
8   import java.awt.Point;
9   import java.io.File;
10  import java.util.ArrayList;
11  import java.util.Collections;
12  import java.util.HashMap;
13  import java.util.Iterator;
14  import java.util.List;
15  import java.util.Map;
16  
17  import javax.jmdns.ServiceInfo;
18  
19  import org.apache.batik.util.SVGConstants;
20  import org.apache.commons.logging.Log;
21  import org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory;
22  import org.w3c.dom.Element;
23  import org.w3c.dom.NodeList;
24  import org.w3c.dom.events.EventTarget;
25  import org.w3c.dom.svg.SVGDocument;
26  
27  import edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common.Peer;
28  import edu.uci.isr.impromptu.security.SecurityConstants;
29  
30  /***
31   * A slice of pie for each peer
32   * 
33   * @author Jie Ren
34   */
35  public class SlicePeer implements Peer {
36      private static Log 		log = LogFactory.getLog(SlicePeer.class);
37      
38      /***
39       * The name of the peer
40       */
41      private		String			name;
42      /***
43       * The owning pie
44       */
45      private		Pie				owner;
46      /***
47       * The document of the pie
48       */
49      private		SVGDocument		document;
50      /***
51       * The number of present peers
52       */
53      private		int				peers;
54      /***
55       * The cardinal position of this pie, from 0 to peers - 1 
56       */
57      private     int				cardinal;
58      /***
59       * Is this peer the local peer for the pie?
60       */
61      private		boolean			isLocal = true;
62      /***
63       * The color for this peer
64       */
65      private		Color			color;
66      /***
67       * The group element for arcs that separate levels 
68       */
69      private 	Element			levels;
70      /***
71       * The separating arcs.
72       */
73      private 	Element[]		arcs = new Element[SecurityConstants.LEVELS];
74      /***
75       * The group for dots of files
76       */
77      private		Element			files;
78      /***
79       * A map that maps a file name to a dot element
80       */
81      private 	Map 			fileDots = Collections.synchronizedMap(new HashMap());
82      /***
83       * The text of the peer name
84       */
85      private 	Element			textElement;
86      /***
87       * The host address of this slice
88       */
89      private		String			hostAddress;
90      /***
91       * The service info of this slice
92       */
93      private 	ServiceInfo		si;
94      /***
95       * Has this slice been created and displayed in the pie?
96       * The concurrency of JmDNS and Batik makes this necessary
97       */
98      private		boolean			createdSVG = false;
99      
100     /***
101      * Create a new peer
102      *  
103      * @param _name			the name of the peer
104      * @param _owner		the owning SVGDocument
105      * @param _peers		the number of present peers
106      * @param _cardinal 	the relative position of this peer
107      * @param _isLocal  	is this peer the local peer?
108      * @param _color    	the color of the peer
109      * @param _hostAddress  the host address for this slice
110      * @param _si 			the service info for this peer
111      * @param doCreation 	whether we should do creation in the constructor
112      */
113     public SlicePeer(String	_name, Pie _owner, int _peers, int _cardinal, 
114             	boolean _isLocal, Color _color, String _hostAddress, ServiceInfo _si, boolean doCreation) {
115         name = _name;
116         owner = _owner;
117         document = owner.getDocument();
118         isLocal = _isLocal;
119         color = _color;
120         hostAddress = _hostAddress;
121         si = _si;
122 
123         peers = _peers;
124         cardinal = _cardinal;
125 
126         if (log==null) {
127         }
128         
129         if (doCreation)
130             create();
131     }
132     
133     /***
134      * The second stage cration. This should be called in Batik updater manager. 
135      */
136     public void create() {
137         doCreate();
138         setPosition(peers, cardinal);
139         createdSVG = true;
140     }
141 
142     private void doCreate() {
143         // This can be enhanced with CSS, XSLT, and XUI...
144         // create the <g> element
145         levels = document.createElementNS(Pie.SVG_NS, SVGConstants.SVG_G_TAG);
146         levels.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_ID_ATTRIBUTE, name);
147 
148         // create an arc for each level
149         for(int i = 0; i < SecurityConstants.LEVELS; i++)
150         {
151             // create <path> for an arc 
152             arcs[i] = document.createElementNS(Pie.SVG_NS, SVGConstants.SVG_PATH_TAG);
153             // the stroke attribute
154             arcs[i].setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.CSS_STROKE_PROPERTY, 
155             					   Configuration.COLOR_STROKE);
156             // the fill attribute
157             String c = Configuration.COLOR_FILL;
158             if(i == 0) {
159                 // This is for the outermost colorful marker
160                 c = PieUtils.getRGBString(color);
161             }
162             arcs[i].setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.CSS_FILL_PROPERTY, c);
163             levels.appendChild(arcs[i]);
164         }
165 
166         // creat text element		
167         textElement = (Element)owner.getTextTemplate().cloneNode(true);
168         // remove the duplicate id
169         textElement.removeAttribute(SVGConstants.SVG_ID_ATTRIBUTE);
170         levels.appendChild(textElement);
171 
172         // Create a group for the files 
173         files = document.createElementNS(Pie.SVG_NS, SVGConstants.SVG_G_TAG);
174         files.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_ID_ATTRIBUTE, getFilesID());
175 
176         owner.getPeersGroup().appendChild(levels);
177         owner.getFilesGroup().appendChild(files);
178 
179         if(isLocal)
180         {
181             // Change the color of the mask layer
182             String c = PieUtils.getRGBString(color);
183             Element localMask = owner.getLocalMask(); 
184         	localMask.setAttribute(SVGConstants.SVG_STYLE_ATTRIBUTE,
185                     "fill:" + c + ";stroke:none;opacity:.3");
186         }
187     }
188     
189     /***
190      * Has this slice been created and displayed in the pie?
191      * @return true if it is created and visisble, false otherwise
192      */
193     public boolean isCreatedSVG() {
194         return createdSVG;
195     }
196     
197     /***
198      * Set the position of this peer, relative to other peers
199      * @param _peers the nubmer of present peers
200      * @param _cardinal the relative position of this peer, in the range from 1 to _peers
201      */
202     public void setPosition(int _peers, int _cardinal)
203     {
204         peers = _peers;
205         cardinal = _cardinal;
206         if (levels==null) {
207             // The SVG content has not been created yet, so just record the position
208             return;
209         }
210         
211         double startAngle = (cardinal - 1) * Configuration.CIRCLE / peers; 
212         double arcAngle = Configuration.CIRCLE / peers;
213         if (peers == 1) // need this trick for a single peer, otherwise nothing is shown
214             arcAngle = Configuration.CIRCLE_ALMOST;
215         
216         // tranform the group
217         String transform = PieUtils.getTranslateAndRotateString(Configuration.CENTER_X,
218                 				Configuration.CENTER_Y, startAngle);
219         levels.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_TRANSFORM_ATTRIBUTE, transform);
220 
221         // the name should be redisplayed
222         displayName();
223         
224         // change path for each ring
225         for(int i = 0; i<SecurityConstants.LEVELS; i++)
226         {
227             // the d attribute
228             String d = PieUtils.calculateDforClosePath(PieUtils.getRadius(i), arcAngle);
229             arcs[i].setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_D_ATTRIBUTE, d);
230         }
231 
232         // change tranform for files
233         PieUtils.setTranslateCenter(files);
234 
235         // change the dots
236         synchronized(fileDots) {
237 	        for(Iterator it = fileDots.values().iterator(); it.hasNext();)
238 	        {
239 	            Dot dot = (Dot)it.next();
240 				dot.updateCardinal(peers, cardinal);
241 	        }
242         }
243 
244         if(isLocal) { // local mask should also change
245         	// paths for arcs have changed
246         	Element clone = (Element)levels.cloneNode(true);
247         	// the replication under local mask should not have a duplicate id
248             clone.removeAttribute(SVGConstants.SVG_ID_ATTRIBUTE);
249             // leave out the outermost colorful ring when masking
250             NodeList nl = clone.getElementsByTagName(SVGConstants.SVG_PATH_TAG);
251             clone.removeChild(nl.item(0));
252             // for other path, don't use its fill or stroke, use localMask's
253             for(int i = 0; i < nl.getLength(); i++) {
254                 Element child = (Element)nl.item(i);
255                 child.removeAttribute(SVGConstants.SVG_FILL_ATTRIBUTE);
256                 child.removeAttribute(SVGConstants.SVG_STROKE_ATTRIBUTE);
257             }
258 
259             // change the local mask
260             Element localMask = owner.getLocalMask(); 
261             NodeList childlist = localMask.getElementsByTagName(SVGConstants.SVG_G_TAG);
262             if(childlist.getLength() > 0){
263             	//suppose there is only g child
264             	localMask.replaceChild(clone, childlist.item(0));
265             }
266             else{
267             	localMask.appendChild(clone);
268             }
269         }
270     }
271     
272     /***
273      * Get the cardinal of this peer
274      * @return cardinal
275      */
276     public int getCardinal() {
277         return cardinal;
278     }
279     
280     /***
281      * Whether an angle is within this slice
282      * @param theta the angle
283      * @return true if the angle is within the slice, false if it is outside
284      */
285     public boolean containsAngle(double theta) {
286         double	sliceSize = Configuration.CIRCLE / peers;
287         return (cardinal - 1) * sliceSize <= theta &&
288         		theta < (cardinal) * sliceSize;
289     }
290     
291     /***
292      * Display the name of this peer
293      *
294      */
295     public void displayName() {
296         // To retain the "old" look & feel, use ring 0, the outmost ring, 
297         // 		thus the name is displayed outside the pie
298         // To minimize the margin outside the pie, use ring 1, thus the name
299         //		is displayed in the colorful marker 
300         //		In this case, should use a default black fill color for fonts
301         //		and the letter "g" will invade the inner rings
302         // Configuration.SIZE_MARGIN_PEER can also be adjusted
303         int		ring = Configuration.getSizeRingPeer();
304         // change the color of the name
305         // if we put the name in the colorful marker (ring==1), then just use the default black
306         if (ring == 0)
307             textElement.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.CSS_FILL_PROPERTY, PieUtils.getRGBString(color));
308 
309         // when number of peers change, the text path would also change
310 	    owner.getTextPath().setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_D_ATTRIBUTE, 
311 	            PieUtils.calculateDforPath(PieUtils.getRadius(ring), peers));
312         // set the text for the name
313         // Since the text path is only hrefed, we must always set the name
314         // so Batik would notice the change and redraw with the new text path
315         textElement.getElementsByTagName(SVGConstants.SVG_TEXT_PATH_TAG).
316     		item(0).getFirstChild().setNodeValue(name);
317     }
318 
319     /***
320      * Clear the display of this peer from the owner's peers group and files group
321      */
322     public void clear() {
323         owner.getPeersGroup().removeChild(levels);
324         owner.getFilesGroup().removeChild(files);
325     }
326 
327     /***
328      * Get the name of this peer, for use in a more human readable manner
329      * @return the name of the peer
330      */
331     public String getName() {
332         return name;
333     }
334     
335     /***
336      * Set color for this peer slice
337      * @param c the color
338      */
339     public void setColor(Color c) {
340         color = c;
341         String	sc = PieUtils.getRGBString(color);
342 
343         // color of the name
344         textElement.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.CSS_FILL_PROPERTY, sc);
345 
346         // color for the outter ring
347         arcs[0].setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.CSS_FILL_PROPERTY, sc);
348 
349         // color for local mask
350         if (isLocal) {
351 	        Element localMask = owner.getLocalMask(); 
352 	    	localMask.setAttribute(SVGConstants.SVG_STYLE_ATTRIBUTE,
353 	                "fill:" + sc + ";stroke:none;opacity:.1");
354         }
355     	
356         // color of the dots
357         synchronized(fileDots) {
358 	        for (Iterator i = fileDots.values().iterator(); i.hasNext();) {
359 	            Dot		d = (Dot)i.next();
360 	            d.setColor(color);
361 	        }
362         }
363     }
364     
365     /***
366      * Update ring colors for a given peer 
367      * @param p the the peer that has changed color
368      * @param c the new color
369      */
370     public void updateRingColor(SlicePeer p, Color c) {
371     	synchronized(fileDots) {
372             for (Iterator i = fileDots.values().iterator(); i.hasNext();) {
373    	            Dot		d = (Dot)i.next();
374    	            SlicePeer lastAccessPeer = d.getLastAccessPeer();
375    	            if (lastAccessPeer != null) {
376    	            	if (lastAccessPeer.equals(p)) {
377    	            		d.setRingColor(c);
378    	            	}
379    	            }
380    	        }         
381         }
382     }
383  
384     /***
385      * Get color of the peer
386      * @return the color
387      */
388     public Color getColor() {
389         return color;
390     }
391     
392     /***
393      * Get the id of the g element that holds the files for this peer
394      * @return an id in the form of "peerName_files"
395      */
396     private String getFilesID() {
397         return name + "_files";
398     }
399 
400     /***
401      * Get whether this peer is the local peer
402      * @return	true if it is a local peer, false if it is a remote peer
403      */
404     public boolean isLocal() {
405         return isLocal;
406     }
407     
408     /***
409      * Add a new file
410      * 
411      * @param file a file from the local file system
412      * @param p the location of the file
413      * @return the Dot. If there was no file with the name, then the dot is a 
414      * newly created dot. Otherwise, it is the existing dot updated with the
415      * new location.
416      */
417     public Dot addFile(File file, Point p)
418     {
419         Dot		result = null;
420         String	fileName = file.getName();
421         if (fileDots.containsKey(fileName)) {
422             result = (Dot)fileDots.get(fileName);
423             result.updateLocation(p);
424         }
425         else {
426 	        result = createFile(file.getName());
427 	        result.setLocalPath(file.getAbsolutePath());
428 	        result.setLocation(p, peers, cardinal);
429         }
430         return result;
431     }
432 
433     /***
434      * Add a new file
435      * @param fileName the name of the file
436      * @param radius the relative radius of the file
437      * @param angle the relative angle of the file
438      * @return the Dot. If there was no file with the name, then the dot is a 
439      * newly created dot. Otherwise, it is the existing dot updated with the
440      * new location.
441      */
442     public Dot addFile(String fileName, double radius, double angle)
443     {
444         Dot		result = null;
445         if (fileDots.containsKey(fileName)) {
446             result = (Dot)fileDots.get(fileName);
447             result.updateLocation(radius, angle);
448         }
449         else {
450 	        result = createFile(fileName);
451 	        result.setLocation(radius, angle, peers, cardinal);
452         }
453         return result;
454     }
455 
456     /***
457      * Move an existing file
458      * @param fileName the name of the file
459      * @param radius the new relative radius of the file
460      * @param angle the new relative angle of the file
461      * @return the Dot if the file is successfully moved, null if there is no such file 
462      */
463     public Dot moveFile(String fileName, double radius, double angle)
464     {
465         if (!fileDots.containsKey(fileName))
466             return null;
467         Dot		dot = (Dot)fileDots.get(fileName);
468         dot.updateLocation(radius, angle);
469         return dot;
470     }
471 
472     /***
473      * Create a dot for a file
474      * @param fileName	the name for the file
475      * @return a Dot that represents the file
476      */
477     public Dot createFile(String fileName) {
478         Dot dot = new Dot(document, fileName, color, this);
479         EventTarget et = (EventTarget)dot.getGroupElement();
480         // These two are for showing and hiding the tool tip
481         et.addEventListener(SVGConstants.SVG_MOUSEOVER_EVENT_TYPE, owner, false);
482         et.addEventListener(SVGConstants.SVG_MOUSEOUT_EVENT_TYPE, owner, false);
483         // for handling click
484         et.addEventListener(SVGConstants.SVG_CLICK_EVENT_TYPE, owner, false);
485         // for handling drag-n-drop
486         et.addEventListener(SVGConstants.SVG_MOUSEDOWN_EVENT_TYPE, owner, false);
487         // Listen for Esc
488         et.addEventListener(SVGConstants.SVG_KEYPRESS_EVENT_TYPE, owner, false);
489 
490         files.appendChild(dot.getGroupElement());
491         fileDots.put(fileName, dot);
492         return dot;
493     }
494     
495     /***
496      * Get a dot element corresponding to a file name 
497      * @param fileName the name of the file
498      * @return the Dot corresponding to this name. null if there is no correspondance.
499      */
500     public Dot getFile(String fileName) {
501         return (Dot)fileDots.get(fileName);
502     }
503 
504     /***
505      * Remove a dot corresponding to a file name 
506      * @param fileName the name of the file
507      */
508     public void removeFile(String fileName) {
509         Dot	d = (Dot)fileDots.get(fileName);
510         files.removeChild(d.getGroupElement());
511         fileDots.remove(fileName);
512     }
513     
514     // Mostly dummy implementation to fit the role of Peer
515     /***
516      * Whether the peer owns a file
517      * @param fileName the name of the file
518      * @return true if the peer owns it, false if it does not own it
519      */
520     public boolean owns(String fileName) {
521         return fileDots.containsKey(fileName);
522     }
523     
524     /***
525      * Get a list of changed files that owned by this local peer
526      * 
527      * @return a list of changed files
528      */
529     public List getChangedFiles() {
530         List	changed = new ArrayList();
531         synchronized(fileDots) {
532 	        for(Iterator	i = fileDots.values().iterator(); i.hasNext();) {
533 	            Dot d = (Dot)i.next();
534 	            if (d.getFileModified()) {
535 	                changed.add(d);
536 	            }
537 	        }
538         }
539         return changed;
540     }
541     
542     /***
543      * Get a list of persistent files
544      * @return a list that contains persistent files for this peer. The
545      * list is empty if this peer has not persistent files.
546      */
547     public List getPersistentFiles() {
548         List 	persistent = new ArrayList();
549         synchronized(fileDots) {
550 	        for(Iterator	i = fileDots.values().iterator(); i.hasNext();) {
551 	            Dot d = (Dot)i.next();
552 	            if (d.getSharingLevel() == SecurityConstants.LEVEL_PERSISTENT) {
553 	                persistent.add(d);
554 	            }
555 	        }
556         }
557         return persistent;
558     }
559 
560     /***
561      * Change the dots' size
562      * @param shrink if true, reduce the size (by 10%). if false, enlarge the size (by 10%)
563      */
564     public void	changeDotSize(boolean shrink) {
565         synchronized(fileDots) {
566 	        for (Iterator i = fileDots.values().iterator(); i.hasNext();) {
567 	            Dot	d = (Dot)i.next();
568 	            d.changeSize(shrink);
569 	        }
570         }
571     }

573     /***
574      * Get the service information received from JmDNS
575      * @return the service inforamtion
576      */
577     public ServiceInfo	getServiceInfo() {
578         return si;
579     }
580     
581     /***
582      * get the host address of the peer
583      * @return the host address of the peer
584      */
585     public String getHostAddress() {
586         return hostAddress;
587     }
588     
589     /***
590      * get the port of the peer
591      * @return the port
592      */
593     public int  getPort() {
594         return -1;
595     }
596 
597     /***
598      * The peer has added a file
599      * 
600      * @param fileName the name of the newly added file
601      * @param radius the relative radius (between 0 and 1) of the newly added file. 
602      * 		This might be null if another application creates the file
603      * @param angle the relative angle (between 0 and 1) of the newly added file.
604      * 		This might be null if another application creates the file
605      * @return true if there was not such a file, false otherwise
606      */
607     public boolean fileAdded(String fileName, double radius, double angle) {
608         boolean 	result = false;
609         if (!fileDots.containsKey(fileName)) {
610             addFile(fileName, radius, angle);
611             result = true;
612         }
613         return result;
614     }
615     
616     /***
617      * The peer has moved a file
618      * 
619      * @param fileName the name of the newly moved file
620      * @param radius the new relative radius (between 0 and 1) of the newly added file
621      * @param angle the new relative angle (between 0 and 1) of the newly added file
622      * @return true if there was not such a file, false otherwise
623      */
624     public boolean fileMoved(String fileName, double radius, double angle) {
625         boolean 	result = false;
626         if (fileDots.containsKey(fileName)) {
627             moveFile(fileName, radius, angle);
628             result = true;
629         }
630         return result;
631     }
632     
633     /***
634      * The peer has removed a file
635      * 
636      * @param fileName the name of the newly removed file
637      * @return true if there was a file, false otherwise
638      */
639     public boolean fileRemoved(String fileName) {
640         boolean 	result = false;
641         if (fileDots.containsKey(fileName)) {
642             removeFile(fileName);
643             result = true;
644         }
645         return result;
646     }
647 }

This page was automatically generated by Maven
##------------------URL-------------------------##
http://drzaius.ics.uci.edu/~swirl/impromptu-0.30/xref/edu/uci/isr/impromptu/security/LevelHandler.html
##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
LevelHandler xref
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
View Javadoc

1   /*
2    * Created on Apr 9, 2005
3    *
4    */
5   package edu.uci.isr.impromptu.security;
6   
7   import java.util.HashMap;
8   import java.util.Iterator;
9   import java.util.Map;
10  
11  import org.mortbay.http.HttpContext;
12  import org.mortbay.http.HttpRequest;
13  import org.mortbay.http.HttpResponse;
14  import org.mortbay.http.SecurityConstraint;
15  import org.mortbay.http.handler.AbstractHttpHandler;
16  
17  import edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common.Configuration;
18  import edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common.Utils;
19  
20  /***
21   * Use Jetty's mechanisms to set allowed methods.
22   * This class is called during handling of "add/remove file" messages.
23   * Need this extra event commuinication channel to configure HTTP.
24   * For Slide security issues (WebDAV ACL), Slide allows a proprietary method
25   * for creating users, and WebDAV ACL method is the standard to set ACL. 
26   *  
27   * @author Jie Ren
28   */
29  public class LevelHandler extends AbstractHttpHandler
30  {
31      // This needs to be a handler so it can get Jetty's httpContext, 
32      //	on which to call the addSecurityConstraint
33  
34      /***
35       * The attribute name of the Jetty Security Handler
36       */
37      public static final String ATTRIBUTE_NAME = 
38          "edu.uci.isr.impromptu.security.LevelHandler";
39      /***
40       * The attribute name of the Jetty Server, used for shutdown
41       */
42      public static final String JETTY_NAME = 
43          "edu.uci.isr.impromptu.security.JettyServer";
44      
45      // the sharing level of each file
46      private HashMap levels = new HashMap();
47      // The Jetty context to which security constraints are applied
48      private	HttpContext	context;
49      // These maps maintain all the constraints that should be dynamically applied to Jetty
50      // The maps are added when setSecurityLevel is called
51      // The maps must maintain all constraints because Jetty does not provide a mechanism 
52      //		for us to change or remove security constraints, only add and clear constraints
53      // The maps are used to construct Jetty-compatible security constraints
54      // Allowed methods for legitimate authenticated users
55      private Map			allowedMethods = new HashMap();
56      // Denied methods that no authenticated user can access 
57      private Map			deniedMethods = new HashMap();
58      // a more static security constraint, granting all methods to "me" on every resource
59      private SecurityConstraint grantAllToMe = new SecurityConstraint("grantAllToMe", SecurityConstants.ME);
60  
61      /***
62       * Constrct a security handler
63       */
64      public LevelHandler()
65      {
66      }
67  
68      /***
69       * Initialize the handler. Set security on the top level.
70       * 
71       * @param context the context of the web application
72       */
73      public void initialize(HttpContext context) {
74          // Must call super
75          super.initialize(context);
76  
77          // Must use this context to setAttribute, otherwise deadlock.
78          this.context = context;
79          context.setAttribute(ATTRIBUTE_NAME, this);
80          context.setAttribute(JETTY_NAME, context.getHttpServer());
81          context.setAttribute(SlideUserRealm.ATTRIBUTE_NAME, context.getRealm());
82          // grant all to me (used for everything)
83          grantAllToMe.setAuthenticate(true);
84          for(int i = 0; i < SecurityConstants.LEVELS_METHODS.length; ++i) {
85              String[] methods = SecurityConstants.LEVELS_METHODS[i];
86              for(int j = 0; j < methods.length; ++j) {
87                  grantAllToMe.addMethod(methods[j]);
88              }
89          }
90          // Do not set security on "/". Windows Redirector issues an OPTIONS first, and 
91          //		if it receives a 401, it does not send username/password to authenticate.  
92          // setSecurityLevelForOthersOnRealPath("/", SecurityConstants.LEVEL_READ_ONLY);
93          // here is the default security settings on "/files". 
94          // Every other files is separately set, thus no general unsecure settings.
95          setSecurityLevelForOthersOnRealPath(Configuration.FILES_PATH, 
96                  SecurityConstants.LEVEL_READ_ONLY);
97          setSecurityLevelForOthersOnRealPath(Configuration.FILES_PATH_WITHOUT_TRAILING, 
98                  SecurityConstants.LEVEL_READ_ONLY);
99      }
100     
101     /***
102      * Set the security level of a file for the role "others". Also allow "me" 
103      * 	to do anything. 
104      * There are two roles, by design. One is "me", the other is "others".
105      * "Me" can do anything. "Others" is subject to security constraints set by "me".
106      * 
107      * This is a policy method which uses the Jetty security constraints mechanism.
108      * That mechanism prevents setting me statically because it does not provide
109      * a way to retrieve and update security constraints. It only allows "add" and "clear".
110      *  
111      * @param fileName	the name of the file
112      * @param level	the sharing level. If the level is -1, it is not even in the private space.
113      */
114     public void setSecurityLevelForOthers(String fileName, int level) {
115         String	securityLevel = SecurityConstants.LEVELS_NAME_EXISTENCE;
116         if (level>SecurityConstants.LEVEL_EXISTENCE)
117             securityLevel = SecurityConstants.LEVELS_NAME[level];
118         levels.put(fileName, securityLevel);
119         String	realPath = Utils.fileNameToContextPath(fileName); 
120         setSecurityLevelForOthersOnRealPath(realPath, level);
121     }
122     
123     /***
124      * Set the security level of a URL path for the role "others". Also allow "me" 
125      * 	to do anything. 
126      * There are two roles, by design. One is "me", the other is "others".
127      * "Me" can do anything. "Others" is subject to security constraints set by "me".
128      * 
129      * This is a policy method which uses the Jetty security constraints mechanism.
130      * That mechanism prevents setting me statically because it does not provide
131      * a way to retrieve and update security constraints. It only allows "add" and "clear".
132      *  
133      * @param realPath	the full path, within the context of the Slide servlet
134      * @param level	the sharing level. If the level is -1, it is not even in the private space.
135      */
136     private void setSecurityLevelForOthersOnRealPath(String realPath, int level) {
137         // Add a new security constraint to grant allowed methods
138         SecurityConstraint	granted = new SecurityConstraint();
139         granted.setName("Allow" + realPath); 
140         granted.setAuthenticate(true);
141         granted.addRole(SecurityConstants.OTHERS);
142         for(int i = 0; i <= level; ++i) {
143             String[] methods = SecurityConstants.LEVELS_METHODS[i];
144             for(int j = 0; j < methods.length; ++j) {
145                 granted.addMethod(methods[j]);
146             }
147         }
148 
149         // Add a new security constraint to deny disallowed methods
150         // Only ROLE_NOBODY has access to these methods
151         // essentially gives nobody access to these methods
152         // Cannot ignore the constraint, otherwise it is unconstrained
153         //		and everybody can access it.
154         // Cannot use an empty role either, because it will deny EVERYBODY
155         //		access to the resource
156         SecurityConstraint	denied = new SecurityConstraint();
157         denied.setName("Deny" + realPath);
158         denied.setAuthenticate(true);
159         denied.addRole(SlideUserRealm.ROLE_NOBODY);
160         for(int i = level + 1; i < SecurityConstants.LEVELS_METHODS.length; ++i)
161         {
162             String[] methods = SecurityConstants.LEVELS_METHODS[i];
163             for(int j = 0; j < methods.length; ++j)
164             {
165                 denied.addMethod(methods[j]);
166             }
167         }
168         
169         if (!allowedMethods.containsKey(realPath)) {
170             // This is the first time the realPath is constrained
171             // do our own recording
172             allowedMethods.put(realPath, granted);
173             deniedMethods.put(realPath, denied);
174             // tell Jetty the new constraints
175             // For a malformed url "//files", Jetty will not challenge it since it 
176             // does not match any settings, and Jetty will pass it as unauthenticated.
177             // It is Slide's unauthenticated/denial settings that prevents leaking  
178             // Once something is created, it is set for very limited access for OTHERS
179 	        context.addSecurityConstraint(realPath, grantAllToMe);
180 	        // if a constraint with empty methods list is added, then ANY method 
181 	        //		will be allowed, which is not what we want
182 	        if (granted.getMethods() != null)
183 	            context.addSecurityConstraint(realPath, granted);
184 	        if (denied.getMethods() != null)
185 	            context.addSecurityConstraint(realPath, denied);
186         }
187         else {
188             // We have touched realPath before
189             if (allowedMethods.containsValue(granted) &&
190                 deniedMethods.containsValue(denied)) {
191                 // the new constraints are the same as the old ones, 
192                 // nothing we need to do
193             }
194             else {
195                 // The security constraints changed for this realPath
196                 // Since Jetty does not give us the power to change its security constraints
197                 //		we have to reset the whole thing
198                 // replace the old ones
199                 allowedMethods.put(realPath, granted);
200                 deniedMethods.put(realPath, denied);
201                 
202                 // reset
203                 context.clearSecurityConstraints();
204                 // no more "/*", as it is "bad" security practice,
205                 // also it comes BEFORE "/" and interferes exact-match setting on "/"
206                 
207                 Iterator	i = allowedMethods.keySet().iterator();
208                 while (i.hasNext()) {
209                     // The pathSpecification exists in both maps 
210                     String	pathSpec = (String)i.next();
211                     SecurityConstraint	allowedSc = (SecurityConstraint)allowedMethods.get(pathSpec);
212                     SecurityConstraint	deniedSc = (SecurityConstraint)deniedMethods.get(pathSpec);
213                     context.addSecurityConstraint(pathSpec, grantAllToMe);
214                     if (allowedSc.getMethods() != null)
215                         context.addSecurityConstraint(pathSpec, allowedSc);
216                     if (deniedSc.getMethods() != null)
217                         context.addSecurityConstraint(pathSpec, deniedSc);
218                 }
219             }
220         }
221     }
222 
223     /***
224      * Get the security level of a file to a role
225      * @param path	the file path
226      * @param role	the role to which the file is secured
227      * @return the sharing level of the file
228      */
229     public String getSecurityLevel(String path, String role)
230     {
231         return (String)levels.get(path + role);
232     }
233 
234     /***
235      * Dumy handle method
236      */
237     public void handle(java.lang.String pathInContext,
238             java.lang.String pathParams, HttpRequest request,
239             HttpResponse response) {
240         if(pathInContext!=pathParams);
241         if(request!=null);
242         if(response!=null);
243     }
244 }

This page was automatically generated by Maven
##------------------URL-------------------------##
http://drzaius.ics.uci.edu/~swirl/impromptu-0.30/xref/edu/uci/isr/impromptu/repository/CharResponseWrapper.html
##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
CharResponseWrapper xref
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
View Javadoc

1   /*
2    * Created on Feb 28, 2005
3    *
4    */
5   package edu.uci.isr.impromptu.repository;
6   
7   import java.io.CharArrayWriter;
8   import java.io.PrintWriter;
9   
10  import javax.servlet.ServletOutputStream;
11  import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse;
12  
13  import org.apache.slide.webdav.logger.StatusHttpServletResponseWrapper;
14  
15  /***
16   * CharResponseWrapper wrapps the response of a servlet for a filter
17   * 		Impromptu {@link ProxyFilter} uses it to find whether the resource is not
18   * 		available locally and should be fetched from a remote repository
19   * Most code is copied from other sources. This class should be part of the standard.
20   * This might not be used if we choose to filter the request instead of the response 
21   *
22   * @author Jie Ren
23   */
24  public class CharResponseWrapper extends StatusHttpServletResponseWrapper {
25  	private CharArrayWriter output;
26  
27  	public CharResponseWrapper(HttpServletResponse response){
28  	    super(response);
29  	    output = new CharArrayWriter();
30  	}
31  
32  	// override both getWriter and getOutputStream
33  	public PrintWriter getWriter(){
34  	    return new PrintWriter(output);
35  	}
36  
37      public ServletOutputStream getOutputStream(){
38  	    return new MyServletOutputStream(output);
39  	}
40  	 
41  	class MyServletOutputStream extends ServletOutputStream{
42  	    CharArrayWriter buffer;
43  	 
44  	    public MyServletOutputStream(CharArrayWriter aCharArrayWriter){
45  	        super();
46  	        buffer = aCharArrayWriter;
47  		}
48  	 
49  		public void write(int aInt){
50  		    buffer.write(aInt);
51  		}
52  	}
53  
54  	public String toString() {
55  	    return output.toString();
56  	}
57  
58  	// super.xxx calls in StatusHttpServletResponse allows smooth filter integration with Slide
59  	// Here must not call super.sendError 
60  	// otherwise the container will directly send the error page back to the client
61  	// before the filter can do its trick
62      public void sendError( int sc ) {
63          setStatus(sc);
64      }
65  
66      public void sendError( int sc, String msg ) {
67          setStatus(sc, msg);
68      }
69  }

5   package edu.uci.isr.impromptu.security;
6   
7   /***
8    * Constants for security
9    * 
10   * @author Jie Ren
11   */
12  public class SecurityConstants {
13      /***
14       * The sharing levels
15       */
16      public static final int 	LEVELS = 4;
17      /***
18       * Files that only the local peer can see from a local PROPFIND
19       */
20      public static final int	LEVEL_EXISTENCE 	= -1;
21      /***
22       * Files that only the local peer can see in the pie
23       */
24      public static final int	LEVEL_PRIVATE 		= 0;
25      /***
26       * Files that others can only see [PROPFIND]
27       */
28      public static final int	LEVEL_SEE_ONLY		= 1;
29      /***
30       * Files that others can read [GET]
31       */
32      public static final int	LEVEL_READ_ONLY 	= 2;
33      /***
34       * Files that others can change [PUT, PROPPATCH]
35       */
36      public static final int	LEVEL_READ_WRITE	= 3;
37      /***
38       * Files that can be stored on others 
39       */
40      public static final int	LEVEL_PERSISTENT	= 4;
41      /***
42       * The name for each level
43       */
44      public static final String	LEVELS_NAME[] = {
45              "PRIVATE", "SEE_ONLY", "READ_ONLY", "READ_WRITE", "PERSISTENT"
46      };
47      /***
48       * The name for the existence level
49       */
50      public static final String	LEVELS_NAME_EXISTENCE = "EXISTENCE";
51      /***
52       * The description for each level
53       */
54      public static final String	LEVELS_DESCRIPTION[] = {
55              "Only this peer can manipulate this file.",
56              "Other peers can see this file but cannot get its content.",
57              "Other peers can only read this file.",
58              "Other peers can also change this file.",
59              "This file will remain available even this peer quits."
60      };
61      /***
62       * Allowed HTTP methods for hidden files
63       */
64      public static final String[] HIDDEN_METHODS = {};
65      /***
66       * Allowed HTTP methods for see-only files
67       */
68      public static final String[] SEE_ONLY_METHODS = 
69                                                      {	
70                                                          "REPORT", "PROPFIND",
71                                                          "SEARCH", "HEAD",
72                                                          "OPTIONS"
73                                                      };
74      /***
75       * Allowed HTTP methods for read-only files
76       */
77      public static final String[] READ_ONLY_METHODS = {"GET"};
78      /***
79       * Allowed HTTP methods for read/write files
80       */
81      //  We do not allow MKCOL, and Mac seems resilient when it receives a 403 for this
82      public static final String[] READ_WRITE_COPY_METHODS = 
83                                                             {
84                                                                 "PROPPATCH",
85                                                                 "COPY", "DELETE",
86                                                                 "POST", "PUT",
87                                                                 "LOCK", "UNLOCK",
88                                                                 "MOVE", "ACL",
89                                                                 "UNBIND", "TRACE",
90                                                                 "BIND", "CONNECT",
91                                                                 "REBIND",
92                                                             };
93      /***
94       * Allowed HTTP methods for persistent files
95       */
96      public static final String[] PERSISTENT_METHODS = {};
97      /***
98       * Allowed HTTP methods for files of different sharing degrees.
99       * Each level adds more methods in addition to methods of lower levels.
100      */
101     public static final String[][] LEVELS_METHODS = 
102                                                     {
103                                                         HIDDEN_METHODS,
104                                                         SEE_ONLY_METHODS,
105                                                         READ_ONLY_METHODS,
106                                                         READ_WRITE_COPY_METHODS,
107                                                         PERSISTENT_METHODS
108                                                     };
109

111      * Allowed WebDAV permissions for hidden files 
112      */
113     public static final String[] HIDDEN_PERMISSIONS = {};
114     /*** 
115      * Allowed WebDAV permissions for see-only files 
116      */
117     public static final String[] SEE_ONLY_PERMISSIONS = {
118             	"read-acl",
119             	"read-current-user-privilege-set"
120             }; 
121     /***

125             	"read"

147      */

159      */

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
RootServlet xref
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
View Javadoc

1   /*
2    * Created on Mar 5, 2005
3    *
4    */
5   package edu.uci.isr.impromptu.repository;
6   
7   import java.io.IOException;
8   import java.io.PrintWriter;
9   
10  import javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet;
11  import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest;
12  import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse;
13  
14  /***
15   * This servlet, if used, is to report DAV support at the "/" level of a server
16   */ 
17  public class RootServlet extends HttpServlet
18  {
19      protected void doOptions(HttpServletRequest req, HttpServletResponse resp) {
20          if(req!=resp);
21  		resp.setHeader("MS-Author-Via", "MS-FP/4.0,DAV");
22  		resp.setHeader("DASL", "<DAV:sql>");
23  		resp.setHeader("DAV", "1, 2");
24  		resp.setHeader("Public", "OPTIONS, TRACE, GET, HEAD, DELETE, PUT, POST, COPY, MOVE, MKCOL, PROPFIND, PROPPATCH, LOCK, UNLOCK, SEARCH");
25  		resp.setHeader("Allow", "OPTIONS, TRACE, GET, HEAD, COPY, PROPFIND, SEARCH, LOCK, UNLOCK");
26  		resp.setHeader("Cache-Control", "private");
27      }
28  
29      protected void doGet(HttpServletRequest req, HttpServletResponse resp) 
30              throws IOException {
31          if(req!=resp);
32  		resp.setContentType("text/html");
33  		PrintWriter out = resp.getWriter();
34  		out.println("<html><head><title>Dummy</title></head><body>This is to support Windows XP WebDAV Redirector</body></html>");
35  		out.close();
36     }
37  }

Dot xref

View Javadoc

1   /*
2    * Created on Mar 12, 2005
3    *
4    */
5   package edu.uci.isr.impromptu.pie;
6   
7   import java.awt.Color;
8   import java.awt.Point;
9   
10  import org.apache.batik.util.SVGConstants;
11  import org.w3c.dom.Element;
12  import org.w3c.dom.Text;
13  import org.w3c.dom.events.Event;
14  import org.w3c.dom.events.EventListener;
15  import org.w3c.dom.svg.SVGDocument;
16  
17  import edu.uci.isr.impromptu.security.SecurityConstants;
18  
19  /***
20   * A dot, for a file. Adapted from Ben Pillet's code.
21   * 
22   * Its coordinate is described by both a relative radius and relative dot.
23   *
24   * The radius tells how far the dot is relative to the center of the pie. 
25   * A 0 is at the center, a value less than 1 is within the pie (and shared),
26   * and a value larger than 1 is within the private space (thus not shared).
27   * Such a relative radius allows different peers have different dimensions.
28   * 
29   * The angle tells where within the slice the dot lies. So when peers join 
30   * and leave the dot can remain in a "stable" position.
31   * 
32   * These properties are also stored in the repository for future use. 
33   * 
34   * @author Jie Ren
35   */
36  public class Dot implements EventListener  
37  {
38      // The owning document
39      private SVGDocument 		document;
40      // The group element that represents the whole dot
41      private Element				group;
42      // The radius of the dot circle
43      private double 				dotRadius;
44      // The stroke width of the highlight circle
45      private String				oldStrokeWidth;
46      // The element of the circle 
47      private Element 			fileDot;
48      // The element for the file name
49      private Text 				fileName;
50      // The file name for this dot
51      private String				name;
52      // The local file path for the dot. Only set for dots in the local slice peer.
53      private String				localPath = null;
54      // The color of the dot
55      private Color				dotColor;
56      // The color of the outer ring of the dot. Set when the file is accessed by others.
57      private Color				ringColor = null;  
58      // The last peer to access this file
59      //   we need to keep track of this so that we can update dot colors when a peer changes color
60      //   it is not enough to know the old color in the rare case where two peers can have the same color
61      private SlicePeer			lastAccessPeer = null;
62      //  The sharing level
63      private int 				sharingLevel = SecurityConstants.LEVEL_PRIVATE;
64      // The coordinate of this dot in the pie
65      // Keep the Coordinate class as is (using an absolute radius), 
66      // but the dot only uses relative radius and relative angle
67      private Coordinate 			location;
68      private SlicePeer			owner;
69      
70      /***
71       * Create a new dot
72       * 
73       * @param _document			the owning document
74       * @param _fileName			the file name of the dot
75       * @param _uColor			the color of the dot
76       * @param _owner			the owner peer
77       */
78      public Dot(SVGDocument _document, String _fileName, Color _uColor, SlicePeer _owner)
79      {
80          document = _document;
81          owner = _owner;
82  
83          // use the dual-purpose template to create a new dot 
84          group = (Element)document.getElementById(Pie.ID_DRAGGING_DELEGATE).cloneNode(true);
85          fileDot = (Element)group.getElementsByTagName(SVGConstants.SVG_CIRCLE_TAG).item(0);
86          // Let ourself handle the two mouse events, 
87          // 		instead of JavaScript, so we can save storage space for Batik's js.jar
88          // All right, let the owner pie handle these events so no duplicate processing
89          //((AbstractNode)fileDot).addEventListener(SVGConstants.SVG_MOUSEOVER_EVENT_TYPE,
90          //        this, false);
91          //((AbstractNode)fileDot).addEventListener(SVGConstants.SVG_MOUSEOUT_EVENT_TYPE,
92          //        this, false);
93          //fileDot.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_FILTER_ATTRIBUTE, FILTER);
94          fileDot.removeAttribute(SVGConstants.SVG_ID_ATTRIBUTE);
95          // get the template stroke width for later mouse over restoration
96          oldStrokeWidth = fileDot.getAttribute(SVGConstants.SVG_STROKE_WIDTH_ATTRIBUTE);
97          // For normal display, no stroke
98          fileDot.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_STROKE_WIDTH_ATTRIBUTE, Configuration.SIZE_STROKE_WIDTH);
99          Element fileLabel = (Element)group.getElementsByTagName(SVGConstants.SVG_TEXT_TAG).item(0);
100         fileLabel.removeAttribute(SVGConstants.SVG_ID_ATTRIBUTE);
101         fileName = (Text)fileLabel.getFirstChild();
102 
103         setFileName(_fileName);
104         setColor(_uColor);
105         dotRadius = Integer.parseInt(fileDot.getAttribute(SVGConstants.SVG_R_ATTRIBUTE));
106         setSize(dotRadius);
107         
108         group.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_STYLE_ATTRIBUTE, Pie.VISIBILITY_VISIBLE);
109     }
110     
111     /***
112      * Get the owner peer
113      * @return the owner peer
114      */
115     public SlicePeer getOwner() {
116         return owner;
117     }
118     
119     /***
120      * Get the last peer to access the file represented by this dot
121      * @return the last peer to access the dot
122      */
123     public SlicePeer getLastAccessPeer() {
124         return lastAccessPeer;
125     }
126 
127     /***
128      * Set the new file name for the dot
129      * @param _fileName the new file name
130      */
131     public void setFileName(String _fileName)
132     {
133         name = _fileName;
134         group.setAttribute(SVGConstants.SVG_ID_ATTRIBUTE, name);
135         fileName.setData(name);
136     }
137 
138     /***
139      * Get the file name for this dot
140      * @return the file name
141      */
142     public String getFileName() {
143         return name;
144     }
145 
146     /***
147      * Set the local file path for this dot
148      * @param _localPath the local file path
149      */
150     public void setLocalPath(String _localPath) {
151         localPath = _localPath;
152     }
153     
154     /***
155      * Get the local file path for this dot 
156      * @return the local file path. Null if this dot belongs to a remote peer
157      */
158     public String getLocalPath() {
159         return localPath;
160     }
161 
162     /***
163      * Open the file represented by the dot, from the proxy
164      */
165     public void openFile()
166     {
167         Platform.openFile(name);
168     }
169 
170     /***
171      * Delete the file represented by the dot, from the proxy
172      */
173     public void deleteFile()
174     {
175         Platform.deleteFile(name);
176     }
177 
178     // Set when a message is received that this dot's file is modified.
179     // Used as a secondary indicator since the file system has a delay in 
180     //		getting the latest modification time
181     private boolean	fileModified = false;
182     /***
183      * Save the file in the repository back to where it was before it was imported
184      *
185      */
186     public void saveFile() {
187         Platform.exportFile(name, localPath);
188         fileModified = false;
189     }
190     
191     /***
192      * Get whether the dot's file has been modifiled.
193      * 
194      * @return true if it is modified, false if not. Always false for non local dots.
195      */
196     public boolean getFileModified() {
197         boolean	result = false;
198         if (localPath != null) {
199             // Only on Windows this isNewer is trustworthy. Mac would always return true. 
200 	        result = Platform.isNewer(Platform.getDestinationPrefix() + name, localPath);
201 	        // The file system driver does not immediately return the  
202 	        // current modification time, so we use fileModified as a secondary 
203 	        // indicator. 
204             if (!result) 
205                 result = fileModified;
206         }
207         return result;
208     }
209     
210     /***
211      * Mark that the dot's file has been modified. Only change local dots.
212      */
213     public void setFileModified() {
214         if (localPath != null)
215             fileModified = true;
216     }
217     
218     /***
219      * Set the color for the dot
220      * @param uColor the new color
221      */
222     public void setColor(Color uColor)
223     {
224         dotColor = uColor;
225         fileDot.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.CSS_FILL_PROPERTY, PieUtils.getRGBString(dotColor));
226     }
227 
228     /***
229      * Set the color for the outter ring of the dot
230      * @param rColor the new color of the ring
231      */
232     public void setRingColor(Color rColor)
233     {
234         ringColor = rColor;
235         fileDot.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.CSS_STROKE_PROPERTY, PieUtils.getRGBString(ringColor));
236         if (!ringColor.equals(dotColor)) {
237             // if this is a different color than the dot color, show it 
238 	        fileDot.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_STROKE_WIDTH_ATTRIBUTE, oldStrokeWidth);
239         }
240     }
241     
242     /***
243      * Set the peer that last accessed the dot
244      * @param lastPeer the last peer to access the dot
245      */
246     public void setLastAccessPeer(SlicePeer lastPeer)
247     {
248         lastAccessPeer = lastPeer;
249     }
250 
251     /***
252      * Set the new size for the dot circle
253      * @param dotSize the new size
254      */
255 	public void setSize(double dotSize) {
256 		dotRadius = dotSize;
257 		fileDot.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_R_ATTRIBUTE, String.valueOf(dotSize));
258 	}
259 	
260 	/***
261 	 * Get the size for the dot circle
262 	 * @return the size for the dot
263 	 */
264 	public double getSize() {
265 	    return dotRadius;
266 	}
267 
268     /***
269      * Change the dots' size
270      * @param shrink if true, reduce the size (by 10%). if false, enlarge the size (by 10%)
271      */
272 	public void changeSize(boolean shrink) {
273 	    double	newDotRadius = 0;
274 	    if (shrink)
275 		    newDotRadius = dotRadius * 9 / 10;
276 	    else
277 	        newDotRadius = dotRadius * 11 / 10;
278 	    setSize(newDotRadius);
279 	}
280 	
281     /***
282      * Get the top level g element
283      * @return the top g element
284      */
285     public Element getGroupElement() {
286         return group;
287     }
288     
289     /***
290      * Get the circle element
291      * @return the circle element
292      */
293     public Element getCircleElement() {
294         return fileDot; 
295     }
296 
297     /***
298      * Highlight the dot
299      * @param highlight true to turn on the highlight, false to turn off highlight
300      */
301     public void highlightDot(boolean highlight)
302     {
303         group.getAttributes().getNamedItem(SVGConstants.CSS_OPACITY_PROPERTY).setNodeValue(
304                 highlight ? "1" : "0");
305     }
306 
307     private boolean showSelection = false;
308     /***
309      * Select the dot 
310      */
311     public void select() {
312         // Just changing the dot color can be confusing if there are other 
313         //	people choosing similar colors. Can probably use an opacity filter filter. 
314         if (showSelection)
315             fileDot.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.CSS_FILL_PROPERTY, Configuration.COLOR_SELECTED);
316     }
317 
318     /***
319      * Deselect the dot
320      */
321     public void deselect() {
322         fileDot.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.CSS_FILL_PROPERTY, PieUtils.getRGBString(dotColor));
323     }
324 
325     /***
326      * Tick count for blinking 
327      */
328     private int blinkCount = 0;
329 
330     // blink functions should be synchronized
331     /***
332      *	start counting for blink 
333      */
334     public synchronized void startBlink(int blinkLength) {
335         blinkCount = blinkLength;
336     }
337     
338     /***
339      * Blink the dot by setting its stroke width on and off
340      */
341     public synchronized void blink() {
342         int		trick;
343         if (ringColor==null) {
344             // blinking should stop at no ring
345             trick = 0;
346         }
347         else {
348             trick = 1;
349         }
350         if (blinkCount % 2 == trick) {
351 	        fileDot.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_STROKE_WIDTH_ATTRIBUTE, oldStrokeWidth);
352         }
353         else {
354 	        fileDot.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_STROKE_WIDTH_ATTRIBUTE, Configuration.SIZE_STROKE_WIDTH);
355         }
356         // After blinkCount--, if it is 0, then blinking stops. When there is a ring 
357         //	color, we want blinking to stop at a width. 
358         blinkCount--;
359     }
360     
361     /***
362      * Whether blink has finished
363      * @return true if blink has finished
364      */
365     public synchronized boolean blinked() {
366         // defensive, in case blinkCount drops below 0
367         return blinkCount<=0;
368     }
369     
370     /***
371      * Handle mouse over and mouse out events
372      */
373     public void handleEvent(Event evt) {
374         String		eventType = evt.getType();
375 
376         if (ringColor==null) {
377     	    // If we have no different ring, then when mouse is out we reduce the ring to no width.
378 			if (eventType.equals(SVGConstants.SVG_MOUSEOVER_EVENT_TYPE)) {
379 		        fileDot.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_STROKE_WIDTH_ATTRIBUTE, oldStrokeWidth);
380 			}
381 			else if (eventType.equals(SVGConstants.SVG_MOUSEOUT_EVENT_TYPE)){
382 		        fileDot.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_STROKE_WIDTH_ATTRIBUTE, Configuration.SIZE_STROKE_WIDTH);
383 			}
384         }
385         else {
386     	    // If we have a different colored ring, leave it when the mosue is out.
387 			if (eventType.equals(SVGConstants.SVG_MOUSEOVER_EVENT_TYPE)) {
388 		        fileDot.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_STROKE_WIDTH_ATTRIBUTE, Configuration.SIZE_STROKE_WIDTH);
389 			}
390 			else if (eventType.equals(SVGConstants.SVG_MOUSEOUT_EVENT_TYPE)){
391 		        fileDot.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_STROKE_WIDTH_ATTRIBUTE, oldStrokeWidth);
392 			}
393         }
394     }
395 
396     /***
397      * Set the location of this dot, with relative coordiante
398      * This is supposed to be used to add files from other peers.
399      * The radius and angle are all relative values. 
400      * @param radius		the relative radius. 0 is the center, less than 1 
401      * 							is within the pie, larger than 1 is private  
402      * @param angle 		the relative angle among the slice between 0 and 1
403      * @param peers			the number of present peers
404      * @param cardinal		the relative position of this peer
405      */
406     public void setLocation(double radius, double angle, int peers, int cardinal) {
407     	location = new Coordinate(adjustRadius(radius) * Configuration.RADIUS, angle, peers, cardinal);
408     	setLocationAttribute();
409     }
410 
411     /***
412      * Set the location of this dot, with absolute coordiante
413      * This is used to support dropping a file by a local peer.
414      * @param p 			the x,y coordinate
415      * @param peers			the number of present peers
416      * @param cardinal		the relative position of this peer
417      */
418     public void setLocation(Point p, int peers, int cardinal) {
419     	location = new Coordinate(adjustPoint(p), peers, cardinal);
420     	setLocationAttribute();
421     }
422 
423     /***
424      * Set the transform string of the top level group 
425      * with the x and y of the coordinate
426      */
427 	private void setLocationAttribute() {
428         Point point = location.getAbsolutePoint();
429     	group.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_TRANSFORM_ATTRIBUTE,
430                        PieUtils.getTranslateString(point.getX(), point.getY()));
431     }
432 
433 	/***
434 	 * Update the coordinate of the dot with an absolute coordiante
435 	 * Should be called after a setLocaion method
436 	 * @param p		the new absolute point
437 	 */
438 	public void updateLocation(Point p) {
439 		location.updateCoordinate(adjustPoint(p));
440 		setLocationAttribute();
441 	}
442 
443 	/***
444 	 * Update the coordinate of the dot with relative coordiante
445 	 * Should be called after a setLocaion method
446 	 * @param radius		the new relative radius
447 	 * @param angle			the new relative angle
448 	 */
449 	public void updateLocation(double radius, double angle) {
450 		location.updateCoordinate(adjustRadius(radius) * Configuration.RADIUS, angle);
451 		setLocationAttribute();
452 	}
453 
454 	/***
455 	 * Update the relative position of this dot's owing peer
456 	 * Should be called after a setLocaion method
457 	 * @param peers		the new number of peers
458 	 * @param cardinal	the new relative position of this peer
459 	 */
460 	public void updateCardinal(int peers, int cardinal) {
461 		location.updateCardinal(peers, cardinal);
462 		setLocationAttribute();
463 	}
464 
465 	/***
466 	 * Move the dot
467 	 * @param distanceX		horizontal offset
468 	 * @param distanceY		vertical offset
469 	 */
470     public void move(double distanceX, double distanceY) {
471     	Point locPoint = location.getAbsolutePoint();
472     	double posX = locPoint.getX() + distanceX;
473         double posY = locPoint.getY() + distanceY;
474         locPoint.setLocation(posX, posY);
475         location.updateCoordinate(adjustPoint(locPoint));
476 		setLocationAttribute();
477     }
478 	
479 	/***
480 	 * Get a point for the location of this dot, relative to the pie
481 	 * @return a point for the dot
482 	 */
483     public Point getLocation() {
484         return location.getAbsolutePoint();
485     }
486 
487     /***
488      * Get the sharing level for this dot
489      * @return the sharing level
490      */
491     public int getSharingLevel() {
492         // This is a live/lazy property, which is always updated when it is read
493         calculateSharingLevel();
494         return sharingLevel;
495     }
496 
497     /***
498      * Calculate the sharing level based on the radius of the dot
499      * @return the sharing level
500      */
501     private int calculateSharingLevel() {
502         sharingLevel = PieUtils.getSharingLevel(location.getRadius());
503     	return sharingLevel; 
504     }
505 
506     /***
507      * Adjust a radius so it will not let a dot fall on the colorful mark
508      * 
509      * @param radius the raw radius
510      * @return a new radius that will not touch the colorful marker
511      */
512     private double adjustRadius(double radius) {
513         // The coordinate is used as the center of the dot, make sure
514         // it plus the default dot radius does not touch the colorful
515         // marker
516         
517         // Below are comments when we decided to put this in the coordinate.
518         // 		The single more compelling reason that we move it to Dot
519         // 		is that Coordinate deals with absolute coordinates, but we 
520         //		are dealing a relative radius.
521         // 
522         // In Dot, this is read from template.svg, and we can probably
523         //		change from the consumer side (dot). But changing from
524         //		the producer side (coordinate) sounds tighter control,
525         //		even though it is somewhat twingled, with the dot.
526         // Since we cannot always accommodate arbitrary dot size (enlarging
527         //		dots will touch markers, then shall we move the dots?), 
528         //		so putting it here is reasonable.
529         // Besides, the best place to put this is right after the raw 
530         //		radius is changed, which happens here at the above four methods.
531         //		In two such cases, the absolute point produces radius,
532         //		which is adjusted, which will trigger back updating  on 
533         //		the originating absolute points.
534         // Also take the stroke width into consideration
535         double		defaultDotRadius = 8 + Integer.parseInt(oldStrokeWidth) / 2;
536         double		defaultMargin = 0.001;	// do not get too close
537         // The relative radius of an 8 pixel dot's radius
538         double		dotRadiusPercent = defaultDotRadius / Configuration.RADIUS;
539         double		innerBound = edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common.Configuration.LEVEL_RADIUS[1];
540         double		outerBound = edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common.Configuration.LEVEL_RADIUS[0];
541         double		result = radius;
542         if ( radius <= innerBound  && ( radius + dotRadiusPercent + defaultMargin >
543                 innerBound)) {
544             // the radius is inside the marker but too close
545             result = innerBound - dotRadiusPercent - defaultMargin;
546         }
547         if ( radius >= innerBound  && ( radius - dotRadiusPercent - defaultMargin <
548                 outerBound)) {
549             // the radius is within or outside the marker but too close
550             // treat the marker as private space, another instance of secure by default
551             result = outerBound + dotRadiusPercent + defaultMargin;
552         }
553         return result;
554     }
555     
556     /***
557      * Adjust a radius so it will not let a dot fall on the colorful mark
558      * @param p 	the x,y coordinate
559      * @param the adjusted point
560      */
561     private Point	adjustPoint(Point p) { 
562     	double 	radiusAbsolute = Coordinate.calculateRadius(p);
563     	double	radiusOriginal = radiusAbsolute / Configuration.RADIUS;
564     	double  radiusAdjusted = adjustRadius(radiusOriginal);
565     	double	newRatio = radiusAdjusted / radiusOriginal;
566     	return 	new Point((int)(p.getX() * newRatio), 
567     	        		  (int)(p.getY() * newRatio));
568     }
569     
570     /***
571      * Get the relative radius for this dot
572      * @return the radius 
573      */
574 	public double getRadius() {
575 		return location.getRadius() / Configuration.RADIUS;
576 	}
577 
578 	/***
579 	 * Get the relative angle for this dot
580 	 * @return the relative angle
581 	 */
582 	public double getAngle() {
583 		return location.getRelativeAngle();
584 	}
585 }

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
PasswordManager xref
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
View Javadoc

1   /*
2    * Created on Apr 18, 2005
3    *
4    */
5   package edu.uci.isr.impromptu.security;
6   
7   import java.math.BigInteger;
8   import java.security.KeyFactory;
9   import java.security.KeyPair;
10  import java.security.KeyPairGenerator;
11  import java.security.PrivateKey;
12  import java.security.PublicKey;
13  import java.security.spec.X509EncodedKeySpec;
14  
15  import javax.crypto.KeyAgreement;
16  import javax.crypto.spec.DHParameterSpec;
17  
18  import edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common.Utils;
19  
20  /***
21   * Uses Diffie-Hellman to exchange secretes that are used as passwords.
22   * 
23   * The ideal is a secure single sign on, so we can have easy-to-setup security.
24   * 
25   * If we use Basic Authentication, it is inherently insecure, to wihch 
26   * we can mitigate with a crytp/MD5, which also reduces the problem of
27   * storing my secure on another person's computer.
28   * 
29   * But we should use Digest Authentication, which requires recoerable
30   * password on the server side. We do not want to transfer such secret
31   * in clear text, so we use Diffie-Hellman to generate such secrets.
32   * 
33   * The problem is, it is a shared secret between a pair, so the pie can
34   * no longer just use one secret (my secret) to authenticate into everyone.
35   * Now the proxy has to use the many secrets to authenticate into every other
36   * person. This is acceptable, and maybe desirable, since we do not want 
37   * to store our secrets into others. 
38   * 
39   * TODO: security: protocol: this needs a revisit once we are more familiar with PKI. 
40   * 
41   * @author Jie Ren
42   */
43  public class PasswordManager {
44      // JmDNS limits a property to 256 bytes, but our public key is around 300 bytes
45      //		so we use two properties 
46      final public static String	PUBLIC_KEY_FIRST = "PUBLIC_KEY_FIRST";
47      final public static String	PUBLIC_KEY_SECOND = "PUBLIC_KEY_SECOND";
48      
49      //    The 1024 bit Diffie-Hellman modulus values used by SKIP
50      private static final byte skip1024ModulusBytes[] = {
51              (byte)0xF4, (byte)0x88, (byte)0xFD, (byte)0x58,
52              (byte)0x4E, (byte)0x49, (byte)0xDB, (byte)0xCD,
53              (byte)0x20, (byte)0xB4, (byte)0x9D, (byte)0xE4,
54              (byte)0x91, (byte)0x07, (byte)0x36, (byte)0x6B,
55              (byte)0x33, (byte)0x6C, (byte)0x38, (byte)0x0D,
56              (byte)0x45, (byte)0x1D, (byte)0x0F, (byte)0x7C,
57              (byte)0x88, (byte)0xB3, (byte)0x1C, (byte)0x7C,
58              (byte)0x5B, (byte)0x2D, (byte)0x8E, (byte)0xF6,
59              (byte)0xF3, (byte)0xC9, (byte)0x23, (byte)0xC0,
60              (byte)0x43, (byte)0xF0, (byte)0xA5, (byte)0x5B,
61              (byte)0x18, (byte)0x8D, (byte)0x8E, (byte)0xBB,
62              (byte)0x55, (byte)0x8C, (byte)0xB8, (byte)0x5D,
63              (byte)0x38, (byte)0xD3, (byte)0x34, (byte)0xFD,
64              (byte)0x7C, (byte)0x17, (byte)0x57, (byte)0x43,
65              (byte)0xA3, (byte)0x1D, (byte)0x18, (byte)0x6C,
66              (byte)0xDE, (byte)0x33, (byte)0x21, (byte)0x2C,
67              (byte)0xB5, (byte)0x2A, (byte)0xFF, (byte)0x3C,
68              (byte)0xE1, (byte)0xB1, (byte)0x29, (byte)0x40,
69              (byte)0x18, (byte)0x11, (byte)0x8D, (byte)0x7C,
70              (byte)0x84, (byte)0xA7, (byte)0x0A, (byte)0x72,
71              (byte)0xD6, (byte)0x86, (byte)0xC4, (byte)0x03,
72              (byte)0x19, (byte)0xC8, (byte)0x07, (byte)0x29,
73              (byte)0x7A, (byte)0xCA, (byte)0x95, (byte)0x0C,
74              (byte)0xD9, (byte)0x96, (byte)0x9F, (byte)0xAB,
75              (byte)0xD0, (byte)0x0A, (byte)0x50, (byte)0x9B,
76              (byte)0x02, (byte)0x46, (byte)0xD3, (byte)0x08,
77              (byte)0x3D, (byte)0x66, (byte)0xA4, (byte)0x5D,
78              (byte)0x41, (byte)0x9F, (byte)0x9C, (byte)0x7C,
79              (byte)0xBD, (byte)0x89, (byte)0x4B, (byte)0x22,
80              (byte)0x19, (byte)0x26, (byte)0xBA, (byte)0xAB,
81              (byte)0xA2, (byte)0x5E, (byte)0xC3, (byte)0x55,
82              (byte)0xE9, (byte)0x2F, (byte)0x78, (byte)0xC7
83          };
84  
85      //     The SKIP 1024 bit modulus
86      private static final BigInteger skip1024Modulus = new BigInteger
87      	(1, skip1024ModulusBytes);
88  
89      //     The base used with the SKIP 1024 bit modulus
90      private static final BigInteger skip1024Base = BigInteger.valueOf(2);
91  
92      private		PrivateKey	privateKey;
93      private		PublicKey	publicKey;
94      private		byte[]		publicKeyBytesFirst;
95      private		byte[]		publicKeyBytesSecond;
96      
97      /***
98       * Initialize the private and public key pair.
99       */
100     public PasswordManager() {
101         try {
102 	        // Parties should generate with the same parameter, so we use a fixed parameter 
103 	        DHParameterSpec dhSpec = new DHParameterSpec
104 	    		(skip1024Modulus, skip1024Base);
105 
106 	        // Use the values to generate a key pair
107 	        KeyPairGenerator keyGen = KeyPairGenerator.getInstance("DH");
108 	        keyGen.initialize(dhSpec);
109 	        KeyPair keypair = keyGen.generateKeyPair();
110 	    
111 	        // Get the generated public and private keys
112 	        privateKey = keypair.getPrivate();
113 	        publicKey = keypair.getPublic();
114 	        byte[]	publicKeyBytes = publicKey.getEncoded();
115 	        int		length = publicKeyBytes.length;
116 	        int		firstLength = 200;
117 	        int		secondLength = length - firstLength;
118 	        publicKeyBytesFirst = new byte[firstLength];
119 	        publicKeyBytesSecond = new byte[secondLength];
120 	        System.arraycopy(publicKeyBytes, 0, publicKeyBytesFirst, 0, firstLength);
121 	        System.arraycopy(publicKeyBytes, firstLength, publicKeyBytesSecond, 0, secondLength);
122         }
123 	    catch (Exception e) {
124 	        Utils.handleException(e);
125 	    } 
126     }
127 
128     /***
129      * Get the first half bytes for my public key 
130      * @return the first half bytes for the public key
131      */
132     public byte[] getMyPublicKeyBytesFirst() {
133         return publicKeyBytesFirst;
134     }
135     
136     /***
137      * Get the second half bytes for my public key 
138      * @return the second half bytes for the public key
139      */
140     public byte[] getMyPublicKeyBytesSecond() {
141         return publicKeyBytesSecond;
142     }
143     
144     /***
145      * Generate a secret password by combining my private key and other's public key
146      * @param otherPublicKeyBytes bytes for another's public key
147      * @return	a secret password that only the two parties know
148      */
149     public String getSecretPassword(byte[] otherPublicKeyBytes) {
150 	    try {
151 	        // Convert the public key bytes into a PublicKey object
152 	        X509EncodedKeySpec x509KeySpec = new X509EncodedKeySpec(otherPublicKeyBytes);
153 	        KeyFactory keyFact = KeyFactory.getInstance("DH");
154 	        PublicKey otherPublicKey = keyFact.generatePublic(x509KeySpec);
155 	    
156 	        // Prepare to generate the secret key with the private key and public key of the other party
157 	        KeyAgreement ka = KeyAgreement.getInstance("DH");
158 	        ka.init(privateKey);
159 	        ka.doPhase(otherPublicKey, true);
160 	    
161 	        // Generate the secret key
162 	        return getStringForm(ka.generateSecret("DES").getEncoded());
163 	    } 
164 	    catch (Exception e) {
165 	        Utils.handleException(e);
166 	    } 
167 	    return null;
168     }
169 
170     /***
171      * Get a string from an array of bytes 
172      * @param bytes	the input bytes
173      * @return	the generated string
174      */
175     private String getStringForm(byte[] bytes) {
176         StringBuffer	sb = new StringBuffer();
177         for (int i=0; i<bytes.length; i++) {
178             sb.append(bytes[i]);
179         }
180         return sb.toString();
181     }
182 }

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
BufferedRequestWrapper xref
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
View Javadoc

1   /*
2    * Created on Mar 28, 2005
3    *
4    */
5   package edu.uci.isr.impromptu.repository;
6   
7   import java.io.ByteArrayInputStream;
8   import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
9   import java.io.IOException;
10  import java.io.InputStream;
11  
12  import javax.servlet.ServletInputStream;
13  import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest;
14  import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequestWrapper;
15  
16  /***
17   * Wrap an http request so its input stream can be reused when aggregating 
18   * 		from multiple repositories.
19   * Adapted from http://forum.java.sun.com/thread.jspa?forumID=33&threadID=238221
20   * 
21   * @author Jie Ren
22   */
23  public class BufferedRequestWrapper extends HttpServletRequestWrapper {
24      ByteArrayInputStream       bais;
25      ByteArrayOutputStream      baos;
26      BufferedServletInputStream bsis;
27      byte[]                     buffer;
28  
29      public BufferedRequestWrapper(HttpServletRequest req) throws IOException {
30          super(req);
31          //         Read InputStream and store its content in a buffer.
32          InputStream is = req.getInputStream();
33          baos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
34          byte buf[] = new byte[1024];
35          int letti;
36          while ((letti = is.read(buf)) > 0)
37              baos.write(buf, 0, letti);
38          buffer = baos.toByteArray();
39      }
40  
41      public ServletInputStream getInputStream() {
42          try {
43              // Generate a new InputStream by stored buffer
44              bais = new ByteArrayInputStream(buffer);
45              // Istantiate a subclass of ServletInputStream
46              // (Only ServletInputStream or subclasses of it are accepted by the
47              // servlet engine!)
48              bsis = new BufferedServletInputStream(bais);
49          }
50          catch (Exception ex) {
51              ex.printStackTrace();
52          }
53          return bsis;
54      }
55  
56      /*
57       * Subclass of ServletInputStream needed by the servlet engine. All
58       * inputStream methods are wrapped and are delegated to the
59       * ByteArrayInputStream (obtained as constructor parameter)!
60       */
61      private static class BufferedServletInputStream extends ServletInputStream {
62          ByteArrayInputStream bais;
63  
64          public BufferedServletInputStream(ByteArrayInputStream bais) {
65              this.bais = bais;
66          }
67  
68          public int available() {
69              return bais.available();
70          }
71  
72          public int read() {
73              return bais.read();
74          }
75  
76          public int read(byte[] buf, int off, int len) {
77              return bais.read(buf, off, len);
78          }
79      }
80  }
