46  import org.mortbay.http.HttpContext;
47  import org.w3c.dom.Element;
48  import org.w3c.dom.NodeList;
49  
50  import edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common.Utils;
51  
52  /***
53   * This class controls how user authentication should be done.
54   * It controls what password is for me.
55   * It also controls whether me will blindly accept any requests, 
56   * 		or it will reject certain users. For accepted users, it
57   * 		controls what their passwords should be.
58   *
59   * @author Jie Ren
60   */
61  public class UserManager 
62  {
63      JPanel				panel = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
64      JPanel				panelMe = new JPanel(new FlowLayout());
65      JTextField			textMyPassword = new JTextField();
66      JPanel				panelOthersGroup = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
67      JPanel				panelOthers = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
68      JCheckBox 			buttonAlwaysAllowOthers = new JCheckBox("Always allow other users");
69      JButton 			buttonChangeMyPassword = new JButton("Change My Password");
70      JButton				buttonChangeOtherPassword = new JButton("Change Others Password");
71      JButton				buttonDisallowOther = new JButton("Disallow other");
72      JList				listOthers = new JList();
73      JScrollPane			paneOthers = new JScrollPane(listOthers);
74      JDialog				f = new JDialog();
75  
76      HttpContext			context;
77      SlideUserRealm		realm;
78      boolean				alwaysAllowOthers = true;
79  
80      /***
81       * The WebDAV connection
82       */
83  	private WebdavResource	impromptuServer;
84  
85  	/***
86  	 * Create a user manager
87  	 * @param uraa				the Jetty realm
88  	 * @param impromptuServer	the Slide connection
89  	 */
90      public UserManager(SlideUserRealm uraa, WebdavResource impromptuServer) {
91  	    this.impromptuServer = impromptuServer;
92  
93  	    // retrieve an HttpContext
94          // create the GUI
95          panelMe.setBorder(BorderFactory.createTitledBorder(
96                  BorderFactory.createEtchedBorder(EtchedBorder.LOWERED),
97                  "Me"));
98          panelMe.add(new JLabel("Input New Password"), BorderLayout.WEST);
99          textMyPassword.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(100, 20));
100         panelMe.add(textMyPassword, BorderLayout.CENTER);
101         panelMe.add(buttonChangeMyPassword, BorderLayout.EAST);
102         panel.add(panelMe, BorderLayout.NORTH);
103 
104         panelOthersGroup.setBorder(BorderFactory.createTitledBorder(
105                 BorderFactory.createEtchedBorder(EtchedBorder.LOWERED),
106                 "Others"));
107         panelOthersGroup.add(buttonAlwaysAllowOthers, BorderLayout.NORTH);
108         JPanel	actionsOthers = new JPanel(new FlowLayout());
109         actionsOthers.add(buttonChangeOtherPassword);
110         actionsOthers.add(buttonDisallowOther);
111         panelOthers.add(actionsOthers, BorderLayout.SOUTH);
112         panelOthers.add(paneOthers, BorderLayout.CENTER);
113         panelOthersGroup.add(panelOthers, BorderLayout.CENTER);
114 
115         panel.add(panelOthersGroup, BorderLayout.CENTER);
116 
117         // TODO: security: architecture: method/permission/abstract mapping and aggregation, arch level
118         f.getContentPane().setLayout(new FlowLayout());
119         f.getContentPane().add(panel);
120         f.setSize(new Dimension(440, 330));
121         f.setTitle("User Manager");
122         
123         buttonAlwaysAllowOthers.setSelected(alwaysAllowOthers);
124         this.realm = uraa;
125         if (this.impromptuServer != null && realm != null) {
126         }
127         if (listOthers.getSelectedIndex() == -1) {
128             buttonChangeOtherPassword.setEnabled(false);
129             buttonDisallowOther.setEnabled(false);
130         }
131     }
132 
133     /***
134      * Display the user manager
135      */
136     public void show() {
137         f.setVisible(true);
138     }
139     
140     /***
141      * The property that stores the members of a role in Slide
142      */
143     private final static String		ROLE_MEMBER_PROPERTY = "group-member-set";
144 
145     /***
146      * Add a slide user from the client side
147      * @param server	the remote WebDAV resource
148      * @param userName	the name of the new user
149      * @param roleName	the role of the new user
150      * @return true if added successfully, false otherwise
151      */
152     public static boolean addASlideUserFromClient(WebdavResource server, 
153             						String userName, String roleName) {
154         /***
155          * The begin tag for a member in the role definition
156          */
157         String  memberBeginTag = "<D:href xmlns:D='DAV:'>";
158         /***
159          * The end tag for a member in the role definition
160          */
161         String  memberEndTag = "</D:href>";
162         /***
163          * The name of the property storing the password for a user
164          */
165         String    	passwordProperty = "password"; 
166         /***
167          * The href tag used for each member of a role
168          */
169         String		tagHref = "href";
170         
171         boolean result = false;
172         try {
173             // Create a user
174 	        String	userPath = SecurityUtils.getUserPathForClient(userName);
175 	        result = server.mkcolMethod(userPath);
176 	        if (result) {
177 			    // set default password
178 		        PropertyName passwordPropertyName = new PropertyName(
179 		            Constants.SLIDE, passwordProperty);
180 		        result = server.proppatchMethod(userPath, passwordPropertyName, 
181 		                DEFAULT_PASSWORD_OPAQUE, true); 
182 			}
183 
184 	        // Get memebers of the role
185 	        String	rolePath = SecurityUtils.getRolePathForClient(roleName);
186 	        PropertyName groupMemberSetProperty = new PropertyName(
187 	               Constants.DAV, ROLE_MEMBER_PROPERTY);
188 	        Vector pnv = new Vector();
189 	        pnv.add(groupMemberSetProperty);
190 	
191 	        // The 2.0 WebdavResource does not handle XML property value correctly, 
192 	        // so we need our own parsing. Code for 2.1 will be simpler
193 	        Enumeration enum = server.propfindMethod(rolePath, DepthSupport.DEPTH_1, pnv);
194 	        // Collect new member with existing members here
195 	        String	newMembers = memberBeginTag + userPath + memberEndTag;
196 	        boolean assigned = false;
197 	        while(enum.hasMoreElements())
198 	        {
199 	            ResponseEntity item = (ResponseEntity)enum.nextElement();
200 	            Enumeration properties = item.getProperties();
201 	            while(properties.hasMoreElements())
202 	            {
203 	            	BaseProperty property = (BaseProperty) properties.nextElement();
204             	    Element membersElement = property.getElement();
205             	    NodeList children = membersElement.getElementsByTagNameNS(
206             	            Constants.DAV, tagHref);
207             	    for (int i = 0; i<children.getLength(); i++ ) {
208 						String member = children.item(i).getFirstChild().getNodeValue();
209 						if (member.equals(userPath)) {
210 						    assigned = true;
211 						}
212 						else {
213 						    newMembers += (memberBeginTag + member + memberEndTag);
214 						}
215 					}
216 	            }
217 	        }
218 	        if (!assigned) {
219 	            // This member is not assigned the role yet
220 		        result = server.proppatchMethod(rolePath, groupMemberSetProperty, 
221 		                newMembers, true);
222 	        }
223         }
224         catch (Exception e) {
225             Utils.handleException(e);
226             result = false;
227         }
228         
229         return result;
230     }
231 
232     /***
233      * Add a slide user at the sever side
234      * @param token		the namespace access token used to access Slide
235      * @param userName	the name of the new user
236      * @param roleName	the role of the new user
237      * @return true if added successfully, false otherwise
238      */
239     public static boolean addASlideUserAtServer(NamespaceAccessToken token, String userName, String roleName) {
240         boolean		result = false;
241         try {
242             token.begin();
243     
244             // In NamespaceConfig.initializeAsDummyConfig, each actionUri is 
245             //		initialized as ActionNode.DEFAULT. The SecurityImpl.hasPermissions
246             //		allows all such actions (for server initialization)
247             // Create a new user
248 
249             SlideToken 	st = new SlideTokenImpl(new CredentialsToken(SecurityConstants.ME));
250             // This must be set to true, otherwise the structure.create complains access denied,
251             //		because of the to-be-created user does not exist, even though it is to be created
252             st.setForceStoreEnlistment(true);
253             
254             SubjectNode nodeUser = new SubjectNode(); 
255             String		uriUser = SecurityUtils.getUserPathForServer(userName);
256             Structure	structure = token.getStructureHelper();
257             Content		content = token.getContentHelper();
258 
259             NodeRevisionDescriptor		revisionDescriptor = new NodeRevisionDescriptor();
260             revisionDescriptor.setResourceType("");
261             revisionDescriptor.setContentType("text/xml");
262             revisionDescriptor.setLastModified(new Date());
263             revisionDescriptor.setCreationDate(new Date());
264             revisionDescriptor.setETag(PropertyHelper.computeEtag(uriUser, revisionDescriptor) );
265             revisionDescriptor.setCreationUser(SecurityConstants.ME);
266             revisionDescriptor.setOwner(SecurityConstants.ME);
267             revisionDescriptor.setContentLength(0);
268             
269             try {
270                 structure.create(st, nodeUser, uriUser);
271                 content.create(st, uriUser, revisionDescriptor, null);
272                 content.store(st, uriUser, revisionDescriptor, null);
273             }
274     		catch (ObjectAlreadyExistsException e) {
275     		}
276     
277     		// Add user to the me role
278     		String	uriRole = SecurityUtils.getRolePathForServer(roleName); 
279             revisionDescriptor = null;
280             NodeRevisionDescriptors revisionDescriptors = null;
281             // We use roles as an indirection, configure and unify based on this
282             try {
283     	        revisionDescriptors = content.retrieve(st, uriRole); 
284     	        if ((revisionDescriptors != null)
285     	            && (revisionDescriptors.hasRevisions())) {
286                     revisionDescriptor = content.retrieve
287                         (st, revisionDescriptors);
288     	        }
289     		}
290     		catch (RevisionDescriptorNotFoundException e) {
291     		}
292     		if (revisionDescriptor == null) {
293                 revisionDescriptor = new NodeRevisionDescriptor(0);
294             }
295     		org.apache.slide.common.PropertyName memberSet = 
296     		    org.apache.slide.common.PropertyName.getPropertyName(ROLE_MEMBER_PROPERTY);
297     		// get existing members
298             NodeProperty property = revisionDescriptor.getProperty(memberSet);
299             if (property != null) {
300                 String members = (String)property.getValue();
301                 if (members.indexOf(uriUser) == -1 ) {
302                     String newMembers = members + "<D:href xmlns:D='DAV:'>" + uriUser + "</D:href>";
303                     // append the new user
304                     revisionDescriptor.setProperty(memberSet, newMembers);
305                     // remember to store
306     	            content.store(st, uriRole, revisionDescriptor, null);
307                 }
308             }
309             token.commit();
310             result = true;
311         }
312         catch (Exception e) {
313             Utils.handleException(e);
314             result = false;
315         }
316         return result;
317     }
318 
319     /***
320      * default password for Me.
321      */
322     private final static String  DEFAULT_ME_PASSWORD = "jetty";
323 
324     /***
325      * default password for Others. Used for dynamic addition of other users
326      */
327     private final static String	DEFAULT_PASSWORD_OPAQUE = "OBF:1y0g1w1c1z0f1w261y1a";
328 
329     /***
330      * Get the credentials for the me user
331      * @return credentials for the me user, with default me password
332      */
333     public static Credentials getMeCredentials() {
334         return new UsernamePasswordCredentials(SecurityConstants.ME, DEFAULT_ME_PASSWORD);
335     }
336 
337     /***
338      * Get the credentials for the current user
339      * @return	credentials for the current user, with default me password
340      */
341     public static Credentials getCurrentUserCredentials() {
342         return new UsernamePasswordCredentials(Utils.getImpromptuName(), DEFAULT_ME_PASSWORD);
343     }
344 }

##------------------URL-------------------------##

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
PeerManager xref
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
View Javadoc

1   /*
2    * Created on Feb 28, 2005
3    *
4    */
5   package edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common;
6   
7   import java.io.IOException;
8   import java.util.ArrayList;
9   import java.util.Collections;
10  import java.util.Iterator;
11  import java.util.List;
12  import java.util.Map;
13  import java.util.Set;
14  import java.util.SortedMap;
15  import java.util.TreeMap;
16  
17  import javax.jmdns.JmDNS;
18  import javax.jmdns.ServiceEvent;
19  import javax.jmdns.ServiceInfo;
20  import javax.jmdns.ServiceListener;
21  import javax.jmdns.ServiceTypeListener;
22  
23  import org.apache.commons.logging.Log;
24  import org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory;
25  
26  /***
27   * RepositoryPeer Manager uses JmDNS to manage present peers  
28   * for a peer owner. The rationale is to reuse this in 
29   * both the pie and the repository. 
30   *   
31   * @author Jie Ren
32   */
33  public class PeerManager implements ServiceListener, ServiceTypeListener {
34      private static Log 		log = LogFactory.getLog(PeerManager.class);
35  
36      // the JmDNS through which the manager knows the arrival and leaving of everybody
37      private 	JmDNS 			myJmDNS;
38      // our service information
39      private 	ServiceInfo		serviceInfo;
40      // the owner 
41      private 	PeerOwner		owner;
42      // Yancees 
43      private 	YanceesConnector		yancees;
44      
45      /***
46       * Construct the peer manager
47       * @param _owner the owner of this manager
48       * @param configuration is the YANCEES configuration file, used to create a YANCEES instance
49       */
50      public PeerManager(PeerOwner _owner, String configuration) {
51          owner = _owner;
52          serviceInfo = owner.getServiceInfo();
53          
54          try {
55              myJmDNS = new JmDNS(Utils.getLocalAddress());
56          }
57          catch (IOException e) {
58              Utils.handleException(e);
59          }
60          new Thread("Peer Resolver") {      
61              // This thread keeps asking for resolution of announced peers
62              public void run() {
63                  while (true && !stopPeerResolver) {
64                      try {
65                          Thread.sleep(1000);
66                          // need to make a copy, since during serviceResolved 
67                          //	the original peersToResolve is modified, 
68                          //	and modification, even by the own thread, is not allowed
69      	                List		l = new ArrayList(peersToResolve);
70      	                Iterator	i = l.iterator();
71      	                while (i.hasNext()) {
72      	                    ServiceEvent	event = (ServiceEvent)i.next();
73      	                    // here is where the modification will happen
74      	                    myJmDNS.requestServiceInfo(event.getType(), event.getName());
75      	                }
76                      }
77                      catch (InterruptedException e) {
78                      }
79                  }
80              }
81          }.start();
82  
83          yancees = new YanceesConnector(Utils.encode(owner.getName()+owner.getCharacter()), configuration);
84          yancees.addMessageProcessor(owner);
85      }
86  
87      public YanceesConnector getConnectorReference() {
88      	return yancees;
89      }
90      
91      /***
92       * Get the peer owner 
93       * @return the owner
94       */
95      public PeerOwner getOwner() {
96          return owner;
97      }
98      
99      // When a service added event is received, the full service info is requested.
100     // The unresolvedPeers list records such unresolved services.
101     // Once the full service is resolved, a new peer is created in peers. 
102     // unresolved peers, indexed by name
103     private List	peersToResolve = Collections.synchronizedList(new ArrayList());
104     // set to true to stop the peer resolver thread
105     private boolean stopPeerResolver = false;
106     // resolved peers, indexed and sorted by name
107     private SortedMap		peers = Collections.synchronizedSortedMap(new TreeMap());
108     /***
109      * Register the local peer to JmDNS
110      */
111     public void registerJmDNS() {
112         try {
113             log.debug("Register JmDNS");
114             // ISSUE: security: naming: how to defend the service type name and the service name?
115             myJmDNS.addServiceTypeListener(this);
116             Set		interestedServices = owner.getInterestedServices();
117             for (Iterator i = interestedServices.iterator(); i.hasNext(); ) {
118                 String	serviceType = (String)i.next();
119 	            myJmDNS.registerServiceType(serviceType);
120 	            myJmDNS.addServiceListener(serviceType, this);
121             }
122             
123             // Add ourselves first. This is not completely symmetrical, but it
124             //   	assures we are always in the list, and eases concurrency issues. 
125             addPeer(owner.getName() + owner.getCharacter(), serviceInfo);
126             
127             // Otherwise, we are never gonna be the first, if others are already 
128             // 		out there and we join them. There service info is resolved
129             //		earlier than ours.
130             myJmDNS.registerService(serviceInfo);
131         } 
132         catch (IOException e) {
133             Utils.handleException(e);
134         }
135     }
136 
137     /***
138      * Unregister the local peer from the JmDNS
139      */
140     public void unregisterJmDNS() {
141         if (myJmDNS != null) {
142             myJmDNS.unregisterService(serviceInfo);
143             Set		interestedServices = owner.getInterestedServices();
144             for (Iterator i = interestedServices.iterator(); i.hasNext(); ) {
145                 String	serviceType = (String)i.next();
146                 myJmDNS.removeServiceListener(serviceType, this);
147             }
148             myJmDNS.close();
149             stopPeerResolver = true;
150             log.debug("Unregister JmDNS");
151         }
152     }
153 
154     /***
155      * Handle the serviceAdded event by requesting more service info
156      * 
157      * @param event the event received 
158      */
159     public synchronized void serviceAdded(ServiceEvent event) {
160         // ISSUE: init: sometimes there is no gui, the reason might be we do not get 
161         //		ourselves, or we get another concurrent one and confuse it with 
162         //		ourselves.
163         // ISSUE: init: loooks like a starting JmDNS can drag a stopping one and prevent it from quiting 
164         String		name = event.getName();
165         ServiceInfo 	si = event.getInfo();
166         if (si != null) {
167             addPeer(name, si);
168         }
169         else if (!peers.containsKey(name)) {
170             // ISSUE: init: should we re-resolve?
171             // JmDNS 1.0RC2 seems only assuring serviceAdded
172             // its list/get functions do not always return correct results
173             // Solution: keep requestServiceInfo until it is resolved
174             myJmDNS.requestServiceInfo(event.getType(), name);
175             peersToResolve.add(event);
176 	    }
177     }
178     
179     /***
180      * Add a new peer
181      * 
182      * @param characterName the characterized name of the peer (
183      * peer-repository, peer-pie, or peer in an integrated case)
184      * @param si the service info of the new peer
185      */
186     private synchronized void addPeer(String characterName, final ServiceInfo si) {
187         // When running integrated, a peer is a peer; when running as standalone 
188         // repository/pie, only a repository triggers creating a peer in the peer manager,
189         // because the repository is what it counts.
190         // However, the yancees maintains a list of every piece (repositories and pies) so
191         // it can notify all of them
192         String name = characterName;
193         if (!peers.containsKey(name)) {
194             // During fast start, both JmDNS and our resolver add a peer
195 	        Peer p = owner.createAPeer(si);
196 	        if (p != null) {
197 		        log.debug("A new peer joined: " + name);
198 		        log.debug("The service is: " + si);
199 		        peers.put(name, p);
200 	        }
201 	        
202 	        // Add a peer here so we can use Yancees for peers admissions
203 	        String		encodedName = Utils.encode(si.getName());
204 	        String		yanceesInfo = "//" + si.getHostAddress() + "/" + encodedName;
205 	        // Here we do not use the newly created peer, since the p would be
206 	        // null when a pie comes on line 
207 	        if (!name.equals(owner.getName()+owner.getCharacter())) // don't publish to ourselves
208 	            yancees.peerJoin(encodedName, yanceesInfo);
209 	        
210 	        owner.afterCreateAPeer(si);
211         }
212     }
213 
214     /***
215      * Handle the serviceRemoved event by removing the peer
216      * 
217      * @param event the event received
218      */
219     public void serviceRemoved(ServiceEvent event) {
220         // ISSUE: init: when this event is received earlier than service add or resolve
221         // The pie pm might start way later than the repository pm
222         String			characterName = event.getName();
223         peers.remove(characterName);
224         log.debug("A peer left: " + characterName);         
225         String 			name = Utils.getPeerUserName(characterName);
226         owner.destroyAPeer(name);
227         if (!name.equals(owner.getName()+owner.getCharacter())) // don't publish to ourselves
228             yancees.peerLeave(Utils.encode(name));
229     }
230 
231     /***
232      * Handle the serviceResolved event by adding the newly arrived peer
233      */
234     public synchronized void serviceResolved(ServiceEvent event) {
235         String			name = event.getName();
236         ServiceEvent	toRemove = null;
237         synchronized(peersToResolve) {
238 	        for (Iterator i = peersToResolve.iterator(); i.hasNext(); ) {
239 	            toRemove = (ServiceEvent)i.next();
240 	            if (event.getName().equals(toRemove.getName()) &&
241 	                event.getType().equals(toRemove.getType())) {
242 	                break;
243 	            }
244 	        }
245         }
246         if (toRemove != null)
247             peersToResolve.remove(toRemove);
248         ServiceInfo 	si = event.getInfo();
249         addPeer(name, si);
250     }
251 
252     /***
253      * Handle the serviceTypeAdded event 
254      * 
255      * @param event the event received
256      */
257     public void serviceTypeAdded(ServiceEvent event) {
258         if(event!=null);
259     }
260 
261     /***
262      * Get present peers
263      * 
264      * @return the map of present peers
265      */
266     public Map	getPeers() {
267         return peers;
268     }
269     
270     /***
271      * Get a peer based on its name
272      * @param peerName	the name of the peer
273      * @return	the RepositoryPeer, null if no such peer
274      */
275     public Peer getPeer(String peerName) {
276         String	peerKey = peerName;
277         // This is to accommdate running repository and pie separately,
278         // when only the appearance of repository triggers "peer creation"
279         if (!peers.containsKey(peerKey))
280             peerKey = peerName + Configuration.REPOSITORY_CHARACTER;
281         return (Peer)peers.get(peerKey);
282     }
283 
284     /***
285      * Get owner of a file.
286      * If the file is owned by any peer, the owing peer would be returned.
287      * This might well be the local peer.
288      * If the file is owned by no one, then it will go to the local peer, 
289      * where it would be created.
290      * 
291      * @param filename the name of the file 
292      * @return the owner peer. Null if no current owner;  
293      */
294     public Peer	getOwnerPeer(String filename) {
295         synchronized(peers) {
296             Iterator	i = peers.values().iterator();
297 	        while (i.hasNext()) {
298 	            Peer	aPeer = (Peer)i.next();
299 	            if (aPeer.owns(filename))
300 	                return aPeer;
301 	        }
302         }
303         return null;
304     }
305     
306     /***
307      * Send out a message
308      * 
309      * @param message the message to send out
310      */
311     public void sendMessage(Map	message) {
312         yancees.send(message);
313     }
314 }

This page was automatically generated by Maven
##------------------URL-------------------------##
http://drzaius.ics.uci.edu/~swirl/impromptu-0.30/xref/edu/uci/isr/impromptu/repository/Overall.html
##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
Overall xref
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
View Javadoc

1   /*
2    * Created on Feb 12, 2005 by Jie Ren
3    *
4    */
5   package edu.uci.isr.impromptu.repository;
6   
7   /***
8    * 
9    * @author Jie Ren <a href="mailto:jie@ics.uci.edu">jie@ics.uci.edu</a>
10   *
11   */
12  public class Overall {
13      /*
14       * Design and Build guidelines for Impromptu
15       * 		1) Overrall
16       *      Follow established rules, unless clear advantages can be anticipated
17       * 		Modular and flexible design
18       * 		Clearly separate out security and visualiuzation features 
19       * 		Architectural connector
20       * 		Keep aspect (security and usablity) in mind
21       * 		Maximize push communictions, use Yancees, maybe other events
22       * 		Separate file system semantics from WebDAV semantics
23       * 		Maintain limitations on shared file name for simplicity, no support for directory.
24       * 		Localize HTTP/WebDAV access (so security will be in one place)
25       * 		Clear threading/concurrency control
26       * 		Clear lifecycle (creation/start/stop/destruction) control
27       * 		No unnecessary performance overhead
28       * 		Prefer simple middleware solutions over elaborate ones, unless security is a concern
29       * 		2) Components
30       *      Use Slide (2.2-dev as of 06/15/2005) as WebDAV container, 
31       * 			because it interoperates with Windows and Mac out of the box 
32       * 		Use Jetty (5.1.2 as of 02/12/2005) as Web server, because it is clear and light
33       * 		Use HttpClient (2.0.2) as Http client since this is the one used with Slide
34       * 		Use Slide's WebDAV client for WebDAV client
35       * 		Use the same proxy pattern. Redirection (3xx) only works for GET.
36       * 		Use a filter to do the proxy instead of a servlet
37       * 			this should be faster
38       * 			should try redirect first (requiring perfect mapping)
39       * 			For the security part, resource urls (i.e., folders) can be used
40       * 				to do access control, but dynamic setting them is more challenging
41       * 			For the naming part, we can also do folder or other management
42       * 				But letting them share a single namespace and telling them something
43       * 				is already existing should be just fine: no need for over complex
44       * 		The proxy specially handles PROPFIND, by aggregating responses from everybody
45       * 			For other methods, it uses the factory pattern, but just relays bits     
46       * 		Use JmDNS as the implementation for zeroconf/rendezvous
47       * 		Use Batik as graphics, because it can be scaled up and down easily
48       * 		Use SWT, because it is native looking, new, and cannot be that hard
49       * 		Use Holongate as the bridge for Batik/SWT, keep an eye on it
50       * 		Unfortunately, Batik does not work with SWT/Holongate well, so fall back to Swing 
51       * 		Pie: has a refresh: start and pull; use events to maintain
52       * 		Check commons launcher
53       * 		Java for URL, Jetty for HTTP, Slide for WebDAV
54       * 		Use as little jars as possible
55       * 		See whether JDK 5.0 can be of some use
56       * 		3) Platform issues
57       * 		XP gets major support, 2000 might lack WebDAV redirector
58       * 		Mac might have a problem with Holongate, so keep the Batik part ready for Swing
59       * 		Test redirector/webdavfs as main clients, not relying on Office DAV.
60       * 		PocketPC can be a headache, depending on Java availability and jars dependency. Maybe just a client/server
61       *		4) Process 			  
62       * 		Use Maven, because it generates good looking documents
63       * 		Use debugger, no log unless absolute necessary
64       * 		Use installer so the system is always deployable (for XP)
65       *		Use automatic test
66       *		Use a bug tracking system
67       *		Generate process and product matrics
68       *		5) Security
69       *		Root, me, others:
70       *			Root is to bootstrapt security. It is generated during installation,
71       *				and can only be accessed programmatically locally.
72       *			Roles are still just me and others. For me, the local user should 
73       *				be added. No /users/me, just /roles/me. Everybody else is others. 
74       *				(This is the name-based scheme. How insecure a name-based 
75       *				system is? More vulnerable than an address-based system?
76       *			Dynamic adding users: SlideUserRealm briges Jetty's realm with 
77       *				Slide's Domain.xml. It is stored and retrived by an attribute.
78       *				Slide's NameaccessToken is also retrieved through an attribute
79       *				in UserManager. During JmDNS peer addition, these two attributes 
80       *				are used to add a user to the Jetty authentication realm and 
81       *				add a user to Slide server's /users and /roles hierarchy. 
82       *				Both are proprieatary server side programming. The Slide 
83       *				part can also be done from the client side, see UserManager.
84       *				The client side programming uses WebDAV mkcol/proppatch to
85       *				trigger Slide propreiatary processing.   
86       *		Files level
87       *			LevelHandler is used to set Jetty security constraints that 
88       *				reflect authorizations. This is about HTTP methods on HTTP
89       *				resources. The handler is stored in an attribute, and is 
90       *				executed during (insecure) event processing.
91       *			ACLManager sets ACEs for files. The method (ACL) and the format
92       *				(ACE) are all standard, so this is the preferred way to set
93       *				permissions.
94       *		6) Peer vs Repository/Pie
95       *		A peer is a combination of a repository and a pie. The combination is done
96       *			through a couple tighly-coupled procedure calls.
97       *		When the repository and the pie run separately, the peer is refactored as such
98       *			Both the repository and the pie have a "character name", in addition to the
99       *				real user name. For a PeerOwner (Pie/ProxyFilter), the getCharacter 
100      *				returns this information. 
101      *			Only a repository triggers a creation of a "peer", since that is the file store.
102      *				So even for a Pie, who creates a slice for each peer, such a slice is only
103      *				created when a repository comes on-line.
104      *			For Yancees, since it needs to deliver messages to everybody, and repositories
105      *				and pies listen to each other, so it maintains a different set of communication
106      *				end points. PeerManager tells Yancees of each such peer, even though it does not
107      *				always create such peer (it only creates a "peer" in its map for a repository)
108      *			The code has some random timing issues with shutdown, and cannot support persistence.
109      *			In summary, the refactoring is a naming issue that keep the original repository 
110      *				concept while let Yancees communicate with many participants.      
111      */
112 }

This page was automatically generated by Maven

1   /*

54  package edu.uci.isr.impromptu.pocketpc;
55  
56  import java.awt.Color;
57  import java.util.HashMap;
58  import java.util.Iterator;
59  import java.util.Map;
60  
61  import edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common.MessageProcessor;
62  import edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common.PeerManager;
63  import edu.uci.isr.impromptu.pie.PieUtils;
64  import edu.uci.isr.impromptu.repository.RepositoryPeer;
65  import edu.uci.isr.yancees.server.filter.peerpublisher.PeerPublisherInputFilter;
66  
67  /***
68   * Responds to events requesting a current snapshot of all the peers and their
69   * files. This is used by the pocket PC to inquire about the existing peers and
70   * their files, at bootstrap.
71   * 
72   * This class is currently instantiated inside the ProxyFilter, the PeerManager
73   * passed in the constructor. 
74   * 
75   * @author rsilvafi class created at Jul 27, 2005
76   * 
77   */
78  public class PeerQueryServer implements MessageProcessor {
79  
80  	public static boolean print = true;
81  	
82  	PeerManager pm = null; // keeps information about this peer
83  
84  	public PeerQueryServer(PeerManager peerMan) {
85  		pm = peerMan;
86  		pm.getConnectorReference().addMessageProcessor(this);
87  	}
88  
89  	/***
90  	 * Receives messages from YANCEES connector and check for peer query requests
91  	 * In case of a request, generates a response and publishes it back to YANCEES
92  	 */
93  	public void processMessage(Map message) {
94  
95  		if (print) {
96  			System.out.print("\n PeerQueryServer: Message: [");
97  			for (Iterator iter = message.keySet().iterator(); iter.hasNext();) {
98  				String key = (String) iter.next();
99  				Object element = message.get(key);
100 				System.out.print(key + " = " + element.toString() + ", ");
101 
102 			}
103 			System.out.println("] \n");
104 		}
105 
106 		// If the message received is a request
107 		if (message.containsKey(PeerQueryProtocol.MESSAGE_TYPE)
108 				&& ((String) message.get(PeerQueryProtocol.MESSAGE_TYPE))
109 						.equals(PeerQueryProtocol.REQ_MESSAGE_TYPE)) {
110 
111 			if (message.containsKey(PeerQueryProtocol.QUERY_COMMAND)
112 					&& ((String) message.get(PeerQueryProtocol.QUERY_COMMAND))
113 							.equals(PeerQueryProtocol.CMD_LIST_GLOBAL_FILES)) {
114 
115 				String sessionId = (String) message.get(PeerQueryProtocol.SESSION_ID);
116 
117 				Map event = generateListGlobalFilesRESPONSE(sessionId);
118 				pm.getConnectorReference().send(event);
119 			}
120 		}
121 
122 	}
123 
124 	
125 
126 	/***
127 	 * We pack a list of files, with their owners/name, and their sharing level
128 	 * in order to send the results back to the requestor.
129 	 * 
130 	 * @param sessionId
131 	 *            is the identifier of the request that will issue in this
132 	 *            response
133 	 * @return a list of existing peers and their files in the format of a hashMap.
134 	 * the peer name comes cateated with each attribute name (i.e. file name), together with the 
135 	 * current sharing level as the attribute value.
136 	 */
137 	protected Map generateListGlobalFilesRESPONSE(String sessionId) {
138 		Map response = new HashMap();
139 
140 		// generates a response to certain session id.
141 		response.put(PeerQueryProtocol.MESSAGE_TYPE, PeerQueryProtocol.RESP_MESSAGE_TYPE);
142 		response.put(PeerQueryProtocol.SESSION_ID, sessionId);
143 		
144 		/*
145 		 * If we are using a simple client only, this prevents the response to be
146 		 * propagated to the other peers in the network.
147 		 */
148 		response.put(PeerPublisherInputFilter.PUBLISH_TO_PEERS, PeerPublisherInputFilter.FALSE);
149 		
150 		String currentPeerName;
151 		RepositoryPeer repPeer;
152 		Map peerMap = pm.getPeers();
153 			
154 		
155 		if (print)
156 			System.out.println("PeerQueryServer: generating response...");
157 		for (Iterator iter = peerMap.keySet().iterator(); iter.hasNext();) {
158 			currentPeerName = (String) iter.next();
159 			repPeer = (RepositoryPeer) peerMap.get(currentPeerName);
160 			
161 			// Adds the peer color as the attribute of the peerName
162 			Color color = PieUtils.getColorFromServiceInfo(repPeer.getServiceInfo());
163 	        if (color == null) {
164 	        	color = PieUtils.getColorForName(currentPeerName);
165 	        }
166 		
167 			response.put(PeerQueryProtocol.PEER+currentPeerName, PieUtils.getRGBString(color));
168 			Map filesMap = repPeer.getOwnedFiles();
169 
170 			for (Iterator iterator = filesMap.keySet().iterator(); iterator
171 					.hasNext();) {
172 				String fileName = (String) iterator.next();
173 				Integer sharingLevel = (Integer) filesMap.get(fileName);
174 
175 				response.put(PeerQueryProtocol.FILE+currentPeerName + "/" + fileName, sharingLevel
176 						.toString());
177 
178 				if (print)
179 					System.out.println(currentPeerName + "/" + fileName
180 							+ " sharing level is " + sharingLevel);
181 
182 			}
183 		}
184 
185 		return response;
186 	}
187 
188 }

This page was automatically generated by Maven

1   /*
2    * Created on Mar 24, 2005
3    *
4    */
5   package edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common;
6   
7   import java.util.Map;
8   
9   /***
10   * Processors of messages
11   * 
12   * @author Jie Ren
13   */
14  public interface MessageProcessor {
15      
16  	/***
17       * The attribute name of the owner peer
18       */
19      public static String ATTR_PEER_NAME = "OwnerPeer";
20      /***
21       * The attribute name of the file name
22       */
23      public static String ATTR_FILE_NAME = "File";
24      /***
25       * The attribute name of action on files
26       */
27      public static String ATTR_ACTION = "Action";
28      /***
29       * The action that a file has been added
30       */
31      public static String ACTION_ADD = "Add";
32      /***
33       * The action that a file has been readded by a MOVE request
34       */
35      public static String ACTION_RE_ADD = "ReAdd";
36      /***
37       * The action that a file has been removed
38       */
39      public static String ACTION_REMOVE = "Remove";
40      /***
41       * The action that a file has been moved
42       */
43      public static String ACTION_MOVE = "Move";
44      /***
45       * The action that a file has been read
46       */
47      public static String ACTION_READ = "Read";
48      /***
49       * The action that a file has been written
50       */
51      public static String ACTION_WRITE = "Write";
52      /***
53       * The action that a peer wants to leave
54       */
55      public static String ACTION_LEAVE_NOTIFY = "LeaveNotify";
56      /***
57       * The action that a peer can leave since its backup holder has backed up files
58       */
59      public static String ACTION_LEAVE_CONTINUE = "LeaveContinue";
60      /***
61       * The action that a peer should shutdown
62       */
63      public static String ACTION_SHUTDOWN = "Shutdown";
64      /***
65       * The action that a peer changes its color
66       */
67      public static String ACTION_COLOR = "ChangeColor";
68      /***
69       * The action that a peer has been added by another peer 
70       * (so the added peer can pull files from the adding peer)
71       */
72      public static String ACTION_ADD_PEER = "AddPeer";
73      /***
74       * The actor who reads or writes a file, or the initiator of a leave notify 
75       * message, or the added peer  
76       */
77      public static String ATTR_ACTOR = "Actor";
78      /***
79       * The new relative radius of a moved file
80       */
81      public static String ATTR_RADIUS = "Radius";
82      /***
83       * The new relative angle of a moved file
84       */
85      public static String ATTR_ANGLE = "Angle";
86      /***
87       * The sharing level of a newly added or moved file. 
88       * This, instead of radius, is the one that a repository cares.
89       * The repository can calcuate this from a radius, but letting the pie
90       * do the calculation can localize knowledge about radius.
91       */
92      public static String ATTR_LEVEL = "Level";
93      /***
94       * The new color for a peer
95       */
96      public static String ATTR_COLOR = "NewColor";
97      
98      /***
99       * Process a message
100      * 
101      * @param message the message with attributes and values
102      */
103     public void processMessage(Map message);
104 }

##------------------URL-------------------------##

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
YanceesJmDNSService xref

View Javadoc

1   /*
2    * Created on Mar 24, 2005
3    *
4    */
5   package edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common;
6   
7   import java.rmi.RemoteException;
8   import java.util.HashMap;
9   import java.util.Iterator;
10  
11  import edu.uci.isr.yancees.EventInterface;
12  import edu.uci.isr.yancees.SubscriberInterface;
13  import edu.uci.isr.yancees.YanceesException;
14  import edu.uci.isr.yancees.client.rmi.YanceesRMIClient;
15  import edu.uci.isr.yancees.server.plugin.protocol.peerpublish.PeerPublishPluginFactory;
16  import edu.uci.isr.yancees.server.plugin.protocol.peerpublish.RemotePeerPublishProtocolPluginInterface;
17  import edu.uci.isr.yancees.server.service.AbstractService;
18  
19  
20  /***
21   * A Yancees plug in for JmDNS 1.0RC2, based on Roberto's code
22   *
23   * This service connects YANCESS with its peers in a subnetwork. It uses the
24   * service location protocol (SLP)
25   *
26   * @author Jie Ren
27   */
28  public class YanceesJmDNSService extends AbstractService  {
29      //private static Log          log                      = LogFactory.getLog(YanceesJmDNSService.class);
30  
31      // Named used by YANCEES plug-ins, internally, to use this service
32      public static String        SERVICE_NAME             = "jmdns.service";
33  
34      //  number of times to retry before
35      private static int           RETRY_TENTATIVES         = 5;
36      //  for RMI reconnecting loopls
37      private static int           RETRY_TIMEOUT            = 5000;
38  
39      // implementation of this service keeps a list of known peers
40      private HashMap             _knownPeers              = new HashMap();
41  
42      // stores peers according to the JmDNS listenter interface calls
43      private HashMap             _peerProtocolConnections = new HashMap();
44  
45      // live connections to the protocol plug-in of the peers
46      private SubscriberInterface _mySubscriberInterface   = new MySubscriber();
47  
48      public YanceesJmDNSService() {
49          super();
50          System.out.println("Started: "+ this.getClass().getName());
51      }
52  
53      /***
54       * Locates and display a list of other YANCEES instances in the neighborhod
55       * through JmDNS
56       */
57      public void printKnownPeers() {
58          HashMap myKnownPeers;
59          synchronized (_knownPeers) {
60              myKnownPeers = (HashMap) _knownPeers.clone();
61          }
62          System.out.println("\nJmDNSService: Known Yancees Peers:");
63          for (Iterator iter = myKnownPeers.keySet().iterator(); iter.hasNext();) {
64              String key = (String) iter.next();
65              System.out.println(key);
66          }
67      }
68  
69      /***
70       * Display connected peers
71       */
72      public void printKnownConnectedPeers() {
73          // we make a copy of the current protocol connections to prevent
74          // concurrent problems.
75          HashMap myPeerProtocolConnections;
76          synchronized (_peerProtocolConnections) {
77              myPeerProtocolConnections = ((HashMap) _peerProtocolConnections
78                      .clone());
79          }
80          // we iterate over the copy we just created
81          System.out.println("\nJmDNSService: Known Connected Peers:");
82          for (Iterator iter = myPeerProtocolConnections.keySet().iterator(); iter
83                  .hasNext();) {
84              String key = (String) iter.next();
85              System.out.println(key);
86          }
87      }
88  
89      /***
90       * Propagates, or publishes an event in all the peers of the network. Note
91       * that for this operation, we do not use the regular publishing interface
92       * of YANCEES as a way to prevent repeated circular publishing of events.
93       *
94       * @param evt
95       *            is the event to be propagated to the other peers.
96       */
97      public void publishToPeers(final EventInterface evt) {
98          Thread t = new Thread() {
99              public void run() {
100                 HashMap myPeerProtocolConnections = null;
101                 // we make a copy of the hashmap to avoid concurrency problems.
102                 synchronized (_peerProtocolConnections) {
103                     myPeerProtocolConnections = (HashMap) _peerProtocolConnections
104                             .clone();
105                 }
106 
107                 for (Iterator iter = myPeerProtocolConnections.keySet().iterator();
108                 		iter.hasNext();) {
109                     String key = (String) iter.next();
110                     RemotePeerPublishProtocolPluginInterface peer;
111 
112                     peer = (RemotePeerPublishProtocolPluginInterface)
113                     			myPeerProtocolConnections.get(key);
114 
115                     if (peer != null) {
116                         try {
117                             peer.publishEventFromPeer(evt);
118                         }
119                         catch (RemoteException e) {
120                             // peer is not alive anymore.
121                             //log.debug("ERROR when publishing to peer: " + key);
122                             //log.debug("When sending evt" + evt);
123                             //log.debug("Exception: " + e);
124                             removePeerProtocolConnection(key);
125                         }
126                     }
127                     else {
128                     }
129                 }
130             };
131         };
132         t.start();
133     }
134 
135     /***
136      * Remove a connected peer
137      * @param key the name of the peer once connected
138      */
139     private void removePeerProtocolConnection(String key) {
140         synchronized (_peerProtocolConnections) {
141             _peerProtocolConnections.remove(key);
142         }
143     }
144 
145     /***
146      * Propagates, or publishes an event in all the peers of the network. Note
147      * that for this operation, we do not use the regular publishing interface
148      * of YANCEES as a way to prevent repeated circular publishing of events.
149      *
150      * @param evtList
151      *            is the event list to be propagated to the other peers.
152      */
153     public void publishToPeers(final EventInterface[] evtList) {
154         Thread t = new Thread() {
155             public void run() {
156                 HashMap myPeerProtocolConnections = null;
157                 // we make a copy of the hashmap to avoid concurrency problems.
158                 synchronized (_peerProtocolConnections) {
159                     myPeerProtocolConnections = (HashMap) _peerProtocolConnections
160                             .clone();
161                 }
162 
163                 for (Iterator iter = myPeerProtocolConnections.keySet().iterator();
164                 	iter.hasNext();) {
165                     String key = (String) iter.next();
166                     RemotePeerPublishProtocolPluginInterface peer;
167 
168                     peer = (RemotePeerPublishProtocolPluginInterface)
169                      			myPeerProtocolConnections.get(key);
170 
171                     if (peer != null) {
172                         try {
173                             peer.publishEventsFromPeer(evtList);
174                         }
175                         catch (RemoteException e) {
176                             //log.debug("Removing errorneous peer" + key);
177                             removePeerProtocolConnection(key);
178                         }
179                     }
180                     else {
181                     }
182                 }
183             }
184 
185         };
186         t.start();
187     }
188 
189     /***
190      * A peer is added. Record it.
191      *
192      * @param peerName
193      * @param peerAddress
194      */
195     public void addPeer(final String peerName, final String peerAddress) {
196         synchronized (_knownPeers) {
197             if (_knownPeers.containsKey(peerName))
198                 return;
199 
200             _knownPeers.put(peerName, peerAddress);
201         }
202 
203         Thread t = new Thread() {
204             public void run() {
205                 // add the received name to the list of known peers
206                 // we use the JmDNS unique name as key
207                 YanceesRMIClient yancees = null;
208                 // It may be the case that the jmDNS service initialized but
209                 // YANCEES did not finish booting up, so we try 5 times with
210                 // 2 seconds interval before giving up connecting to the new
211                 // YANCEES peer.
212                 boolean succeeded = false;
213                 int 	tentative = 0;
214                 while (!succeeded && tentative < RETRY_TENTATIVES) {
215                     try {
216                         yancees = new YanceesRMIClient(peerAddress);
217                         succeeded = true;
218                     }
219                     catch (YanceesException ex) {
220                         tentative++;
221                         succeeded = false;
222                         try {
223                             Thread.sleep(RETRY_TIMEOUT);
224                         }
225                         catch (InterruptedException e) {
226                             e.printStackTrace();
227                         }
228 
229                         if (tentative >= RETRY_TENTATIVES) {
230                             //log.debug(ex);
231                         }
232                     }
233                 }
234 
235                 RemotePeerPublishProtocolPluginInterface peerPublishPluginReference = null;
236                 if (succeeded) {
237                     boolean connected = false;
238                     int mytry = 0;
239                     while (!connected && mytry < RETRY_TENTATIVES) {
240                         try {
241                             // TODO: security: protocol: This uses RMI, which is firewall unfriendly, since it
242                             //		does not use a fixed port by default
243                             // Windows XP SP2 firewall and 2003 Server SP1 firewall
244                             //		have program exceptions, which allows Java to do anything
245                             peerPublishPluginReference = (RemotePeerPublishProtocolPluginInterface) yancees
246                                     .connectToSharedProtocol(
247                                             PeerPublishPluginFactory.PROTOCOL_NAME,
248                                             _mySubscriberInterface);
249                             connected = true;
250                             // keeps the connection alive so it can publish
251                             // events in the future.
252                             synchronized (_peerProtocolConnections) {
253                                 _peerProtocolConnections.put(peerName,
254                                         peerPublishPluginReference);
255                             }
256                         }
257                         catch (YanceesException e2) {
258                             mytry++;
259                             connected = false;
260 
261                             if (mytry == 1) {
262                                 //log.debug("error when connecting to new protocol...");
263                             }
264 
265                             try {
266                                 Thread.sleep(RETRY_TIMEOUT);
267                             }
268                             catch (InterruptedException e) {
269                                 //log.debug(e);
270                             }
271                         }
272                     }
273                 }
274             }
275         };
276         t.start();
277     }
278 
279     /***
280      * Remove a peer
281      * @param name	the name of a peer
282      */
283     public void removePeer(final String name) {
284         Thread t = new Thread() {
285             public void run() {
286                 synchronized (_knownPeers) {
287                     _knownPeers.remove(name);
288                 }
289                 synchronized (_peerProtocolConnections) {
290                     _peerProtocolConnections.remove(name);
291                 }
292             }
293         };
294         t.start();
295     }
296 
297     /***
298      * This is a dummy class to uniquely identify the subscriber in this case.
299      * For this protocol plug-in specifically, it has no application.
300      *
301      * This interface allows other plug-ins to subscribe to events generated by
302      * this service.
303      *
304      * @author rsilvafi class created at Jun 15, 2004
305      *
306      */
307     public class MySubscriber implements SubscriberInterface {
308         /*
309          * (non-Javadoc)
310          *
311          * @see edu.uci.isr.yancees.SubscriberInterface#notify(edu.uci.isr.yancees.EventInterface)
312          */
313         public void notify(EventInterface evt) {
314             if(evt!=null);
315         }
316 
317         /*
318          * (non-Javadoc)
319          *
320          * @see edu.uci.isr.yancees.SubscriberInterface#notify(edu.uci.isr.yancees.EventInterface[])
321          */
322         public void notify(EventInterface[] evtList) {
323             if(evtList!=null);
324         }
325     }
326 }

1   /*
2    * Created on Mar 25, 2005
3    *
4    */
5   package edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common;
6   
7   import java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException;
8   import java.net.InetAddress;
9   import java.net.NetworkInterface;
10  import java.net.SocketException;
11  import java.net.UnknownHostException;
12  import java.util.Enumeration;
13  
14  import edu.uci.isr.impromptu.security.SecurityConstants;
15  
16  
17  /***
18   * Shared PieUtils between Impromptu Repository and Pie
19   * 
20   * @author Jie Ren
21   */
22  public class Utils {
23      /***
24       * Handle an exception.
25       * 
26       * @param e the exception to handle
27       */
28      public static void handleException(Exception e) {
29          e.printStackTrace();
30      }
31  
32      /***
33       * Get a usable local address
34       * @return	a usable local address
35       */
36      public static InetAddress getLocalAddress()
37      {
38          InetAddress		localAddress = null;
39          Enumeration 	interfaces;
40          try {
41              interfaces = NetworkInterface.getNetworkInterfaces();
42              while(interfaces.hasMoreElements()) {
43      		    NetworkInterface inter = (NetworkInterface)interfaces.nextElement();
44      		    Enumeration addresses = inter.getInetAddresses();
45      		    while(addresses.hasMoreElements())
46      		    {
47      		        InetAddress address = (InetAddress)addresses.nextElement();
48      		        if(!(address.isLoopbackAddress() || address.isLinkLocalAddress() ||
49      					 /*address.isSiteLocalAddress() || */
50      					 address.isMCOrgLocal() || address.isMCSiteLocal() ||  
51      					(address instanceof java.net.Inet6Address))){
52      		            localAddress = address;
53      		            return localAddress;
54      		        }
55      		    }
56      		}
57              
58              // if the extreme restricted method does not work, use the regular way of
59              // finding a network card...
60              if (localAddress == null) {
61      			localAddress = java.net.InetAddress.getLocalHost();
62              }
63          } 
64          catch (SocketException e) {
65              handleException(e);
66          }
67          catch (UnknownHostException e) {
68              handleException(e);
69          }
70          return localAddress;
71      }
72      
73      /***
74       * Get the sharing level for a relative radius
75       * @param relative the input radius. The larger the radius, the lower the sharing level.
76       * @return the shairing level that the radius falls into
77       */
78  	public static int getSharingLevelFromRelativeRadius(double relative) {
79  	    int			result = SecurityConstants.LEVEL_PRIVATE;
80  	    if (relative > Configuration.LEVEL_RADIUS[1]) {
81  	        // It falls on or outside the colorful marker
82  	        result = SecurityConstants.LEVEL_PRIVATE;
83  	    }
84  	    else {
85              //find which inner ring or circle it belongs to
86              for(int i = SecurityConstants.LEVEL_PERSISTENT; i > 0; i--) {
87                  if(relative < Configuration.LEVEL_RADIUS[i]) {
88                      result = i;
89                      break;
90                  }
91              }
92          }
93          return result;
94  	}
95  
96      /***
97       * Whether the file name designates the root directory
98       * @param fileName the file name
99       * @return true if the file name is "", or "/", false otherwise
100      */
101     public static boolean isRoot(String fileName) {
102         boolean result = false;
103         if (Configuration.ROOT_NAME.equals(fileName) || "/".equals(fileName))
104             result = true;
105         return result;
106     }
107     
108     /***
109      * Get a URL that corresponds to a file name
110      * @param fileName the file name
111      * @return a URL path prefixed by context and files paths of slide
112      */
113     public static String fileNameToURL(String fileName) {
114     	//if (!isRoot(fileName)), rootName, which should be "", ends up as "/files/".
115         //result = result + "/" + encode(fileName);
116         // encode is unnecessary, since WebdavResource propfind/proppatch/acl methods
117         // seem working fine without encoding
118         return  Configuration.URL_PREFIX + fileName;
119     }
120 
121     /***
122      * Get a /files path within the /impromptu context that corresponds to a file name
123      * @param fileName the file name
124      * @return a URL path prefixed by the files path of slide
125      */
126     public static String fileNameToContextPath(String fileName) {
127         return Configuration.FILES_PATH + fileName;
128     }
129     
130     /***
131      * Get a file name that corresponds to a URL
132      * @param url the URL
133      * @return a file name stripped off context and files paths of slide
134      */
135     public static String urlToFileName(String url) {
136         // Replace "//" with "/"
137         String		reducedURL = url;
138         while (reducedURL.indexOf("//")!=-1) {
139             reducedURL = reducedURL.replaceAll("//", "/");
140         }
141         String	result = null;
142         int		prefixLength = Configuration.URL_PREFIX.length();
143         int		urlLength = reducedURL.length();
144         if (urlLength==prefixLength || urlLength==(prefixLength - 1))
145             // URL is like "/" or ""
146             result = "/";
147         else if (urlLength > prefixLength)
148             // URL is like "prefixfileName"
149             result = reducedURL.substring(prefixLength);
150         // otherwise, result will be null, and it signals a problem
151         return result;
152     }
153     
154     /***
155      * Get the name used to designate the impromptu instance
156      * @return the name. It is the property user.name, unless
157      * the property impromptu.name is set.
158      */
159     public static String getImpromptuName() {
160 		String impromptuName = System.getProperty("impromptu.name"); 
161         if (impromptuName==null) {
162             impromptuName = System.getProperty("user.name");
163         }
164         return impromptuName;
165     }
166     
167     private static String DefaultEncodingScheme = "UTF-8";
168     /***
169      * Encode a URL
170      * 
171      * @param unencoded		unencoded URL
172      * @return	encoded URL
173      */
174     public static String encode(String unencoded) {
175         try {
176             String result = java.net.URLEncoder.encode(unencoded, DefaultEncodingScheme);
177             // change "+" to "%20"
178             result = result.replaceAll("//\u002b", "%20");
179             return result;
180         } 
181         catch (UnsupportedEncodingException e) {
182             handleException(e);
183             return null;
184         }
185     }
186 
187     /***
188      * Decode a URL
189      * 
190      * @param encoded encoded URL
191      * @return	decoded URL
192      */
193     public static String decode(String encoded) {
194         try {
195             String result = java.net.URLDecoder.decode(encoded, DefaultEncodingScheme);
196             // change "%20" to " "
197             result = result.replaceAll("%20", "//\u0020");
198             return result; 
199         } 
200         catch (UnsupportedEncodingException e) {
201             handleException(e);
202             return null;
203         }
204     }
205 
206     /***
207      * Get the real user name, if the provided peer name is a character-suffixed name
208      * @param name the possibly suffixed peer name
209      * @return the real user name
210      */
211     public static String getPeerUserName(String name) {
212         String	result = name;
213         int		len = name.length();
214         if (name.endsWith(Configuration.PIE_CHARACTER)) {
215             result = name.substring(0, len - Configuration.PIE_CHARACTER.length());
216         }
217         else if (name.endsWith(Configuration.REPOSITORY_CHARACTER)) {
218             result = name.substring(0, len - Configuration.REPOSITORY_CHARACTER.length());
219         }
220         return result;
221     }
222 }

5   package edu.uci.isr.impromptu.repository;
6   
7   /***
8    * This servlet extends the Slide WebdavServlet. We need this to control 
9    * 	initialization/shutdown. 
10   * 
11   * @author Jie Ren
12   */
13  import java.io.IOException;
14  
15  import javax.servlet.ServletConfig;
16  import javax.servlet.ServletException;
17  import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest;
18  import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse;
19  
20  import org.apache.slide.webdav.WebdavServlet;
21  
22  public class ProxyServlet extends WebdavServlet
23  {
24      public ProxyServlet() {
25          super();
26      }
27      
28      protected void service (HttpServletRequest req, HttpServletResponse resp)
29      	throws ServletException, IOException {
30          super.service(req, resp);
31      }
32      
33      public void init(ServletConfig config) throws ServletException {
34          super.init(config);
35  
36          // The WebDAV servlet is initialized. Now we can do more initialiazation. 
37          ProxyFilter pf = (ProxyFilter)config.getServletContext().getAttribute(
38                  ProxyFilter.ATTRIBUTE_NAME);
39          pf.initAfterServlet();
40      }
41      	
42  
43      public void init() throws ServletException {
44          super.init();
45      }
46      
47      public void destroy() {
48          super.destroy();
49      }
50  }

105 /***
106  * This is the Pie client for the proxy. It connects to the Proxy,
107  * displays available files, using special properties (owner, level, position) it finds.
108  * It can also change these properties, when the user drags files.
109  * It allows user open files, using simple start/open command.
110  * The whole pie assumes a file with a certain name only belongs to one peer, so two
111  * peers cannot have files with the same name.  
112  * 
113  * @author Jie Ren
114  */
115 public class Pie implements EventListener, PeerOwner {
116     private static Log 		log = LogFactory.getLog(Pie.class);
117

223     //		Yancees.

225     //		Repository is not interested in Pie events. 
226     //	The peers map below only contains SlicePeers: presentation vs communication

230     // for quick access, an aux structure 
231     // all peers in this map are slice peer
232     // This probably could be merged with the peer manager's peers map,
233     //		but the synchronization/concurrency cost might be more than its worth
234     private SortedMap 		peers = Collections.synchronizedSortedMap(new TreeMap());
235     // whether the other peer has admitted this peer (to access the remote files)
236     // The key is the remote peer's name, the value is admitted (true) or not admitted (false)
237     // The key includes the userName, which should always be true
238     private SortedMap		admittedBy = Collections.synchronizedSortedMap(new TreeMap());

280     /***
281      * Create an empty instance
282      * 
283      */
284 	public Pie() {
285 	}
286 
287 	/***
288 	 * Start peer manager
289 	 * 
290      * @param integratePie	true if the pie is integrated with the repository as a peer,
291      * false if the pie is running standalone
292 	 */
293     public void startPeerManager(boolean integratePie) {
294         this.integratePie = integratePie;
295 	    if (!integratePie) {
296 	        interestedServices.add(Configuration.PIE_SERVICE_TYPE);
297 	        interestedServices.add(edu.uci.isr.impromptu.repository.Configuration.IMPROMPTU_SERVICE_TYPE);
298 	        myServiceInfo = new ServiceInfo(Configuration.PIE_SERVICE_TYPE, 
299 	                getName() + getCharacter(), Configuration.PIE_PORT_NONE, getName() + getCharacter());
300 	        pm = new PeerManager(this, Configuration.YANCEES_CONFIGURATION_FILE_SECONDARY);
301 	        pm.registerJmDNS();
302 	        if (log==null) {
303 	        }
304 	    }
305     }
306 
307     // If true, then the Pie is integrated with the proxy filter
308     private		boolean	integratePie = false;
309     /***
310      * Set the peer manager, used when the owner does not start its own manager
311      * @param pm	the peer manager that this owner should use
312      */
313     public void 	setPeerManager(PeerManager pm) {
314 	    if (this.pm == null) {
315 	        // If we have not got one peer manager.
316 	        // This is used when integrated with the proxy filter, 
317 	        // because we need this to send out messages.
318 	        this.pm = pm;
319 	        integratePie = true;
320 	    }
321     }
322 
323     private	boolean	leaving	= false;
324     /***
325      * Send out a leave notify message after the user chooses to exit the GUI
326      */
327     public void leaveNotify() {
328         if (peers.size()>1 && localPeer != null && localPeer.getPersistentFiles().size()>0) {
329             // There are more than just us, and we have some persistent files
330             // We only do persistent exchanges here. The eager policy, which 
331             // 		back up persistent files proactively when persistent files
332             //		are created and modified, still needs notifications of a 
333             //		peer's leaving. But with such notifications, it is also
334             //		possible to execute a lazy policy. 
335             leaving = true;
336             Map		leaveNotifyEvent = new HashMap();
337             leaveNotifyEvent.put(MessageProcessor.ATTR_PEER_NAME, 
338                     userName);
339             leaveNotifyEvent.put(MessageProcessor.ATTR_ACTION, 
340                 MessageProcessor.ACTION_LEAVE_NOTIFY);
341             pm.sendMessage(leaveNotifyEvent);
342             new Thread("Shutdown waiter") {
343                 public void run() {
344                     // wait 30000 seconds, 
345                     try {
346                         Thread.sleep(30000);
347                     }
348                     catch (InterruptedException e) {
349                     }
350                     // then shutdown
351                     log.debug("Having been waiting for too long");
352                     shutdown();
353                 }
354             }.start();
355         }
356         else {
357             shutdown();
358         }
359     }
360 
361     /***
362      * Whether we should take over a remote user's persistent files
363      * @param remoteUserName the name of the remote user
364      * @return true if we want to take over and keep servering that user's 
365      * persistent files, false if we do not want to do so
366      */
367     public boolean takePersistent(String remoteUserName) {
368         boolean	result = false;
369         int		peersSize = peers.size();
370         if (peersSize>1) {
371             // we take over if we are right after the remoteUserName in the pie
372             // The second condition is for the ring case: we are first and 
373             //	the remote is the last
374             int	localCardinal = localPeer.getCardinal() + peersSize;
375             int	remoteCardinal = ((SlicePeer)peers.get(remoteUserName)).getCardinal();
376             result = ((localCardinal - remoteCardinal) % peersSize == 1); 
377         }
378         return result;
379     }
380     
381     // A list of others' persistent files. Might contain more than one user's files
382     private List	othersPersistentFiles = Collections.synchronizedList(new ArrayList());
383     /***
384      * Copy a remote user's persistent files to our persistent directory
385      * @param remoteUserName the name of the remote user
386      */
387     public void savePersistent(String remoteUserName) {
388         List	p = ((SlicePeer)peers.get(remoteUserName)).getPersistentFiles();
389         for(Iterator i = p.iterator(); i.hasNext();) {
390             Dot		d = (Dot)i.next();
391             // copy each file to our own persisten directory
392             String	fileName = d.getFileName();
393             Platform.exportFile(fileName, Platform.getPersistentPrefix() + fileName);
394         }
395         // Use an add method, in case we are busy serving more than one remote user
396         othersPersistentFiles.addAll(p);
397     }
398 
399     /***
400      * Reimport a remote user's persistent files so we are their new owner
401      * @param remoteUserName the name of the remote user who has just left
402      */
403     public void reimportPersistent(String remoteUserName) {
404         // make a copy in case of concurrent modification
405         synchronized(othersPersistentFiles) {
406 	        List	p = new ArrayList();
407 	        for(Iterator i = othersPersistentFiles.iterator(); i.hasNext();) {
408 	            Dot		d = (Dot)i.next();
409 	            if (d.getOwner().getName().equals(remoteUserName)) {
410 	                // copy each file from our own persisten directory to its original place
411 	                File	file = new File(Platform.getPersistentPrefix() + d.getFileName());
412 	                if (doImportFile(file)) {
413 	                    doDrop(file, d.getLocation());
414 	                }
415 	                p.add(d);
416 	            }
417 	        }
418 	        othersPersistentFiles.removeAll(p);
419         }
420     }
421     
422     /***
423      * Send out a shutdown message, probably after receiving the backup holder's 
424      * leave continue message. 
425      */
426     public void shutdown() {
427         Platform.unmountDrive();
428 
429         if (pm != null) {
430 	        Map		shutdownEvent = new HashMap();
431 	        shutdownEvent.put(MessageProcessor.ATTR_PEER_NAME, 
432 	                userName);
433 	        shutdownEvent.put(MessageProcessor.ATTR_ACTION, 
434 	            MessageProcessor.ACTION_SHUTDOWN);
435 	        pm.sendMessage(shutdownEvent);
436         }
437 
438         // if we are not integrated, then exit directly
439         if (!integratePie) {
440             // give some time to Yancees 
441             try {
442                 Thread.sleep(2000);
443             }
444             catch (InterruptedException ie) {
445             }
446             log.debug("Exiting...");
447             System.exit(0);
448         }
449     }
450     
451     /***
452      * Get the ServiceInfo structure of the local peer
453      * @return the ServiceInfo
454      */
455     public ServiceInfo	getServiceInfo() {
456         return myServiceInfo;
457     }
458 
459     /***
460      * Get the services that this owner is interested
461      * @return a set of interested services
462      */
463     public Set getInterestedServices() {
464         return interestedServices;
465     }
466     
467 	/***
468 	 * Construct a pie, based on the loaded template. This is the real constructor.
469 	 * @param _document the template document
470 	 */
471     public void setDocument(SVGDocument _document) {
472         document = _document;
473 
474         // Must check the old attribute value against the new value. 
475         // 		If blindly setting the attribute with the same new value, it will trigger attribute
476         // 		"change" events whose handler generates null pointer exceptions
477         // Again, the template.svg must also be changed to reflect a new width/height
478         //		Batik seemingly won't catch up the width/height/viewbox update at svg element
479         //		after a document has been loaded (from the template)
480         // Cannot out smart each other.
481         Element svgRoot = document.getDocumentElement();
482         // width
483         String	oldAttribute = svgRoot.getAttribute(SVGConstants.SVG_WIDTH_ATTRIBUTE);
484         String  newAttribute = String.valueOf(Configuration.SIZE_VIEW_WIDTH);
485         if (!newAttribute.equals(oldAttribute))
486             svgRoot.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_WIDTH_ATTRIBUTE, newAttribute);
487         // height
488         oldAttribute = svgRoot.getAttribute(SVGConstants.SVG_HEIGHT_ATTRIBUTE);
489         newAttribute = String.valueOf(Configuration.SIZE_VIEW_HEIGHT);
490         if (!newAttribute.equals(oldAttribute))
491             svgRoot.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_HEIGHT_ATTRIBUTE, newAttribute);
492         // viewBox. A rather quick comparison, instead of a full analysis
493         oldAttribute = svgRoot.getAttribute(SVGConstants.SVG_VIEW_BOX_ATTRIBUTE);
494         newAttribute = "0 0 " + String.valueOf(Configuration.SIZE_VIEW_WIDTH) + ".0 " + 
495 						String.valueOf(Configuration.SIZE_VIEW_HEIGHT) + ".0";
496         if (!newAttribute.equals(oldAttribute)) {
497             svgRoot.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_VIEW_BOX_ATTRIBUTE, newAttribute);
498         }
499 
500         // Move original long procedure into the SVG stub template (clone node), 
501         // 		so this looks simple, and it becomes easy to change visual effects 
502         // Notes
503         //		filter is fixed
504         // 		tooltip is template
505         // 		dot uses a template. The same template is used as a dragging template. 
506         // 		original local mask code covers the center
507         
508         // get the empty textpath reference
509         textPath = document.getElementById(ID_TEXT_PATH); 
510         // get the template text for name
511         textTemplate = document.getElementById(ID_TEXT_TEMPLATE); 
512         // get private space
513         privateSpace = document.getElementById(ID_PRIVATE_SPACE);
514         privateSpace.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_WIDTH_ATTRIBUTE, String.valueOf(Configuration.SIZE_VIEW_WIDTH));
515         privateSpace.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_HEIGHT_ATTRIBUTE, String.valueOf(Configuration.SIZE_VIEW_HEIGHT));
516         // Get the peers 
517         peersGroup = document.getElementById(ID_PEERS);
518         // get the persistent space
519     	persistentSpace = document.getElementById(ID_PERSISTENT_SPACE);
520     	persistentSpace.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_R_ATTRIBUTE, String.valueOf(PieUtils.getRadius(SecurityConstants.LEVEL_PERSISTENT)));
521     	PieUtils.setTranslateCenter(persistentSpace);
522     	// get the local mask
523         localMask = document.getElementById(ID_LOCAL_MASK);
524         // get the local mask persistent
525     	localMaskPersistent = document.getElementById(ID_LOCAL_MASK_PERSISTENT);
526     	localMaskPersistent.setAttributeNS(null, SVGConstants.SVG_R_ATTRIBUTE, String.valueOf(PieUtils.getRadius(SecurityConstants.LEVEL_PERSISTENT)));
527     	PieUtils.setTranslateCenter(localMaskPersistent);
528     	// get the dragging dot
529         draggingDelegate = document.getElementById(ID_DRAGGING_DELEGATE);
530         draggingText = (Text)document.getElementById(ID_DRAGGING_TEXT).getFirstChild();
531   		// Get the tool tip
532         fileDescription = document.getElementById(ID_FILE_DESCRIPTION);
533         fileName = (Text)document.getElementById(ID_FILE_NAME).getFirstChild();
534         filePermission = (Text)document.getElementById(ID_FILE_PERMISSION).getFirstChild();
535         // get files
536         filesGroup = document.getElementById(ID_FILES);
537 
538         // always listen to Esc
539         ((EventTarget)localMask).addEventListener(SVGConstants.SVG_KEYPRESS_EVENT_TYPE, Pie.this, false);
540         ((EventTarget)privateSpace).addEventListener(SVGConstants.SVG_KEYPRESS_EVENT_TYPE, Pie.this, false);
541 
542         ourProperties = new Vector();
543         ourProperties.add(new PropertyName(NS_URI, PROPERTY_OWNER));
544         ourProperties.add(new PropertyName(NS_URI, PROPERTY_RADIUS));
545         ourProperties.add(new PropertyName(NS_URI, PROPERTY_ANGLE));
546     }
547
