##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
ACLManager xref
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
View Javadoc

1   /*
2    * Created on Apr 10, 2005
3    *
4    */
5   package edu.uci.isr.impromptu.security;
6   
7   import java.io.IOException;
8   import java.util.Arrays;
9   import java.util.Collection;
10  import java.util.Enumeration;
11  import java.util.HashMap;
12  import java.util.Iterator;
13  import java.util.Vector;
14  
15  import org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpException;
16  import org.apache.slide.common.NamespaceAccessToken;
17  import org.apache.slide.common.ServiceAccessException;
18  import org.apache.slide.common.SlideToken;
19  import org.apache.slide.security.AccessDeniedException;
20  import org.apache.slide.security.NodePermission;
21  import org.apache.slide.structure.ActionNode;
22  import org.apache.slide.structure.ObjectNotFoundException;
23  import org.apache.webdav.lib.Ace;
24  import org.apache.webdav.lib.Constants;
25  import org.apache.webdav.lib.Privilege;
26  import org.apache.webdav.lib.WebdavResource;
27  import org.apache.webdav.lib.properties.AclProperty;
28  
29  import edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common.Utils;
30  
31  /***
32   * Set Slide ACL for files.
33   * 
34   * @author Jie Ren
35   */
36  public class ACLManager {
37      /***
38       * Store the sharing levels of files
39       */
40      private HashMap levels = new HashMap();
41      /***
42       * The WebDAV connection
43       */
44  	private WebdavResource	impromptuServer;
45  
46  	/***
47  	 * Granted and revoked permissions for each level
48  	 */
49      private Vector[] granted = new Vector[SecurityConstants.LEVELS_PERMISSIONS.length];
50      private Vector[] revoked = new Vector[SecurityConstants.LEVELS_PERMISSIONS.length];
51  
52      /***
53       * This controls whether ACL is implemented at the client side (using ACL 
54       * WebDAV method) or at the server side (using Slide internals)
55       */
56      private boolean	aclAtClient = false;
57      /***
58       * Security Token to access Slide
59       */
60      private SlideToken	slideToken = null;
61      /***
62       * Namespace token
63       */
64      private NamespaceAccessToken token = null;
65      
66  	/***
67  	 * Create an ACL manager at the client side
68  	 * 
69  	 * @param impromptuServer the WebDAV connection used to get and set ACL
70  	 */
71  	public ACLManager(WebdavResource impromptuServer) {
72  	    this.impromptuServer = impromptuServer;
73  	    
74  	    // initialize permissions
75          for (int level = 0; level<SecurityConstants.LEVELS_PERMISSIONS.length; level++) {
76              Vector grant = new Vector();
77              Vector revoke = new Vector();
78  	        for (int i = 0; i < SecurityConstants.LEVELS_PERMISSIONS.length; ++i) {
79  	            String[] permissions = SecurityConstants.LEVELS_PERMISSIONS[i];
80  	            if (i <= level) {
81  	                grant.addAll(Arrays.asList(permissions));
82  	            }
83  	            else {
84  	                revoke.addAll(Arrays.asList(permissions));
85  	            }
86  	        }
87  	        granted[level] = grant;
88  	        revoked[level] = revoke;
89          }
90          
91          aclAtClient = true;
92  	}
93  	
94  	/***
95  	 * Create an ACL manager at the server side
96  	 *
97  	 */
98  	public ACLManager(NamespaceAccessToken token, SlideToken slideToken) {
99  	    this.token = token;
100 	    this.slideToken = slideToken;
101 
102 	    aclAtClient = false;
103     }
104 
105 	/***
106 	 * Set the security level for a file
107 	 * @param fileName	the file name
108 	 * @param role		the role name
109 	 * @param level		the sharing level
110 	 */
111     public void setSecurityLevel(String fileName, String role, int level) {
112         String	securityLevel = SecurityConstants.LEVELS_NAME[level];
113         
114         if (aclAtClient) {
115 	        Vector grant = granted[level];
116 	        Vector revoke = revoked[level];
117 	
118 	        try {
119 	            setPermissions(Utils.fileNameToURL(fileName), role, grant, revoke);
120 	        }
121 	        catch (Exception e) {
122 	            Utils.handleException(e);
123 	        }
124         }
125         else {
126             Vector	allPermissions = new Vector();
127             NodePermission	np;
128             String	objectUri = Utils.fileNameToContextPath(fileName);
129             String	subjectUri = SecurityUtils.getRolePathForServer(role);
130             if (role.equals(SecurityConstants.ME)) {
131                 // Grant me all permissions
132                 np = new NodePermission(objectUri, subjectUri, 
133                         ActionNode.ALL_URI, true, false);
134                 allPermissions.add(np);
135             }
136             else {
137                 // Grant others permissions appropriate to level
138                 for (int l = 0; l<SecurityConstants.LEVELS_ACTIONS.length; l++) {
139     	            String[] actions = SecurityConstants.LEVELS_ACTIONS[l];
140         	        for (int i = 0; i < actions.length; ++i) {
141         	            if (l <= level) {
142         	                np = new NodePermission(objectUri, subjectUri, 
143         	                        actions[i], true, false);
144         	            }
145         	            else {
146         	                np = new NodePermission(objectUri, subjectUri, 
147         	                        actions[i], true, true);
148         	            }
149         	            allPermissions.add(np);
150         	        }
151                 }
152             }
153             try {
154                 token.getSecurityHelper().setPermissions(slideToken, objectUri, allPermissions.elements());
155             }
156             catch (ObjectNotFoundException e) {
157                 Utils.handleException(e);
158             }
159             catch (AccessDeniedException e) {
160                 Utils.handleException(e);
161             }
162             catch (ServiceAccessException e) {
163                 Utils.handleException(e);
164             }
165         }
166 
167         levels.put(fileName + role, securityLevel);
168     }
169 
170     /***
171      * Get the security level for a file
172      * @param fileName the file name
173      * @param role	the role
174      * @return	the sharing level
175      */
176     public String getSecurityLevel(String fileName, String role) {
177         return (String) levels.get(fileName + role);
178     }
179 
180     /***
181      * Set permissions for a file path
182      * @param path		the URL path for the file
183      * @param role		the role name
184      * @param grant		granted permissions
185      * @param revoke	revoked permissions
186      */
187     private void setPermissions(String path, String role, Collection grant,
188             Collection revoke) {
189         // Use role as an indirection
190         // When the role is wrong here (localhost:8080), 
191         // 		we are still allowed read access, because "/" is configured for 
192         // 		read access for every one
193         String theRole = SecurityUtils.getRolePathForClient(role);
194 
195         try {
196             Ace othersDeniedAce = new Ace(theRole);
197             othersDeniedAce.setNegative(true);
198             Ace othersGrantedAce = new Ace(theRole);
199             othersGrantedAce.setNegative(false);
200 
201             AclProperty acl = impromptuServer.aclfindMethod(path); 
202             if (acl != null) {
203                 Ace[] aces = acl.getAces();
204                 if (aces != null ) {
205 	                for (int i = 0; i < aces.length; ++i) {
206 	                    // The principal can be anything : a role, a user, all, 
207 	                    if (aces[i].getPrincipal().equals(theRole)
208 	                            && !aces[i].isInherited()) {
209 	                        Enumeration e = aces[i].enumeratePrivileges();
210 	                        while(e.hasMoreElements()) {
211 		                        if (aces[i].isNegative()) {
212 		                            othersDeniedAce.addPrivilege((Privilege)e.nextElement());
213 		                        }
214 		                        else {
215 		                            othersGrantedAce.addPrivilege((Privilege)e.nextElement());
216 		                        }
217 	                        }
218 	                    }
219 	                }
220                 }
221             }
222 
223             if (grant != null) {
224 	            for (Iterator it = grant.iterator(); it.hasNext();) {
225 	                String permission = (String) it.next();
226 	                Privilege privilege = new Privilege(Constants.DAV, permission, null);
227 	                removePrivilege(othersDeniedAce, privilege);
228 	                addPrivilege(othersGrantedAce, privilege);
229 	            }
230             }
231 
232             if (revoke != null) {
233 	            for (Iterator it = revoke.iterator(); it.hasNext();) {
234 	                String permission = (String) it.next();
235 	                Privilege privilege = new Privilege(Constants.DAV, permission, null);
236 	                removePrivilege(othersGrantedAce, privilege);
237 	                addPrivilege(othersDeniedAce, privilege);
238 	            }
239             }
240 
241             Ace[] aces = new Ace[] { othersDeniedAce, othersGrantedAce };
242             impromptuServer.lockMethod(path);
243             impromptuServer.aclMethod(path, aces);
244             impromptuServer.unlockMethod(path);
245 
246         }
247         catch (HttpException e) {
248             Utils.handleException(e);
249         }
250         catch (IOException e) {
251             Utils.handleException(e);
252         }
253     }
254 
255     /***
256      * Add a privilege to an access control entry
257      * @param ace	the access control entry
258      * @param p		the privilege to add
259      */
260     private void addPrivilege(Ace ace, Privilege p) {
261         //check to see if ace already contains p
262         boolean contains = false;
263         for (Enumeration en = ace.enumeratePrivileges(); (en != null)
264                 && en.hasMoreElements();) {
265             Privilege temp = (Privilege) en.nextElement();
266             if (temp.getName().equals(p.getName())) {
267                 contains = true;
268             }
269         }
270         if (!contains) {
271             ace.addPrivilege(p);
272         }
273     }
274 
275     /***
276      * Remove a privilege from an access control entry
277      * @param ace	the access control entry
278      * @param p		the privilege to remove
279      */
280     private void removePrivilege(Ace ace, Privilege p) {
281         Vector removes = new Vector();
282         for (Enumeration en = ace.enumeratePrivileges(); (en != null)
283                 && en.hasMoreElements();) {
284             Privilege temp = (Privilege) en.nextElement();
285 
286             if (temp.getName().equals(p.getName())) {
287                 removes.addElement(p);
288             }
289         }
290         for (Iterator it = removes.iterator(); it.hasNext();) {
291             ace.removePrivilege((Privilege) it.next());
292         }
293     }
294 }

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
PeerOwner xref
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
View Javadoc

1   /*
2    * Created on Mar 25, 2005
3    *
4    */
5   package edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common;
6   
7   import java.util.Set;
8   
9   import javax.jmdns.ServiceInfo;
10  
11  /***
12   * An abstract peer owner. It can be the proxy servlet, the pie, or other type. 
13   * 
14   * @author Jie Ren
15   */
16  public interface PeerOwner extends MessageProcessor {
17      /***
18       * Set the name of the owner
19       * @param name the new name
20       */
21      public void		setName(String name);
22      /***
23       * Get the name of the owner
24       * @return the name of the owner
25       */
26      public String	getName();
27      /***
28       * Get the character of the owner
29       * @return an empty string if the owner runs as part of an integrated peer, 
30       * or a string descrbing whether it is a pie or a repository when running standalone
31       */
32      public String	getCharacter();
33  
34      /***
35       * Set the peer manager, used when the owner does not start its own manager
36       * @param pm	the peer manager that this owner should use
37       */
38      public void 	setPeerManager(PeerManager pm);
39      
40      /***
41       * Get the service info related to the owner, if any
42       * @return the related service info of the owner, null if there is none
43       */
44      public ServiceInfo		getServiceInfo();
45      
46      /***
47       * Get a list of services that this owner is interested in
48       * @return a set of interested services
49       */
50      public Set				getInterestedServices();
51      
52      /***
53       * Create a peer when a new peer joins
54       * 
55       * @param si the service info of the newly appeared peer
56       * @return	a newly created peer
57       */
58      public Peer				createAPeer(ServiceInfo si);
59  
60      /***
61       * Perform further initialization after the peer is created and added to 
62       * the peer manager
63       * 
64       * @param si the service info of the newly appeared peer
65       */
66      public void				afterCreateAPeer(ServiceInfo si);
67      
68      /***
69       * Destroy a peer when an old peer leaves
70       * 
71       * @param name the name of the removed peer
72       * @return	the old peer 
73       */
74      public Peer				destroyAPeer(String name);
75  }

Package edu.uci.isr.impromptu.repository



Class SummaryBufferedRequestWrapperWrap an http request so its input stream can be reused when aggregating 
 		from multiple repositories.CharResponseWrapperCharResponseWrapper wrapps the response of a servlet for a filter
 		Impromptu ProxyFilter uses it to find whether the resource is not
 		available locally and should be fetched from a remote repository
 Most code is copied from other sources.ConfigurationConfiguration of ImpromptuOverall ProxyFilterProxyFilter decides where an HTTP request should be handled.ProxyServlet RepositoryPeerRepositoryPeer represents each peer, either the local one or a remote one.RepositoryUtilsUtility methods.RootServletThis servlet, if used, is to report DAV support at the "/" level of a server

##------------------URL-------------------------##

How This API Document Is Organized

This API (Application Programming Interface) document has pages corresponding to the items in the navigation bar, described as follows.
Overview



The Overview page is the front page of this API document and provides a list of all packages with a summary for each.  This page can also contain an overall description of the set of packages.

Package



Each package has a page that contains a list of its classes and interfaces, with a summary for each. This page can contain four categories:Interfaces (italic)ClassesExceptionsErrors


Class/Interface



Each class, interface, nested class and nested interface has its own separate page. Each of these pages has three sections consisting of a class/interface description, summary tables, and detailed member descriptions:Class inheritance diagramDirect SubclassesAll Known SubinterfacesAll Known Implementing ClassesClass/interface declarationClass/interface description

Nested Class SummaryField SummaryConstructor SummaryMethod Summary

Field DetailConstructor DetailMethod Detail
Each summary entry contains the first sentence from the detailed description for that item. The summary entries are alphabetical, while the detailed descriptions are in the order they appear in the source code. This preserves the logical groupings established by the programmer.

Use

Each documented package, class and interface has its own Use page.  This page describes what packages, classes, methods, constructors and fields use any part of the given class or package. Given a class or interface A, its Use page includes subclasses of A, fields declared as A, methods that return A, and methods and constructors with parameters of type A.  You can access this page by first going to the package, class or interface, then clicking on the "Use" link in the navigation bar.

Tree (Class Hierarchy)

There is a Class Hierarchy page for all packages, plus a hierarchy for each package. Each hierarchy page contains a list of classes and a list of interfaces. The classes are organized by inheritance structure starting with java.lang.Object. The interfaces do not inherit from java.lang.Object.When viewing the Overview page, clicking on "Tree" displays the hierarchy for all packages.When viewing a particular package, class or interface page, clicking "Tree" displays the hierarchy for only that package.


Deprecated API

The Deprecated API page lists all of the API that have been deprecated. A deprecated API is not recommended for use, generally due to improvements, and a replacement API is usually given. Deprecated APIs may be removed in future implementations.

Index

The Index contains an alphabetic list of all classes, interfaces, constructors, methods, and fields.

Prev/Next
These links take you to the next or previous class, interface, package, or related page.
Frames/No Frames
These links show and hide the HTML frames.  All pages are available with or without frames.


Serialized Form
Each serializable or externalizable class has a description of its serialization fields and methods. This information is of interest to re-implementors, not to developers using the API. While there is no link in the navigation bar, you can get to this information by going to any serialized class and clicking "Serialized Form" in the "See also" section of the class description.



This help file applies to API documentation generated using the standard doclet.

 are represented as YANCEES events by the application.

Class SlideUserRealm

java.lang.Object
  edu.uci.isr.impromptu.security.SlideUserRealm

All Implemented Interfaces: org.mortbay.http.UserRealm

public class SlideUserRealmextends java.lang.Objectimplements org.mortbay.http.UserRealm

 Domain.xml file

Field Detail


ROLE_NOBODY

public static final java.lang.String ROLE_NOBODY
a role that no user can be in, to deni access of certain methods.
 		if an empty role list is given in web.xml, it essentially denies EVERYTHING

ATTR_LEVEL

public static final java.lang.String ATTR_LEVEL
The sharing level of a newly added or moved file. 
 This, instead of radius, is the one that a repository cares.
 The repository can calcuate this from a radius, but letting the pie
 do the calculation can localize knowledge about radius.

VERSION

See Also:Constant Field Values




PROPERTY_FILE

public static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_FILE
The name of the configuration property file. Contains both repository and 
 pie configurations.

See Also:Constant Field Values




FILES_PATH

public static final java.lang.String FILES_PATH
The path under the context path that leads to the exposed files.
 Slide has /users, /roles, and /files. To enable security, we need to 
 expose /users, which requires files to be exposed through /files, not
 directly as "". See the scope init_param in web.xml.

See Also:Constant Field Values




FILES_PATH_WITHOUT_TRAILING

public static final java.lang.String FILES_PATH_WITHOUT_TRAILING
The same path as above, but without the trailing slash.
 
 Windows Redirector uses this format. Jetty's SecurityConstraint needs this 
 format to recognize that proper authentication is needed.

See Also:Constant Field Values




CONTEXT_PATH

public static final java.lang.String CONTEXT_PATH
The context path for the proxy. Used by pie and security

See Also:Constant Field Values

edu.uci.isr.impromptu.pie

Class Pie

java.lang.Object
  edu.uci.isr.impromptu.pie.Pie

All Implemented Interfaces: org.w3c.dom.events.EventListener, MessageProcessor, PeerOwner

public class Pieextends java.lang.Objectimplements org.w3c.dom.events.EventListener, PeerOwner


This is the Pie client for the proxy. It connects to the Proxy,
 displays available files, using special properties (owner, level, position) it finds.
 It can also change these properties, when the user drags files.
 It allows user open files, using simple start/open command.
 The whole pie assumes a file with a certain name only belongs to one peer, so two
 peers cannot have files with the same name.



Author:Jie Ren

edu.uci.isr.impromptu.pie

Class Coordinate

java.lang.Object
  edu.uci.isr.impromptu.pie.Coordinate


public class Coordinateextends java.lang.Object


Coordinate for a dot. Copied from Kari's code.
 The center of the pie is (0,0). 
 The radius and theta is just like normal polar system.
 X increases rightwards. Y increases downwards.



Author:Jie Ren













Constructor SummaryCoordinate(double _radius,
           double _relativeAngle,
           int _peers,
           int _cardinal)


          Create a coordiante.Coordinate(java.awt.Point point,
           int _peers,
           int _cardinal)

Whether the current file is newer than the original file

Parameters:current - the current file nameoriginal - the original file name
Returns:true if newer, false otherwise. Return true only on Windows, since
 Mac webdav driver does not honor the original setLastModified request in import

service

public java.lang.Object service(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                                boolean forward,
                                boolean identifySelf)
Execute a request towards this (remote) peer. It is invoked by the filter
 		to direct the request to an owner peer. This method executes a HttpClient
 		call and forward the response back to the original client. This extra 
 		round trip affects performance.


Parameters:request - the original requestresponse - the original responseforward - if true, then the response from the method will be 
 						forwarded to the original response.identifySelf - whether the method should add a header to identify itself
Returns:the response body of the execution, can be either a string or a XML document

ProxyFilter (Impromptu Workspace 0.30 API)
##------------------TEXT------------------------##

edu.uci.isr.impromptu.repository

Class ProxyFilter

java.lang.Object
  edu.uci.isr.impromptu.repository.ProxyFilter

All Implemented Interfaces: javax.servlet.Filter, MessageProcessor, PeerOwner

public class ProxyFilterextends java.lang.Objectimplements javax.servlet.Filter, PeerOwner


ProxyFilter decides where an HTTP request should be handled. If one peers
 owns the file mentioned in the request, the request goes to that peer. This
 could be the local peer. If no one owns the file, then the request goes to
 the local peer, so the local peer might create the file This is a request
 filter. A response filter does not fulfill our needs. Simple redirect does
 not work with WebDAV methods other than GET.



Author:Jie Ren










Field Summary
static java.lang.StringATTRIBUTE_NAME


          The attribte name for the proxy filter, to be put in the servlet context

edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common

Class YanceesJmDNSService

java.lang.Object
  edu.uci.isr.yancees.server.service.AbstractService
      edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common.YanceesJmDNSService

All Implemented Interfaces: edu.uci.isr.yancees.server.service.ServiceInterface

public class YanceesJmDNSServiceextends edu.uci.isr.yancees.server.service.AbstractService


A Yancees plug in for JmDNS 1.0RC2, based on Roberto's code

 This service connects YANCESS with its peers in a subnetwork. It uses the
 service location protocol (SLP)



Author:Jie Ren







Nested Class Summary

publishToPeers

public void publishToPeers(edu.uci.isr.yancees.EventInterface evt)
Propagates, or publishes an event in all the peers of the network. Note
 that for this operation, we do not use the regular publishing interface
 of YANCEES as a way to prevent repeated circular publishing of events.

Parameters:evt - is the event to be propagated to the other peers.




publishToPeers

public void publishToPeers(edu.uci.isr.yancees.EventInterface[] evtList)
Propagates, or publishes an event in all the peers of the network. Note
 that for this operation, we do not use the regular publishing interface
 of YANCEES as a way to prevent repeated circular publishing of events.

Parameters:evtList - is the event list to be propagated to the other peers.

edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common

Class YanceesConnector

java.lang.Object
  edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common.YanceesConnector

All Implemented Interfaces: edu.uci.isr.yancees.SubscriberInterface

public class YanceesConnectorextends java.lang.Objectimplements edu.uci.isr.yancees.SubscriberInterface


Yancees connector to send and receive events. This is the Yancess interface 
 between the peer owners (repository or pie) and the Yancees middleware.
 
 The peer manager discovers present peers, and uses this class to interact 
 with Yancees. This class forwards the available peers to the service. 
   
 TODO: architecture: make this ArchStudio compatible and delivery independent



Author:Jie Ren

                 java.lang.String configurationFileName)


          Create a Yancees peer

peerJoin

public void peerJoin(java.lang.String peerName,
                     java.lang.String peerAddress)
Tell the service that a new peer has joined.
 Yancees maintains a different set of peers than the proxyFilter or 
 the pie for a separate configuration. Yancees needs to deliver to
 every one, but the repository signifies the presense of a peer. Still,
 this is somewhat artificial.


Parameters:peerName - the name of the newly joined peerpeerAddress - the address of the newly joined peer




peerLeave

public void peerLeave(java.lang.String peerName)
Tell the service that a peer has left


Parameters:peerName - the name of the newly left peer

edu.uci.isr.impromptu.pocketpc

Interface PeerQueryProtocol

public interface PeerQueryProtocol


PeerQuery properties and commands used to compose the protocol PDUs, which
 are represented as YANCEES events by the application.
 
 This class basically stores those properties and types as constants.



Author:rsilvafi
 class created at Jul 29, 2005

edu.uci.isr.impromptu.pocketpc

Class PeerQueryServer

java.lang.Object
  edu.uci.isr.impromptu.pocketpc.PeerQueryServer

All Implemented Interfaces: MessageProcessor

public class PeerQueryServerextends java.lang.Objectimplements MessageProcessor


Responds to events requesting a current snapshot of all the peers and their
 files. This is used by the pocket PC to inquire about the existing peers and
 their files, at bootstrap.
 
 This class is currently instantiated inside the ProxyFilter, the PeerManager
 passed in the constructor.



Author:rsilvafi class created at Jul 27, 2005

public void processMessage(java.util.Map message)

Specified by:processMessage in interface MessageProcessor

generateListGlobalFilesRESPONSE

protected java.util.Map generateListGlobalFilesRESPONSE(java.lang.String sessionId)
We pack a list of files, with their owners/name, and their sharing level
 in order to send the results back to the requestor.


Parameters:sessionId - is the identifier of the request that will issue in this
            response
Returns:a list of existing peers and their files in the format of a hashMap.
 the peer name comes cateated with each attribute name (i.e. file name), together with the 
 current sharing level as the attribute value.

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
PasswordManager (Impromptu Workspace 0.30 API)
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
Overview     Package   Class     Use     Tree     Deprecated     Index     Help 



 PREV CLASS 
 NEXT CLASS
  FRAMES

  SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

edu.uci.isr.impromptu.security

Class PasswordManager

java.lang.Object
  edu.uci.isr.impromptu.security.PasswordManager


public class PasswordManagerextends java.lang.Object


Uses Diffie-Hellman to exchange secretes that are used as passwords.
 
 The ideal is a secure single sign on, so we can have easy-to-setup security.
 
 If we use Basic Authentication, it is inherently insecure, to wihch 
 we can mitigate with a crytp/MD5, which also reduces the problem of
 storing my secure on another person's computer.
 
 But we should use Digest Authentication, which requires recoerable
 password on the server side. We do not want to transfer such secret
 in clear text, so we use Diffie-Hellman to generate such secrets.
 
 The problem is, it is a shared secret between a pair, so the pie can
 no longer just use one secret (my secret) to authenticate into everyone.
 Now the proxy has to use the many secrets to authenticate into every other
 person. This is acceptable, and maybe desirable, since we do not want 
 to store our secrets into others. 
 
 TODO: security: protocol: this needs a revisit once we are more familiar with PKI.



Author:Jie Ren










Field Summary
static java.lang.StringPUBLIC_KEY_FIRST


           
static java.lang.StringPUBLIC_KEY_SECOND

          Initialize the private and public key pair.

edu.uci.isr.impromptu.repository

Class CharResponseWrapper

java.lang.Object
  javax.servlet.ServletResponseWrapper
      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponseWrapper
          org.apache.slide.webdav.logger.StatusHttpServletResponseWrapper
              edu.uci.isr.impromptu.repository.CharResponseWrapper

All Implemented Interfaces: javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse, javax.servlet.ServletResponse

public class CharResponseWrapperextends org.apache.slide.webdav.logger.StatusHttpServletResponseWrapper


CharResponseWrapper wrapps the response of a servlet for a filter
 		Impromptu ProxyFilter uses it to find whether the resource is not
 		available locally and should be fetched from a remote repository
 Most code is copied from other sources. This class should be part of the standard.
 This might not be used if we choose to filter the request instead of the response



Author:Jie Ren










Field Summary
 
Fields inherited from interface javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponseSC_ACCEPTED, SC_BAD_GATEWAY, SC_BAD_REQUEST, SC_CONFLICT, SC_CONTINUE, SC_CREATED, SC_EXPECTATION_FAILED, SC_FORBIDDEN, SC_FOUND, SC_GATEWAY_TIMEOUT, SC_GONE, SC_HTTP_VERSION_NOT_SUPPORTED, SC_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, SC_LENGTH_REQUIRED, SC_METHOD_NOT_ALLOWED, SC_MOVED_PERMANENTLY, SC_MOVED_TEMPORARILY, SC_MULTIPLE_CHOICES, SC_NO_CONTENT, SC_NON_AUTHORITATIVE_INFORMATION, SC_NOT_ACCEPTABLE, SC_NOT_FOUND, SC_NOT_IMPLEMENTED, SC_NOT_MODIFIED, SC_OK, SC_PARTIAL_CONTENT, SC_PAYMENT_REQUIRED, SC_PRECONDITION_FAILED, SC_PROXY_AUTHENTICATION_REQUIRED, SC_REQUEST_ENTITY_TOO_LARGE, SC_REQUEST_TIMEOUT, SC_REQUEST_URI_TOO_LONG, SC_REQUESTED_RANGE_NOT_SATISFIABLE, SC_RESET_CONTENT, SC_SEE_OTHER, SC_SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE, SC_SWITCHING_PROTOCOLS, SC_TEMPORARY_REDIRECT, SC_UNAUTHORIZED, SC_UNSUPPORTED_MEDIA_TYPE, SC_USE_PROXY

Parameters:name - the name

getColorFromString

public static java.awt.Color getColorFromString(java.lang.String color)
Get a color based on a string representation

Parameters:color - the color string. Can be either "#rrggbb", or a color name like "blue".
Returns:a Color. null if the string is irrecognizable.

Returns:a color if the service info specifies a color, null otherwise

                                                           double y,
                                                           double startAngle)
Get a string of both translation and rotation

Parameters:x - horizontal offsety - vertical offsetstartAngle - rotation angle
Returns:a string as "translate(x, y) rotate(-startAngle)"




getRadius

public static double getRadius(int level)
Get the radius for a sharing level. This does not exactly correspond to the 
 sharing level. The outermost ring is a colorful marker. The radius for inner 
 circle is not retrieved through this.

Parameters:level - the sharing level
Returns:the radius of the circle




getSharingLevel

public static int getSharingLevel(double radius)
Get the sharing level for a radius

Parameters:radius - the input radius. The larger the radius, the lower the sharing level.
Returns:the shairing level that the radius falls into




calculateDforClosePath

public static java.lang.String calculateDforClosePath(double radius,
                                                      double arcAngle)
Calculate a "d" value for a close path

Parameters:radius - the radiusarcAngle - the angle
Returns:the d string for the close path

                                                 int pieNum)

Parameters:radius - the radiuspieNum - the number of slices
Returns:a "d" string

getDefaultSecureRadius

public static double getDefaultSecureRadius()
Get a default radius that is secure

Returns:a value between 1 and 1.01, which designates the private space

edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common

Interface Peer
All Known Implementing Classes: RepositoryPeer, SlicePeer

public interface Peer


An abstract peer. It can be a repostiory peer, a pie peer, or other type.



Author:Jie Ren

                         double radius,

The peer has added a file.

Parameters:fileName - the name of the newly added fileradius - the relative radius (between 0 and 1) of the newly added file. 
 		This might be null if another application creates the fileangle - the relative angle (between 0 and 1) of the newly added file.
 		This might be null if another application creates the file

edu.uci.isr.impromptu.security

Class LevelHandler

java.lang.Object
  org.mortbay.http.handler.AbstractHttpHandler
      edu.uci.isr.impromptu.security.LevelHandler

All Implemented Interfaces: org.mortbay.http.HttpHandler, org.mortbay.util.LifeCycle, java.io.Serializable

public class LevelHandlerextends org.mortbay.http.handler.AbstractHttpHandler


Use Jetty's mechanisms to set allowed methods.
 This class is called during handling of "add/remove file" messages.
 Need this extra event commuinication channel to configure HTTP.
 For Slide security issues (WebDAV ACL), Slide allows a proprietary method
 for creating users, and WebDAV ACL method is the standard to set ACL.



Author:Jie RenSee Also:Serialized Form

Method Detail


initialize

public void initialize(org.mortbay.http.HttpContext context)
Initialize the handler. Set security on the top level.

Parameters:context - the context of the web application




setSecurityLevelForOthers

public void setSecurityLevelForOthers(java.lang.String fileName,
                                      int level)
Set the security level of a file for the role "others". Also allow "me" 
 	to do anything. 
 There are two roles, by design. One is "me", the other is "others".
 "Me" can do anything. "Others" is subject to security constraints set by "me".
 
 This is a policy method which uses the Jetty security constraints mechanism.
 That mechanism prevents setting me statically because it does not provide
 a way to retrieve and update security constraints. It only allows "add" and "clear".

Parameters:fileName - the name of the filelevel - the sharing level. If the level is -1, it is not even in the private space.




getSecurityLevel

public java.lang.String getSecurityLevel(java.lang.String path,
                                         java.lang.String role)
Get the security level of a file to a role

Parameters:path - the file pathrole - the role to which the file is secured
Returns:the sharing level of the file




handle

public void handle(java.lang.String pathInContext,
                   java.lang.String pathParams,
                   org.mortbay.http.HttpRequest request,
                   org.mortbay.http.HttpResponse response)
Dumy handle method

edu.uci.isr.impromptu.security

Class UserManager

java.lang.Object
  edu.uci.isr.impromptu.security.UserManager


public class UserManagerextends java.lang.Object


This class controls how user authentication should be done.
 It controls what password is for me.
 It also controls whether me will blindly accept any requests, 
 		or it will reject certain users. For accepted users, it
 		controls what their passwords should be.



Author:Jie Ren













Constructor SummaryUserManager(SlideUserRealm uraa,
            org.apache.webdav.lib.WebdavResource impromptuServer)


          Create a user manager

edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common

Class PeerManager

java.lang.Object
  edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common.PeerManager

All Implemented Interfaces: java.util.EventListener, javax.jmdns.ServiceListener, javax.jmdns.ServiceTypeListener

public class PeerManagerextends java.lang.Objectimplements javax.jmdns.ServiceListener, javax.jmdns.ServiceTypeListener


RepositoryPeer Manager uses JmDNS to manage present peers  
 for a peer owner. The rationale is to reuse this in 
 both the pie and the repository.



Author:Jie Ren

getOwnerPeer

public Peer getOwnerPeer(java.lang.String filename)
Get owner of a file.
 If the file is owned by any peer, the owing peer would be returned.
 This might well be the local peer.
 If the file is owned by no one, then it will go to the local peer, 
 where it would be created.


Parameters:filename - the name of the file
Returns:the owner peer. Null if no current owner;




sendMessage

public void sendMessage(java.util.Map message)
Send out a message


Parameters:message - the message to send out

edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common

Class YanceesFilter

java.lang.Object
  edu.uci.isr.yancees.filter.AbstractFilter
      edu.uci.isr.impromptu.common.YanceesFilter

All Implemented Interfaces: edu.uci.isr.yancees.filter.FilterInterface

public class YanceesFilterextends edu.uci.isr.yancees.filter.AbstractFilter


this filter redirects all events published using this YANCEEs instance, to
 all the JmDNS peers in the network. For such, it uses the services provided
 by the JmDNSService which should be installed as a local service.

 Copied from Roberto's code from file PeerPublisherInputFilter in Yancees

 Note that this is the old way, the 0.7 way of defining a filter. The new
 YANCEES uses another interface here.



Author:Jie Ren













Constructor SummaryYanceesFilter()

edu.uci.isr.impromptu.pie

Class Dot

java.lang.Object
  edu.uci.isr.impromptu.pie.Dot

All Implemented Interfaces: org.w3c.dom.events.EventListener

public class Dotextends java.lang.Objectimplements org.w3c.dom.events.EventListener


A dot, for a file. Adapted from Ben Pillet's code.
 
 Its coordinate is described by both a relative radius and relative dot.

 The radius tells how far the dot is relative to the center of the pie. 
 A 0 is at the center, a value less than 1 is within the pie (and shared),
 and a value larger than 1 is within the private space (thus not shared).
 Such a relative radius allows different peers have different dimensions.
 
 The angle tells where within the slice the dot lies. So when peers join 
 and leave the dot can remain in a "stable" position.
 
 These properties are also stored in the repository for future use.



Author:Jie Ren













Constructor SummaryDot(org.w3c.dom.svg.SVGDocument _document,
    java.lang.String _fileName,
    java.awt.Color _uColor,
    SlicePeer _owner)

setLocation

public void setLocation(double radius,
                        double angle,
                        int peers,
                        int cardinal)
Set the location of this dot, with relative coordiante
 This is supposed to be used to add files from other peers.
 The radius and angle are all relative values.


Parameters:radius - the relative radius. 0 is the center, less than 1 
 							is within the pie, larger than 1 is privateangle - the relative angle among the slice between 0 and 1peers - the number of present peerscardinal - the relative position of this peer




setLocation

public void setLocation(java.awt.Point p,
                        int peers,
                        int cardinal)
Set the location of this dot, with absolute coordiante
 This is used to support dropping a file by a local peer.


Parameters:p - the x,y coordinatepeers - the number of present peerscardinal - the relative position of this peer

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
Public Transportation - Wiki for Paul Dourish's Research Group
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
Public Transportation
	  
	    From Wiki for Paul Dourish's Research Group
	    
	    	    	    
	    Team Members:

 Johanna Brewer
 David H. Nguyen


Routes:

 Route 57


Todo:

 IRB
 get OCTA pass
 get OCTA schedules
 go on a few joy rides


Definitely Related Work:

In the Metro by Marc Auge
73 Urban Journeys by Kat Jungnickel
Mind the Gap: The ‘Tube Map’ as London’s User Interface by Janet Vertesi

Probable Related Work:

Underground Woman: My Four Years As a New York City Subway Conductor by Marian Swerdlow
Underground Harmonies: Music and Politics in the Subways of New York by Susie J. Tanenbaum 


Possible Related work:

Regulation of Intercity Bus Fares: The Problem of Cost Analysis
Mass Transit Utilization: Individual Response Data Inputs
Firm Size and Operating Costs in Urban Bus Transportation
Optimization and Scale Economies in Urban Bus Transportation
Public Transportation
A Study of the Motor-Bus as a Competitor of the Railroads
Geography of City Terrain Based on Bus Routes
On Competition and Product Differentiation in Urban Transportation: The San Francisco Bay Area
Transportation Controls and the Spatial Structure of Urban Areas
Innovative Approaches to Urban Transportation Planning




Retrieved from "http://drzaius.ics.uci.edu/wiki/index.php/Public_Transportation"

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
Create an account or log in - Wiki for Paul Dourish's Research Group
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
Create an account or log in
	  
	    From Wiki for Paul Dourish's Research Group
	    
	    	    	    
	    	Log in:
	You must have cookies enabled to log in to Wiki for Paul Dourish's Research Group.

	Username:
				
			
				Remember me
			Password:
				
			
				
			 
				
					Fields marked with superscripts are optional.  Storing an email address enables people to contact you through the website without you having to reveal your
email address to them, and it can be used to send you a new password if you forget it.Your real name, if you choose to provide it, will be used for giving you attribution for your work.
					
				
			

 

Retrieved from "http://drzaius.ics.uci.edu/wiki/index.php/Special:Userlogin"

##------------------URL-------------------------##
http://drzaius.ics.uci.edu/wiki/index.php/Special:Export
##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
Export pages - Wiki for Paul Dourish's Research Group
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
Export pages
	  
	    From Wiki for Paul Dourish's Research Group
	    
	    	    	    
	    You can export the text and editing history of a particular page or
set of pages wrapped in some XML. In the future, this may then be imported into another
wiki running MediaWiki software, although there is no support for this feature in the
current version.
To export article pages, enter the titles in the text box below, one title per line, and
select whether you want the current version as well as all old versions, with the page
history lines, or just the current version with the info about the last edit.
In the latter case you can also use a link, e.g. Special:Export/Train for the
article Train.





Include only the current revision, not the full history



Retrieved from "http://drzaius.ics.uci.edu/wiki/index.php/Special:Export"

ta['pt-userpage'] = new Array('.','My user page');
ta['pt-anonuserpage'] = new Array('.','The user page for the ip you\'re editing as');
ta['pt-mytalk'] = new Array('n','My talk page');
ta['pt-anontalk'] = new Array('n','Discussion about edits from this ip address');
ta['pt-preferences'] = new Array('','My preferences');
ta['pt-watchlist'] = new Array('l','The list of pages you\'re monitoring for changes.');
ta['pt-mycontris'] = new Array('y','List of my contributions');
ta['pt-login'] = new Array('o','You are encouraged to log in, it is not mandatory however.');
ta['pt-anonlogin'] = new Array('o','You are encouraged to log in, it is not mandatory however.');
ta['pt-logout'] = new Array('o','Log out');
ta['ca-talk'] = new Array('t','Discussion about the content page');
ta['ca-edit'] = new Array('e','You can edit this page. Please use the preview button before saving.');
ta['ca-addsection'] = new Array('+','Add a comment to this discussion.');
ta['ca-viewsource'] = new Array('e','This page is protected. You can view its source.');
ta['ca-history'] = new Array('h','Past versions of this page.');
ta['ca-protect'] = new Array('=','Protect this page');
ta['ca-delete'] = new Array('d','Delete this page');

ta['ca-move'] = new Array('m','Move this page');

ta['ca-unwatch'] = new Array('w','Remove this page from your watchlist');

			addedwatchtextTalk
		
The page "$1" has been added to your [[Special:Watchlist|watchlist]].
Future changes to this page and its associated Talk page will be listed there,
and the page will appear '''bolded''' in the [[Special:Recentchanges|list of recent changes]] to
make it easier to pick out.

<p>If you want to remove the page from your watchlist later, click "Unwatch" in the sidebar.

			anontalkpagetextTalk
		
----''This is the discussion page for an anonymous user who has not created an account yet or who does not use it. We therefore have to use the numerical [[IP address]] to identify him/her. Such an IP address can be shared by several users. If you are an anonymous user and feel that irrelevant comments have been directed at you, please [[Special:Userlogin|create an account or log in]] to avoid future confusion with other anonymous users.'' 
		
----''This is the discussion page for an anonymous user who has not created an account yet or who does not use it. We therefore have to use the numerical [[IP address]] to identify him/her. Such an IP address can be shared by several users. If you are an anonymous user and feel that irrelevant comments have been directed at you, please [[Special:Userlogin|create an account or log in]] to avoid future confusion with other anonymous users.''

			clearyourcacheTalk
		
'''Note:''' After saving, you may have to bypass your browser's cache to see the changes. '''Mozilla / Firefox / Safari:''' hold down ''Shift'' while clicking ''Reload'', or press ''Ctrl-Shift-R'' (''Cmd-Shift-R'' on Apple Mac); '''IE:''' hold ''Ctrl'' while clicking ''Refresh'', or press ''Ctrl-F5''; '''Konqueror:''': simply click the ''Reload'' button, or press ''F5''; '''Opera''' users may need to completely clear their cache in ''Tools&rarr;Preferences''.

Please note that all contributions to {{SITENAME}} are
considered to be released under the $2 (see $1 for details).

at will, then don't submit it here.<br />
You are also promising us that you wrote this yourself, or copied it from a
public domain or similar free resource.
<strong>DO NOT SUBMIT COPYRIGHTED WORK WITHOUT PERMISSION!</strong>

email address to them, and it can be used to send you a new password if you forget it.<br /><br />Your real name, if you choose to provide it, will be used for giving you attribution for your work.

Dear $WATCHINGUSERNAME,

the {{SITENAME}} page $PAGETITLE has been $CHANGEDORCREATED on $PAGEEDITDATE by $PAGEEDITOR, see $PAGETITLE_URL for the current version.

$NEWPAGE

Editor's summary: $PAGESUMMARY $PAGEMINOREDIT

Contact the editor:
mail: $PAGEEDITOR_EMAIL
wiki: $PAGEEDITOR_WIKI

There will be no other notifications in case of further changes unless you visit this page. You could also reset the notification flags for all your watched pages on your watchlist.

             Your friendly {{SITENAME}} notification system

--
To change your watchlist settings, visit
{{SERVER}}{{localurl:Special:Watchlist/edit}}

Feedback and further assistance:
{{SERVER}}{{localurl:Help:Contents}}

			explainconflictTalk
		
Someone else has changed this page since you
started editing it.
The upper text area contains the page text as it currently exists.
Your changes are shown in the lower text area.
You will have to merge your changes into the existing text.
<b>Only</b> the text in the upper text area will be saved when you
press "Save page".<br />
		
			exportTalk

			exportcuronlyTalk
		
Include only the current revision, not the full history
		
			exporttextTalk
		
You can export the text and editing history of a particular page or
set of pages wrapped in some XML. In the future, this may then be imported into another
wiki running MediaWiki software, although there is no support for this feature in the
current version.

To export article pages, enter the titles in the text box below, one title per line, and
select whether you want the current version as well as all old versions, with the page
history lines, or just the current version with the info about the last edit.

In the latter case you can also use a link, e.g. [[{{ns:Special}}:Export/Train]] for the
article [[Train]].

		
You can export the text and editing history of a particular page or
set of pages wrapped in some XML. In the future, this may then be imported into another
wiki running MediaWiki software, although there is no support for this feature in the
current version.

To export article pages, enter the titles in the text box below, one title per line, and
select whether you want the current version as well as all old versions, with the page
history lines, or just the current version with the info about the last edit.

In the latter case you can also use a link, e.g. [[{{ns:Special}}:Export/Train]] for the
article [[Train]].

<form method="get" action="http://www.google.com/search" id="googlesearch">
    <input type="hidden" name="domains" value="{{SERVER}}" />
    <input type="hidden" name="num" value="50" />
    <input type="hidden" name="ie" value="$2" />
    <input type="hidden" name="oe" value="$2" />

    <input type="text" name="q" size="31" maxlength="255" value="$1" />
    <input type="submit" name="btnG" value="$3" />
  <div>
    <input type="radio" name="sitesearch" id="gwiki" value="{{SERVER}}" checked="checked" /><label for="gwiki">{{SITENAME}}</label>
    <input type="radio" name="sitesearch" id="gWWW" value="" /><label for="gWWW">WWW</label>
  </div>
</form>

			movepageTalk
		
Move page
		
			movepagebtnTalk
		
Move page
		
			movepagetalktextTalk
		
The associated talk page, if any, will be automatically moved along with it '''unless:'''
*You are moving the page across namespaces,
*A non-empty talk page already exists under the new name, or
*You uncheck the box below.

In those cases, you will have to move or merge the page manually if desired.
		
			movepagetextTalk
		
Using the form below will rename a page, moving all
of its history to the new name.
The old title will become a redirect page to the new title.
Links to the old page title will not be changed; be sure to
check for double or broken redirects.
You are responsible for making sure that links continue to
point where they are supposed to go.

Note that the page will '''not''' be moved if there is already
a page at the new title, unless it is empty or a redirect and has no
past edit history. This means that you can rename a page back to where
it was just renamed from if you make a mistake, and you cannot overwrite
an existing page.

<b>WARNING!</b>
This can be a drastic and unexpected change for a popular page;
please be sure you understand the consequences of this before
proceeding.

Reason

			sitestatstextTalk
		
There are '''$1''' total pages in the database.
This includes "talk" pages, pages about {{SITENAME}}, minimal "stub"
pages, redirects, and others that probably don't qualify as content pages.
Excluding those, there are '''$2''' pages that are probably legitimate
content pages.

There have been a total of '''$3''' page views, and '''$4''' page edits
since the wiki was setup.
That comes to '''$5''' average edits per page, and '''$6''' views per edit.

			uploadtextTalk
		

Use the form below to upload new files,
to view or search previously uploaded images
go to the [[Special:Imagelist|list of uploaded files]],
uploads and deletions are also logged in the [[Special:Log|project log]].

You must also check the box affirming that you are not
violating any copyrights by uploading the file.
Press the "Upload" button to finish the upload.

To include the image in a page, use a link in the form
'''<nowiki>[[{{ns:6}}:file.jpg]]</nowiki>''',
'''<nowiki>[[{{ns:6}}:file.png|alt text]]</nowiki>''' or
'''<nowiki>[[{{ns:-2}}:file.ogg]]</nowiki>''' for directly linking to the file.

		

Use the form below to upload new files,
to view or search previously uploaded images
go to the [[Special:Imagelist|list of uploaded files]],
uploads and deletions are also logged in the [[Special:Log|project log]].

You must also check the box affirming that you are not
violating any copyrights by uploading the file.
Press the "Upload" button to finish the upload.

To include the image in a page, use a link in the form
'''<nowiki>[[{{ns:6}}:file.jpg]]</nowiki>''',
'''<nowiki>[[{{ns:6}}:file.png|alt text]]</nowiki>''' or
'''<nowiki>[[{{ns:-2}}:file.ogg]]</nowiki>''' for directly linking to the file.

			val_form_noteTalk
		
'''Hint:''' Merging your data means that for the article revision you select, all options where you have specified ''no opinion'' will be set to the value and comment of the most recent revision for which you have expressed an opinion. For example, if you want to change a single option for a newer revision, but also keep your other settings for this article in this revision, just select which option you intend to ''change'', and merging will fill in the other options with your previous settings.

##------------------URL-------------------------##
http://drzaius.ics.uci.edu/wiki/index.php/Special:Statistics
##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
Statistics - Wiki for Paul Dourish's Research Group
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
Statistics
	  
	    From Wiki for Paul Dourish's Research Group
	    
	    	    	    
	    Wiki for Paul Dourish's Research Group statistics
There are 1,322 total pages in the database.
This includes "talk" pages, pages about Wiki for Paul Dourish's Research Group, minimal "stub"
pages, redirects, and others that probably don't qualify as content pages.
Excluding those, there are 8 pages that are probably legitimate
content pages.
There have been a total of 753,703 page views, and 387 page edits
since the wiki was setup.
That comes to 0.29 average edits per page, and 1,947.55 views per edit.

User statistics
There are 252 registered users, of which
2 (or 0.79%) are administrators (see Project:Administrators).

Retrieved from "http://drzaius.ics.uci.edu/wiki/index.php/Special:Statistics"

You can narrow down the view by selecting a log type, the user name, or the affected page.

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
Archive of previous quarters - Wiki for Paul Dourish's Research Group
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
Archive of previous quarters
	  
	    From Wiki for Paul Dourish's Research Group
	    
	    	    	    
	    See also current schedule of Informatics Department Seminars.

Contents
1 Academic Year 2004-05
1.1 Fall Quarter 20041.2 Winter Quarter 20051.3 Spring Quarter 2005
2 Academic Year 2005-06
2.1 Fall Quarter 20052.2 Winter Quarter 20062.3 Spring Quarter 2006
3 Academic Year 2006-07
3.1 Fall Quarter 20063.2 Winter Quarter 20073.3 Spring Quarter 2007




[edit] Academic Year 2004-05 
[edit] Fall Quarter 2004 
 09/24: Welcome event for new students
 10/01: Bill Tomlinson
 10/08: Rogerio de Paula
 10/15: Crista Lopes
 10/22: No talk (Joe Konstan ISR talk)
 10/29: Cleidson de Souza
 11:05: Simon Penny
 11:/12: Simon Cole
 11/19: Andre van der Hoek (also CalIT2 opening)
 11/26: Thanksgiving
 12/03: panel on interdisplinarity -- simon, bill, bonnie, susan
 12/10: No seminar, just happy hour

[edit] Winter Quarter 2005 
 01/07: Randy Black
 01/14: No talk (ISR Speaker: John Knight)
 01/21: Thomas Alspaugh
 01/28: No talk (ISR Speaker: Geof Bowker)
 02/04: Alladi Venkatesh
 02/11: No talk (ISR Speaker: Tom Moran)
 02/18: Gloria Mark
 02/25: Gayna Williams (Microsoft)
 03/04: Falko Kuester
 03/11: Paul Dourish
 03/18: Graduate student recruiting

[edit] Spring Quarter 2005 
 04/08: Chair's event
 04/15: Bonnie and Susan
 04/22: Thad Starner (Georgia Tech)
 04/29: David Obstfeld
 05/06: No talk (ISR speaker: Alex Wolf)
 05/13: Leo Whang
 05/20: (ICSE)
 05/27: Team XAR
 06/03: No talk (ISR Forum)
 06/10: Crista Lopes and Dick Taylor (on legal experiences)
 06/17: End-of-year event

[edit] Academic Year 2005-06 
[edit] Fall Quarter 2005 
 09/23: No event
 09/30: Discussion of student internships
 10/07: Walt Scacchi
 10/14: David Redmiles
 10/21: IBM visitors (4S)
 10/28: Kelly Garrett (UCSD CalIT2 opening)
 11/04: Beatriz da Costa
 11/11: No seminar -- Veterans' Day
 11/18: Paul Dourish
 11/25: No seminar -- Thanksgiving holiday
 12/02: Robert Nideffer (joint with CS)
 12/09: End of quarter event

[edit] Winter Quarter 2006 
 01/06: No seminar (welcome event)
 01/13: Julian Bleecker, USC
 01/20: Don Patterson
 01/27: Tatsuhiro Nishioka (tat@ics.uci.edu)
 02/03: Padhraic Smyth (joint with CS)
 02/10: Michael Curry, UCLA
 02/17: John-Sören Pettersson (Alfred hosting)
 02/24: No seminar (ISR distinguished speaker)
 03/03: Laura Dabbish?? (Paul in Atlanta)
 03/10: Crista Lopes (Calit2 STS event)
 03/17: No seminar (ISR Distinguished speaker)
 03/24: Grad student recruiting day

[edit] Spring Quarter 2006 
 04/07: Chancellor's Inauguration
 04/14: Clay Williams (IBM, Hadar/Debra hosting)
 04/21: No seminar (ISR Distinguished speaker; also CHI)
 04/28: No seminar (ISR Distinguished speaker; also CHI)
 05/05: Kane Kim (joint with CS)
 05/12: Tony Wasserman (Walt hosting)
 05/19: Frank Vahud and Susan Lysecky (UC Riverside, Crista hosting) 
 05/26: Tom Boellstorff
 06/02: No seminar (ISR Research Forum)
 06/09: Morana Alac (UC San Diego, Paul hosting)
 06/16: Kishore Swaminathan (Accenture, Debra hosting)

[edit] Academic Year 2006-07 
[edit] Fall Quarter 2006 
 09/22: Welcome event
 09/29: Alessandro Garcia (hosted by Crista)
 10/06: Gloria Mark
 10/13: Ricardo Morla (hosted by Crista)
 10/20: No talk (Steve Barley visit)
 10/27: Paulo Maurin (Roberta hosting)
 11/03: Susan Sim
 11/10: Veteran's Day holiday
 11/17: Matt Bietz
 11/24: No talk (Thanksgiving)
 12/01: Mark Poster
 12/08: John Hoskings (hosted by David)

[edit] Winter Quarter 2007 
 01/05: No talk (welcome reception)
 01/12: Thomas Herrmann
 01/19: Ken Anderson
 01/26: Thomas Alspaugh
 02/02: (book event)
 02/09: No speaker (John Canny in ISR series)
 02/16: Eric Klopfer (Bill hosting; no happy hour, faculty/student mixer in Bren Hall)
 02/23: No speaker (Brenda Laurel in ISR series)
 03/02: Werner Beuschel
 03/09: Andre van der Hoek
 03/16: Paul Dourish
 03/23: No speaker (grad recruiting day)

[edit] Spring Quarter 2007 
 04/06: Bill Tomlinson
 04/13: No speaker (Colin Ware speaking in ISR series)
 04/20: Amaya Becvar
 04/27: No speaker (Hiroshi Ishii speaking in ISR series)
 05/04: Aerospace visitors [people away for CHI?]
 05/11: Gloria Mark
 05/18: No speaker (Jeff Magee speaking in ISR series)
 05/25: ---- [people away for ICSE?]
 06/01: No speaker (ISR Research Forum)
 06/08: Gilad Ravid (Gloria hosting)
 06/15: Karen Baker? (Susan hosting)

 was encoded in the href/request

equals(SharingLevel) - 
Method in class swirl.workspace.viz.SharingLevel
DOCUMENT ME!
execute() - 
Method in class swirl.workspace.AggregateCommand
Generic implementation of execute that performs the following steps

 
 
 1. sets the response headers
 
 
 2. gets the peers to proxy to
 
 
 3. initializes a response document
 
 
 4. for each target peer
 
 
 4.1. creates an HttpMethod to send to the peer
 
 
 4.2. executes the HttpMethod
 
 
 4.3. processes and/or mangles the response
 
 
 4.4. adds the peer's response to the client's response
 
 
 5. sends the response back to the client
 
 
execute() - 
Method in class swirl.workspace.ProxyCommand
Figures out which peer to proxy to and sends them a request based on the
 createMethod() hook
execute() - 
Method in interface swirl.workspace.SwirlCommand
Implement this method to handle requests from the client.

Package swirl.workspace.messages



Interface SummaryMessageProcessorPerforms an action or command based on a message from the messaging service
 Most messages will come through a MessageReceiver objectMessageReceiverAny messaging infrastructure that swirl uses must implement this interface to be
 incorporated into swirl.MessageSenderTODORMIRegistrySimple Interface for an RMIRegistry implementationYanceesConfigDOCUMENT ME!
 




Class SummaryLoggingFilterFilter that logs a request and then passes throughNullMessageSenderDOCUMENT ME!RMIRegistryImplDOCUMENT ME!RMIRegistryImpl2 YanceesConfigImplDOCUMENT ME!YanceesMessageReceiverDOCUMENT ME!YanceesMessageSenderDOCUMENT ME!YanceesServerDOCUMENT ME!

Package swirl.workspace



Interface SummaryHostPathCodecDOCUMENT ME!PeerFinderDOCUMENT ME!PeerManagerListenerDOCUMENT ME!ResourceUpdateListener SwirlCommandBase interface for all Commands to proxied servers
 




Class SummaryAggregateCommandThis command is a base class for commands that proxy multiple DAV servers
 and aggregate their responses to send back to the clientAppTODO - make sure test cases succeed TODO - make sure it works on mac with
 multiple peers TODO - plan out what groups areBasePeerDOCUMENT ME!BaseSwirlCommandAn abstract base class that other SwirlCommands can extend with some basic
 functionalityConfigurationTODOCopyCommandProxies an WebDAV COPY command to a specific peerDeleteCommandRemove an object or collection from the workspaceFileNodeDOCUMENT ME!GetCommandProxies an HTTP GET method to a specific peerHeadCommandProxies an HTTP HEAD request which is essentially a GET request without the
 body (just the headers).HostPathCodecImplDOCUMENT ME!JmDNSPeerDOCUMENT ME!JmDNSPeerFinderDOCUMENT ME!LockCommandProxies an WebDAV LOCK command to a specific peerLookupCodecDOCUMENT ME!MePeerFinderDOCUMENT ME!MkcolCommandProxies an WebDAV MKCOL command to a specific peerMoveCommandProxies an WebDAV MOVE command to a specific peerOptionsCommandProxies an OPTION request to a peerOurPropPatchMethod PeerDOCUMENT ME!PeerManagerMaintains list of known peers for application and manages message
 information about their joining and leavingPeerTableModelAn adapter between the swirl model and a JTablePropertiesContainerBuilderDOCUMENT ME!PropfindCommandTODOProppatchCommandImplements the PROPPATCH methodProxyCommandAbstract base class for commands that proxy to only one peer. PutCommandSends a PUT method to the peerQuerystringCodecDOCUMENT ME!ResourceUpdateFilterFilter that listens for sucessfull updates to swirl resources and maintains a list of modified resources.SlideUserRealmBuilds a jetty user realm based on the configuration stored in the slide
 Domain.xml fileSwirlProxyThis is the hub of the servlet application.  UnlockCommandProxies an WebDAV UNLOCK command to a specific peerWrappedResponse

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
API Help (Swirl WebDAV Workspace 0.20 API)
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
Overview     Package     Class     Use     Tree     Deprecated     Index   Help 



 PREV 
 NEXT

  All Classes









How This API Document Is Organized

This API (Application Programming Interface) document has pages corresponding to the items in the navigation bar, described as follows.
Overview



The Overview page is the front page of this API document and provides a list of all packages with a summary for each.  This page can also contain an overall description of the set of packages.

Package



Each package has a page that contains a list of its classes and interfaces, with a summary for each. This page can contain four categories:Interfaces (italic)ClassesExceptionsErrors


Class/Interface



Each class, interface, nested class and nested interface has its own separate page. Each of these pages has three sections consisting of a class/interface description, summary tables, and detailed member descriptions:Class inheritance diagramDirect SubclassesAll Known SubinterfacesAll Known Implementing ClassesClass/interface declarationClass/interface description

Nested Class SummaryField SummaryConstructor SummaryMethod Summary

Field DetailConstructor DetailMethod Detail
Each summary entry contains the first sentence from the detailed description for that item. The summary entries are alphabetical, while the detailed descriptions are in the order they appear in the source code. This preserves the logical groupings established by the programmer.

Use

Each documented package, class and interface has its own Use page.  This page describes what packages, classes, methods, constructors and fields use any part of the given class or package. Given a class or interface A, its Use page includes subclasses of A, fields declared as A, methods that return A, and methods and constructors with parameters of type A.  You can access this page by first going to the package, class or interface, then clicking on the "Use" link in the navigation bar.

Tree (Class Hierarchy)

There is a Class Hierarchy page for all packages, plus a hierarchy for each package. Each hierarchy page contains a list of classes and a list of interfaces. The classes are organized by inheritance structure starting with java.lang.Object. The interfaces do not inherit from java.lang.Object.When viewing the Overview page, clicking on "Tree" displays the hierarchy for all packages.When viewing a particular package, class or interface page, clicking "Tree" displays the hierarchy for only that package.


Deprecated API

The Deprecated API page lists all of the API that have been deprecated. A deprecated API is not recommended for use, generally due to improvements, and a replacement API is usually given. Deprecated APIs may be removed in future implementations.

Index

The Index contains an alphabetic list of all classes, interfaces, constructors, methods, and fields.

Prev/Next
These links take you to the next or previous class, interface, package, or related page.
Frames/No Frames
These links show and hide the HTML frames.  All pages are available with or without frames.


Serialized Form
Each serializable or externalizable class has a description of its serialization fields and methods. This information is of interest to re-implementors, not to developers using the API. While there is no link in the navigation bar, you can get to this information by going to any serialized class and clicking "Serialized Form" in the "See also" section of the class description.



This help file applies to API documentation generated using the standard doclet.

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
swirl.workspace.viz.pie.actions (Swirl WebDAV Workspace 0.20 API)
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
swirl.workspace.viz.pie.actions

Classes

decodeHost

public String decodeHost()
Retrieves the host from an application level lookup table.  If it is not
 in the table, returns ""

Specified by:decodeHost in interface HostPathCodec
Returns:the host the client is proxied to

swirl.workspace

Class Peer

java.lang.Object
  swirl.workspace.Peer

All Implemented Interfaces: org.picocontainer.Startable
Direct Known Subclasses: BasePeer, DNSSDPeer, JmDNSPeer

public abstract class Peerextends Objectimplements org.picocontainer.Startable


DOCUMENT ME!



Author:bpillet Base class for peers to extend.  Represents a peer in the
         swirl network and manages connecting to the server and executing
         methods on the server.










Field Summary
static intMAX_RETRIES


          how many times the peer tries to execute a method before it gives up
 




Constructor SummaryPeer()


           
 




Method Summary
 voidaddMessageSender(MessageSender l)


          Register a listener for Messages
 intexecuteHttpRequestMethod(HttpMethod method)


          Execute a method on the server behind this peer
 intexecuteHttpRequestMethod(HttpMethod method,
                         Coordinate coord)


          Execute a method on the server behind this peer
 intexecuteHttpRequestMethodLogPrivate(HttpMethod method)


          Execute a method on the server behind this peer
 intexecuteHttpRequestMethodLogPrivate(HttpMethod method,
                                   Coordinate coord)


          Execute a method on the server behind this peer
 intexecuteHttpRequestMethodWithoutLog(HttpMethod method)


          Execute a method on the server behind this peer
abstract  ColorgetColor()


          Get the globally unique color for this peer
 StringgetHost()


          Get the host for this peer
abstract  HttpURLgetHttpURL()


          Each peer needs to figure out how to connect based on different locating

swirl.workspace.messages

Interface MessageReceiver
All Known Implementing Classes: YanceesMessageReceiver

public interface MessageReceiver


Any messaging infrastructure that swirl uses must implement this interface to be
 incorporated into swirl.



Version:$Revision: 1.4 $Author:bpilletSee Also:MessageSender, 
MessageProcessor
















Method Summary
 voidreceiveMessage(Map msg)


          Receive a message as a set of key/value pairs and pass the message on to
 all of the MessageProcessor objects

swirl.workspace

Class BaseSwirlCommand

java.lang.Object
  swirl.workspace.BaseSwirlCommand

All Implemented Interfaces: SwirlCommand
Direct Known Subclasses: AggregateCommand, ProxyCommand

public abstract class BaseSwirlCommandextends Objectimplements SwirlCommand


An abstract base class that other SwirlCommands can extend with some basic
 functionality



Author:Ben Pillet

swirl.workspace

Class ProxyCommand

java.lang.Object
  swirl.workspace.BaseSwirlCommand
      swirl.workspace.ProxyCommand

All Implemented Interfaces: SwirlCommand
Direct Known Subclasses: CopyCommand, DeleteCommand, GetCommand, HeadCommand, LockCommand, MkcolCommand, MoveCommand, OptionsCommand, ProppatchCommand, PutCommand, UnlockCommand

public abstract class ProxyCommandextends BaseSwirlCommand


Abstract base class for commands that proxy to only one peer. All the child
 has to do is implement createMethod to customize what to send and this
 class will do the rest



Author:bpillet










Field Summary
 
Fields inherited from interface swirl.workspace.SwirlCommandSLIDE, SWIRL

createMethod

public abstract HttpMethod createMethod(String url)
Hook for subclasses to make this Command send a specific method

Parameters:url - the url to the server
Returns:an initialized HTTP Method




execute

public int execute()
            throws Exception
Figures out which peer to proxy to and sends them a request based on the
 createMethod() hook

Returns:the status code from the server
Throws:
Exception - if there's a problem proxying




modifyServerResponseDocument

protected Document modifyServerResponseDocument(Document serverResponseBody)
                                         throws DocumentException
change any references to slide to swirl so that the client doesn't see
 slide at all

Parameters:serverResponseBody - the response from the server to change
Returns:and document to send back to the client
Throws:
DocumentException - if there's a problem reading the response

 path will be to an underlying slide server on the peer

Constructor SummaryHostPathCodecImpl(String servPath)


          Constructs a new codec given the requested path from the client and the
 path of the swirl servlet

 
 
 POST /some/path.html HTTP/1.1
 
 /some/path.html
 
 
 GET http://foo.bar/a.html HTTP/1.0
 
 /a.html
 
 
 HEAD /xyz?

Constructor Detail


HostPathCodecImpl

public HostPathCodecImpl(String servPath)
Constructs a new codec given the requested path from the client and the
 path of the swirl servlet

 
 POST /some/path.html HTTP/1.1
 
 /some/path.html
 
 GET http://foo.bar/a.html HTTP/1.0
 
 /a.html
 
 HEAD /xyz?a=b HTTP/1.1
 
 /xyz
 

Parameters:servPath - the path of the swirl servlet





Method Detail


decodeHost

public String decodeHost()
Extract the peer host from a uri that has a peer hostname encoded in it.
 If no host is encoded, this method will return ""

Specified by:decodeHost in interface HostPathCodec
Returns:the actual host of the peer




decodePath

public String decodePath()
Extract the path from a uri that has a peer hostname encoded in it. The
 path will be to an underlying slide server on the peer

Specified by:decodePath in interface HostPathCodec
Returns:the actual path on the peer




encodeHostInPath

public String encodeHostInPath(String href,
                               String encodeHost)
Utility method that encodes a host URL in an href. The format is
 /the_href/some.file_on_host

Specified by:encodeHostInPath in interface HostPathCodec
Parameters:href - the href to hide the host inencodeHost - the peer to get the host from
Returns:the encoded href

swirl.workspace

Class WrappedResponse

java.lang.Object
  swirl.workspace.WrappedResponse

All Implemented Interfaces: HttpServletResponse, ServletResponse

public class WrappedResponseextends Objectimplements HttpServletResponse


Author:Kari
 
 This wrapper for HttpServletResponse keeps track of the return status.
 
 To change the template for this generated type comment go to
 Window>Preferences>Java>Code Generation>Code and Comments

swirl.workspace

Interface HostPathCodec
All Known Implementing Classes: HostPathCodecImpl, LookupCodec, QuerystringCodec

public interface HostPathCodec


DOCUMENT ME!



Author:bpillet
















Method Summary
 StringdecodeHost()


          assuming the implementation of this codec has access to the client's
 request or the requested href, this method will figure out which peer
 was encoded in the href/request
 StringdecodePath()


          assuming the implementation of this codec has access to the client's
 request or the requested href, this method will figure out the path on
 the peer to proxy to, often replacing "/swirl" with "/slide"
 StringencodeHostInPath(String href,
                 String encodeHost)


          Mangle the href and/or the request in a response to the client so that
 when the client accesses the href again, the proxy will know which peer
 to proxy to
 












Method Detail


decodeHost

public String decodeHost()
assuming the implementation of this codec has access to the client's
 request or the requested href, this method will figure out which peer
 was encoded in the href/request

Returns:the peer to proxy to




decodePath

public String decodePath()
assuming the implementation of this codec has access to the client's
 request or the requested href, this method will figure out the path on
 the peer to proxy to, often replacing "/swirl" with "/slide"

Returns:the peer to proxy to




encodeHostInPath

public String encodeHostInPath(String href,
                               String encodeHost)
Mangle the href and/or the request in a response to the client so that
 when the client accesses the href again, the proxy will know which peer
 to proxy to

Parameters:href - the href to mangleencodeHost - the peer it belongs to
Returns:the new href

Class WebDAVVisualization

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              swirl.workspace.viz.BaseVisualizer
                  swirl.workspace.viz.WebDAVVisualization

All Implemented Interfaces: ActionListener, Controller, EventListener, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, MessageProcessor, ModelListener, Serializable, org.picocontainer.Startable, View, Visualizer, WindowListener

public class WebDAVVisualizationextends BaseVisualizerimplements Controller, MessageProcessor


WebDAV visualization. This class displays the WebDAV accesses between Swirl
 servers. Display is done through JUNG.



See Also:Serialized Form

swirl.workspace.viz

Class SwirlNeighbor

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              swirl.workspace.viz.BaseVisualizer
                  swirl.workspace.viz.SwirlNeighbor

All Implemented Interfaces: ActionListener, Controller, EventListener, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, ModelListener, Serializable, javax.jmdns.ServiceListener, javax.jmdns.ServiceTypeListener, org.picocontainer.Startable, View, Visualizer, WindowListener

public class SwirlNeighborextends BaseVisualizerimplements javax.jmdns.ServiceListener, javax.jmdns.ServiceTypeListener, Controller


SwirlNeighbor visualization. This class displays the Swirl Neighbors and
 non-Swirl Neighbors. Neighbors are discovered through JmDNS. Display is
 done through JUNG.



See Also:Serialized Form
